Project Description: Madrona community residents will restore up to   1.5 acres of the SE corner of the Madrona Woods property by removing invasive plants and replacing them with native plants. Other clean up efforts will improve the safety of the trailhead entrance across from the Spectrum Dance Studio.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Magnolia residents will build the first 30 plots of the P-Patch at Magnolia Manor Park. Funds will be used for grading and site prep and community volunteers will install garden beds, compost bins, and a shed along with buffer plantings.  The garden will meet a community need and will serve as a focal point for the neighborhood.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Friends of Seward Park and community supporters are applying for a planning grant to fund a community engagement process for restoring the 25 foot torii or Japanese gate that stood at the entrance to Seward Park for 50 years prior to its removal in 1986.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: 19th & Madison Park represents the convergence of local residents in both affordable & transitional housing, nonprofit organizations, a historical Black church and members of the Deaf and Deaf-Blind communities who receive services and work in the neighborhood. The goal is to implement a community engagement process that results in a design for a fully accessible,art filled, sustainable park for  people of all abilities.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Friends of Federal and Republican Open Space
Project Description: This project continues the work with design consultants and the community on the development of the open space at Federal Ave E & E Republican. This phase will result in the completion of the construction documents.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Improving Heron Viewing in Kiwanis Ravine
Project Description:
Heron Habitat Helpers(HHH) will pursue improving knowledge of the Kiwanis Memorial Preserve Park and opportunities for heron viewing by hire of a consultant to develop a plan for improving knowledge of the Kiwanis Memorial Preserve Park,opportunities for the public to participate and/or volunteer with HHH, and heron viewing and interpretation. The work will include:  
1.Research and development of a neighborhood citizen monitoring program to track herons. 
2.Improving the “heron cam” system already in place (www.heronhelpers.org)
3.Improving interpretation at two proposed visitor center viewing stations.
4. Recommendations for marketing the heron cam with social networking strategies.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Public Safety for Danny Woo ID Community Garden
Project Description: Our project will address environmental and safety concerns at the Danny Woo Garden by replacing two key features that have deteriorated over time. A major wall in the Garden is near collapse, creating an unsafe environment for visitors, employees and gardeners and increasing the risk for soil erosion. In addition, we intend to construct a ramp and stairs to replace a staircase that is unsuitable to walk on and in dire need of repairs.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Peoples Family Life Center: Work-It-Out Seattle
Project Description: Work It Out Seattle will host a community-wide WIO Job Fair on August 4, 2012 for unemployed and underemployed people reflective of community demographics including veterans, seniors, young adults and teens coming together to meet diverse employers.  A follow-up survey will be conducted to evaluate the effectiveness of the event.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Roosevelt Bull Moose festival will be held on Saturday, July 28, 2012 from 11am to 7pm.  The festival will be the 8th Annual celebration for residents, businesses and stakeholders in the Roosevelt Neighborhood and surrounding communities.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Steering Committee of the View Ridge Playground Project will hire a consultant to facilitate a community engagement process to develop a master plan for the improvement of the play areas on the west side of the school. This space is highly utilized by View Ridge families and is an important community gathering spot.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This project will expand the Roxhill Park playground with new elements that will create more resources for an underserved community in Delridge. The new elements will include a climbing and physical challenge course.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Designed in response to neighborhood feedback, the Lake Union Park Ambassadors will connect residents of the neighborhoods surrounding Lake Union Park to the park and the activities it hosts. Volunteer Park Ambassadors will provide visitors with a friendly welcome and information about the park and neighborhood, as well as directions, advice, and personal stories.  Online information tools will be developed including an online map and website.  The Park Ambassadors will also create exciting new opportunities for neighbors to get involved with their community and host a `Neighbor Day` event to publicize this new service.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Lewis Park Steering Committee will hire a landscape architect who will facilitate a public process to engage the community in planning the next phase of the Lewis Park Natural Area.  This public process will result in a landscape plan with several options designed to meet the goal of fostering long-term community stewardship of Lewis Park Natural Area.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Sacajawea Elementary School community will continue their community design process for  improvements identified in the Master Plan for the redevelopment of the upper playground and adjacent park. The focus of this project, Phase I, will be the completion of design development for the wetlands and playscape areas.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: South Park Lucha Libre & Cultural Event
Project Description: On July 7, a community collaboration between the Environmental Coalition of South Seattle (ECOSS), South Park Arts (Sparts), and the South Park Promotores will host a Latino-focused cultural event, Lucha Libre which features Mexican wrestling. The project includes an education element at the South Park Library prior to the event and local artists and area youth performers will be featured. Youth will be invited to create their own Lucha Libre masks.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Fremont - From Timber to Troll involves current and past residents, neighborhood organizations and schools. The project consists of a historical, living history video, historical exhibits, and the creation of the Fremont Community Youth Action Committee that will allow local youth the opportunity to work with adults to help shape the future of Fremont.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Funding will be used for outreach, marketing, events, and clearing the site in preparation for construction of a community garden.  Funds will also be used for purchase/construction of a shed and garden tools.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Show four free, PG-13, PG, or G rated, family-friendly outdoor movie screenings in Cal Anderson Park taking place on Friday, July 27, August 3, August 10 and August 17.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: LGBT Community Outreach and Programming Study
Project Description: Members of the LGBT community on Capitol Hill will conduct a needs assessment process for the development of a community center.  They will assess needs, gaps in service, space requirements and inter-organizational collaboration and co-location feasibility.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The goal of this project is to increase emergency preparedness efforts within the East African community of southeast Seattle.  This will include training, distribution of emergency kits and assistance in developing a family emergency plan.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The NewHolly Disaster Preparedness project will develop the readiness of NewHolly immigrant and refugee families and the community as a whole for emergencies. The project will offer disaster preperedness trainings and distribute 125 family kits for those in attendence.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Improvements to the Gay City Auditorium include a tech booth and lighting grid, installing lighting, sound and projection systems, and purchasing chairs and risers. The goal is to encourage more community theatre and arts activities in the newly improved space.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Dia de Muertos, at Seattle Center
Organization Name: Taller Mexicano para la Cultura y las Artes TMCA
Project Description: Community members, especially Latino youth, will  organize and produce a Dia de Muertos (Day of the Dead) celebration at Seattle Center, 305 Harrison Street, on Saturday and Sunday, October 27th and 28th.  The authentic cultural and artistic expressions characteristic of this celebration will be presented with a special emphasis on  activities and learning opportunities for youth.  This tradition deeply emphasizes the emotional connection with loved ones and the historical representation of Mexican culture in our community.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The PUSH ARTS NEW MEDIA FESTIVAL is an all-access free event on August 24th and 25th in the South Lake Union community that celebrates experimental media and contemporary art. They will partner with neighboring organizations to curate 15 installation pieces and interactive performance pieces.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Music is my life: Art by homeless young people
Project Description: The Music is My Life project covers the preparation and execution of a show of art work by homeless young people. Homeless youth requested that their drawings and stories be included in a public art show to be held at Molly's Café/Henry Art Gallery.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The High Point Neighborhood Association (HPNA) and partners will expand the Commons Park P-Patch  to include an educational beehive enclosure (apiary) and pollination garden. This project will provide educational opportunities  and a place to host gatherings.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Renovation and Expansion of Nagomi Tea House
Project Description: The Hokubei Hochi Foundation is proposing to relocate and renovate the Nagomi Tea House in order to further the understanding and appreciation of Japanese arts and culture through educational projects and events.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The project will ready residents and businesses in Lake City neighborhoods to prepare  for an emergency by promoting awareness and individual/family-based/neighborhood disaster readiness, and will develop and stock a Communication HUB in the Lake City Fred Meyer parking lot.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Sand Point Community Garden and Playground Project
Project Description: The Sand Point Elementary PTA will begin a second phase of site development and playground enhancements.  SPE PTA will add (in two phases) 4-6 additional playground area structures to provide more play opportunities for students and children in the community.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Storefronts Belltown project will activate our streetscape with short-term pop-up storefront art projects.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Friends of NAS Seattle Historic District
Project Description: The goal of this project is to interview and record the lives of people who lived or worked on Naval Air Station Seattle during its early history. A travelling exhibit of their stories will be created.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Friends of South Park Community Kitchen
Project Description: The South Park Community Kitchen will allow for residents to cook a communal meal, discuss nutrition and learn about healthy lifestyles. Kitchens will be open to all South Park residents, free of charge, be multi-lingual, and use produce supplied by Marra Farm.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Fun and Fit University Playground Project
Project Description: The Fun and Fit University Playground Improvement Project encourages activities in the park by installing a teen/adult fitness area, promoting safe and healthy activities, and promoting expanded usability of the park using CPTED strategies.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The non-profit International Examiner seeks funding to identify, catalog and make available to the public its 2000+ photographic images from the past 40 years of history in the International District.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This project will develop and implement a plan for emergency and disaster preparedness, including training, disaster kits and supplies for 126 staff, residents, on-site volunteers, on-site clients and neighbors of Jubilee Women's Center.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This project will build community by bringing together neighbors and businesses to create artwork in the city.  The project will issue a call for artists and solicit input from the community at large to design, install, and maintain a  mural in the North 63rd Street and Aurora underpass.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Seal Sitters will build a more connected West Seattle Community and remind us ‘to share the shore’ and protect marine mammals by launching the 'Year of the Seal' in 2013. The culmination will be 'Harbor Seal Day' with the official unveiling of a seal sculpture on Alki Beach.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The project will use funds to hire a consultant to work with the P-Patch gardeners and neighbors to create a plan for improvements  at the Greenwood P-Patch.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Madison Valley Community Council and Merchants Association will plan and design a neighborhood landmark sign on a large traffic triangle at East Madison St and 28th Ave East, the heart of our district. Plans may include a Madison Valley sign, landscaping, a means to advertise seasonal events, and possible installation of a walkway or art elements.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Young Workers in the Green Economy
Project Description: The Young Workers in the Green Economy project proposes to use the leadership of young adult workers between ages 18-35 from low income backgrounds and communities of color to address the issues of jobs and employment.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Ethiopian Community in Seattle (ECS) proposes to offer computer literacy/instruction and open-lab opportunities that will include instruction given in Amharic, Tigrigna and Oromo. Classes will be offered on-site at the ECS for seniors, adults, and youth.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Equipment for 5-12 yr olds at Laurelhurst Park
Organization Name: Play it Safe at Laurelhurst Park
Project Description: New ADA compliant play equipment designed for 5-12 year olds will be purchased and installed at Laurelhurst Park, an important gathering space for the community.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Arts in Nature Festival is a free, all ages, community celebration that encompasses live music, dance, performances, hands-on arts and naturalist activities, a Species Parade with a marching band, a `museum of sound` in 8 rustic cabins with sound and visual art installations, and food & drink. It is scheduled for Saturday, August 10 & Sunday, August 11, 2013 at Camp Long. The event aims to accomplish Nature Consortium's mission to connect people, arts and nature.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Next Steps on the Path to Magnolia Manor Park
Project Description: Work with consultant on design development for Magnolia Manor Park. This Project is located in Magnolia Park.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Belltown BIA Outreach and Education Campaign
Project Description: For much of the past year, the Belltown Business Association (BBA) has conducted analysis and discussion on the possible benefits of joining the Metropolitan Improvement District, an opportunity only provided during their 5 year renewal process. This project will provide outreach and education to Belltown residents and potential ratepayers to inform them of the benefits of MID membership, and assist the BBA in the process necessary to join the MID.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Planned improvements at the Snoqualmie P-Patch including a new fence and entryway will make the site more accessible and attractive.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Asian Pacific Islander Workers' History Project
Organization Name: Asian Pacific American Labor Alliance - Seattle
Project Description: The contributions of low wage Asian Pacific Islanders to the economic and social life of Seattle will be captured in a traveling photo exhibit.  A total of fifteen stories will be highlighted. A community-wide celebration is planned once the exhibit has been completed.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Expand and promote the existing Blitz Arts Walk through a website upgrade, promotional signage for venues and connecting community members as actively participating volunteers.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Chinatown International District Business Improvement Area (CIDBIA) seeks to add translated street signs in Chinese and Japanese within the boundaries of Seattle's Chinatown and Japantown neighborhoods.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Emergency Preparedness in the Central District
Project Description: Community residents and students from Garfield High School will partner with the Central Area Senior Center to identify vulnerable seniors who will then receive emergency preparedness training and disaster kits.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: `Boogie Up the Block` is a free two-day Urban arts festival in the Squire Park neighborhood of the historic Central District.  With an aim to engage and strengthen the community through music, dance, entertainment and various activies for all ages. The event will be held July 27 & 28, 2013 from 12:00pm to 8:00pm each day.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: José Martí Child Development Center Renovation
Project Description: This project will provide a series of much needed renovations to the José Martí Child Development Center (JMCDC), bringing it up to the structural, seismic and aesthetic standards of El Centro's upcoming JMCDC expansion/development project.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Friend’s of Kirke Park plan to complete the park’s “living room” trellis. The trellis was designed through community input to serve as a focal point for neighbors coming together and will serve as a community gathering point.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Rainier Valley Math and Science Tutoring
Project Description: A free math and science drop-in tutoring center for 20 students ages 8 through 18 will be developed and implemented. Along with tutoring there will be guest speakers and fun events to demonstrate how math and science are used in everyday life.  The focus will be an  interactive, hands on approach to learning.  The center will operate each Saturday beginning January 12th from 11:00 am until 2:00 pm, at 2720 South Hanford Street.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: A series of 4 events will be held throughout the year that will focus on and strengthen the  relationships between fathers and sons.  This will be accomplished  through social and educational activities. The events will include speakers, food, entertainment, and networking.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Friends of Schmitz Park will hire a professional crew to assist with habitat restoration. Some of the park is too steep for volunteers to safely do the work so professionals and their equipment are needed. Match will be provided with community volunteer work parties where the park terrain is not as challenging.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Wing Luke Museum of the Asian Pacific American Experience
Project Description: The Wing Museum proposes a new exhibit in 2013: `Beyond Talk 2` that will explore race and racism with a focus on youth voices and intergenerational conversations.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Phase II will expand the use of ‘Freeway Estates Community Orchard’ through a community driven design process, working with a consultant to help neighbors identify potential uses for the site.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The intersection painting project at 4th Avenue NE and NE 60th Street will be used as a vehicle for building community and slowing traffic in the neighborhood. A dragonfly will be painted which will be about 90' tall and 130' wide, in green, blue, yellow, black, and white.  Funds will be used to buy paint, a spill kit, rollers and other painting supplies, and to pay for a construction street use permit and the required street inspection.  Painting will take place on August 31 and September 1, 2013.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Five Ballard Emergency Communication Hubs will have storage job boxes on site and equipment, such as canopies, tables, chairs, and radios, as well as brochures and information cards to educate local neighbors. Materials stored in the boxes will be readily available for trained volunteers to set up in the event of an emergency.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: As a companion to the red and yellow koi fish and dragonfly columns on Jackson Street, twenty-two King Street columns under I-5 will be painted in a contrasting blue and green color depicting waves in a classical Asian form.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Fiestas Patrias is a two-day cultural festival on September 14 & 15 which offers performances, health fairs, children’s activities and education. The event celebrates the richness of Latin American cultures and traditions, highlighting local and well-known artists, crafts, music, dance and food.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Peoples Family Life Center: Work-It-Out Seattle
Project Description: Produce a Central District Community Street Fair that celebrates the values and richness of the diversity in the community.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The PTSA will work with the local community and hire a designer to help us create a visioning (concept) plan for the school grounds.  The plan will focus on making improvements based on the interests of the school, the PTSA and the local community.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Broadway High School Video History Project
Project Description: This project will capture in a video, the history, memories, and memorabilia of Broadway High School, Seattle's first high school that eventually became Seattle Central Community College.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Our goal is to implement the landscape design developed in 2012. This grant request covers acquiring plants, clearing, planting, and mulching the hillside according to the landscape design and SDOT specifications, and acquiring and installing a temporary water tank and irrigation hosing.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Interim Youth Basketball for 33rd Ave NE Park Site
Project Description: Create a `pick up` basketball court on the Parks and Recreation Department owned property on 33rd Ave NE directly south of the Lake City Court SHA housing for Lake City youth and teens to play on.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Construction of the Broadway Hill Park P-Patch
Organization Name: The Townships Garden P-patch at Broadway Hill Park
Project Description: Improvements to the site include regrading the northern portion of the park and the construction of the Broadway Hill Park P-Patch according to a design that was developed through a public engagement process and the consultant, Site Workshop.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Community Reader Boards For Leschi Elementary
Project Description: Two reader boards will be installed to provide information and help improve communication amongst the Leschi Elementary school community and with the surrounding neighborhoods. The reader board signs will allow groups to post messages about events, functions, celebrations and requests for support at the school and within the community.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Tibet Fest will showcase the unique Tibetan culture during a part of the Seattle Center's Festal program.  We will have unique cultural artists and performances. We also purchased yak and Tibetan snowlion costumes for dances, symbolic of Tibetan culture and enhance performances. The festival will be held Augsut 24-25, 2013 and will be a great opportunity to educate the larger community.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: A monthly dinner will be held which will create opportunities for all neighbors to share recipes, cooking techniques, nutritional knowledge, and consensus leadership, while sharing the resulting food and fellowship among our diverse community. Funding will be used for outreach, room rental,  interpretation services, and supplies to support the monthly dinners.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Eritreans Take a Stand Project seeks to make vital building improvements to the Eritrean Association of Greater Seattle Community Center at 1528 Valentine Place South. The improvements will include resurfaced floors and a repainting of the Gathering Hall interior and exterior wall surfaces and the building will become more useful to the greater community.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: José Martí Child Dev. Center Renovation Phase 2
Project Description: Phase 2 of the José Martí Child Development Center (JMCDC) will complete renovations by modernizing and bringing facilities up to current safety and cosmetic standards. The project will focus on the community gathering space in the center, signage, classroom ceilings and light fixtures, and office spaces in JMCDC.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This project would provide additional improvements that include a pavilion, tool shed, entry way gate, park benches, and a three bin compost system. The new features will benefit the community by providing new gathering space opportunities for seniors,youth from Rainier View elementary and Rainier Beach High schools.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The NE Seattle Tool Library provides community access to a wide variety of tools, training and advice. Funds will be used to hire a staff person and for stocking and purchase of tools to increase the services available to the community.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: AGE UP Young Men's Leadership Project
Organization Name: All Girl Everything Ultimate Program (AGE UP)
Project Description: AGE UP is an empowerment-based community-building program for teen girls and boys in South Seattle that engages them in leadership skills, critical awareness, healthy habits, and positive identity. This project will create a parallel program for boys that supports their development into thoughtful, skilled, and motivated young men.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Clean and Safe Committee of the U-District  Partnership (UDP)
Project Description: Implement a program powered by local homeless street youth as a workforce, overseen by University of Washington interns and directed by local service providers.  The goal of this project is to promote workplace integration for homeless street youth by providing them simple job tasks such as garbage collection and graffiti removal in exchange for compensation.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Rejuvenate the existing Laurelhurst Elementary Peace Garden, dedicated in June 1997 to Aki Kurose, beloved teacher and peace activist. The project will improve the functionality of this green space through restoration and the addition of new elements that reflect Aki Kurose's ideals about non-violence and peace.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Trans Pride will be a celebration of Seattle's trans community in conjunction with annual LGBTQ pride events on June 28, 2013. It will include Seattle's first Trans Pride march, nationally-renowned speakers, and a variety of community groups doing outreach and tabling.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This endeavor will enhance the play areas on the west side of View Ridge Elementary. Improvements include drainage work, an ADA approved entry ramp and a new play structure and surface.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Orca K-8 is an alternative public school located in the Hillman City neighborhood – with close ties and associations to the Seward Park, Lakewood, and Columbia City communities—of Seattle’s Rainier Valley. Funds will be used to hire a consultant to facilitate a public process to create a concept plan for the entire site including the playground and field.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Backyard Barter will host an Urban Food Fair in Fall 2013 to be a celebration of all that is homegrown and homemade and a chance to enlarge our community of barter enthusiasts. The Urban Food Fair will be a day of fun featuring a barter of homegrown and homemade food; workshops about sustainable gardening, urban farming and related topics; a jam judging contest; a pie judging contest; food focused games; a raffle of prizes donated by local artists and businesses; food; music; kids’ activities and more.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: In partnership with Urban Artworks, U-District Livability Partnership, and local business owners, the Sanctuary Art Center (SAC) will lead a process to create a community-vetted mural on J's Market on the SW corner of University Way and 50th St. NE.  The North Ave Mural serves to beautify and activate an area that has one of U-District's crime hotspots.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Friends of Lewis Park are continuing their community driven effort to restore the park.  This phase includes additional design services, a geotechnical survey and a public meeting.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Planning Stage: Afro-Latino Arts Education Season
Project Description: This project comprises the planning stage of a larger project focused on the dance, music and legacy of the Afro-Latino Diaspora. Various community artist leaders will come together to plan an authentic season of educational and artistic programs at Langston Hughes Performing Arts Institute.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Indigenous Cultures Day (ICD), a free Festa'l event, occurs at the Seattle Center on Saturday, August 17, 2013. ICD features both modern and traditional performances by indigenous people from around the world, showcased on at least two stages. The festival celebrates with art, music, food, dance, poetry and exercises, which connect us, preserve cultures and promote community partnering.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Hopscotch CD is a 1.8 mile temporary hopscotch course chalked onto sidewalks across the Central District, from the Jackson Business Corridor, following the Central Seattle Greenways route via 20th/19th/18th to the Union Street Business Corridor. The event takes place on June 1, 2013.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This project will design and construct an outdoor gathering space, adjacent to the Iu Mien Community Center at 3925 South Bozeman Street, for Elders to foster and share storytelling, handicraft, culinary traditions, encourage intergenerational and community wide interaction through design workshops, creation of public art and site work parties.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Funding will be used to help support creation of a permanent sound sculpture at the Seattle Children’s PlayGarden by Seattle resident, Trimpin, to be called “A Musical Fence.” Trimpin is an internationally renowned kinetic sculptor, musician, engineer, sound artist, and MacArthur Fellow. The PlayGarden, located at Colman Playfield, is the only program of its kind in the country located in a public park. The beautiful gardens and play equipment are heavily used by neighborhood residents.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Native Youth Performing Arts Festival at EMP
Project Description: A Native Youth Performing Arts project is a 2 week performing arts camp and final performance. The camp is scheduled from August 5-16, 2013 at Daybreak Star. Youth will be lead by teaching artists in native storytelling and native drama production. The youth will present their final performance at Indigenous Cultures Day on August 17, 2013 at the Seattle Center. A showcase of traditional and contemporary performing arts Native youth talent, including a musical theatre production by Red Eagle Soaring – engaging audience and participants alike in cultural community building, bringing diverse audiences into a mainstream institution devoted to the popular culture of the dominant society, and celebrating the persistence of traditional Native artistic expression and its modern adaptations.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Southeast Asian Young Men's Film Program
Project Description: The Southeast Asian Young Men's Film Program will complete several documentary films and develop an interactive website to host these films and other oral history projects.  A community cultural celebration film screening of the completed films is planned.  The participants are high school-aged young men who will be creating documentary films that explore topics such as Southeast Asian culture, bicultural identity, drug and alcohol dependency, and youth violence.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Pathfinder K-8 PTSA will partner with the neighborhood to design the best possible playground for our community at the Pathfinder K-8 School Playground.  The effort will include hiring a landscape designer, coordinating with the neighborhood, and hosting 3 public meetings to guide the design process. The resulting products will be a playground design plan and a very excited community.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The First Hill Improvement Association will engage the First Hill community and conduct an organizational assessment and visioning process to develop a more effective community voice for First Hill.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Belltown Business Assoc. Strategic Plan Process
Project Description: The Belltown Business Association,(BBA), will hire a consultant to facilitate an organizational assessment and visioning process and development of a BBA strategic plan.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Ballard Chamber of Commerce will implement a community-based holiday lighting display that will enhance the spirit of Ballard residents/visitors and leverage the historic character of our neighborhood, it will drive holiday shoppers and tourists to Ballard to the benefit of local and independent retailers, restaurants and other Ballard businesses.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Central District Youth College and Career Project
Project Description: The Central District Youth College and Career Project (YCCP) will help 40 students of color  prepare for college admission and careers. Some highlights of the 6-month project are the Princeton Review SAT/ACT Test Preparation, college immersion activities, and career guidance from working professionals.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Olympic Hills Greenway Pocket Park design
Project Description: Community members will hire a consultant to create a design concept for a proposed pocket park at NE 133th between 27th and 28th Avenue NE.  Three public meetings will be held to solicit public input for the plan.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Othello Park International Music and Arts Festival
Project Description: The Othello community will host its annual free multi-ethnic music and arts festival on Sunday, August 17, 2014 from noon - 6:00pm. at the park, 4531 S Othello St.  Activities will include an arts creation station,  a theatrical performance by neighborhood youth, petting zoo, carnival rides,  live music,  vendors, information booths and food carts.   Neighborhood Matching Fund supported events are open to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Members of the Greenwood P-Patch and the surrounding neighborhood will enhance the garden by building additional plots, creating ADA accessibility, developing a children's play area and columnar orchard and enlarging the community gathering space. These improvements were identified through a community design process.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Star Tech Global Academy (STGA), an initiative of the 501(c)(3) Renaissance 21, will implement the first chapter of `The Coder's Club,` an after-school program teaching desktop and mobile web application development to at-risk and underrepresented youth. The innovative Star Tech Fleet of classroom-supply vehicles delivers this mobile program in-whole, cost-free to our host organization PSKS. PSKS (www.psks.org) provides support to Seattle-area homeless and street-involved youth.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Steps at Stevens project will create strong community connections and improve public safety near West Seattle High School at the intersection of California Ave SW and SW Stevens. A consultant will be hired to facilitate community meetings which will result in a concept plan for the site that highlights the school entrance and promotes safe walking and bicycling.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Judkins P-Patch community will improve and expand the existing community garden by building new retaining walls and reorganizing existing infrastructure.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Judkins P-Patch community will improve and expand the existing neighborhood garden by building new retaining walls and reorganizing existing infrastructure. The enhancements include a new ADA accessible path.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: A youth basketball jamboree event for Seattle Recreation basketball level teams will be held on December 28-29, 2013 at the Rainier Beach Community Center.  The teams participating will be recruited from a Seattle communities, Parks recreation teams, Boys and Girls Clubs and the YMCA.  This event will accomplish the following: create a new, healthy experience for youth in our neighborhood; provide an equally competitive environment for all participants, and create a promotion of fellowship between Seattle’s Rainier Beach neighborhood and other communities.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Sand Point Elementary PTA will finalize the site development focused on playground enhancements.  We will replace the existing border of plastic beams and add an additional piece of equipment.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Develop Land Use Planning Tools for 35th Ave NE.
Project Description: The 35th Ave Committee will develop 1) a streetscape plan and 2) recommendations for zoning changes (if any) for the 35th Ave NE Business District.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Indigenous Showcase will present 10 contemporary films produced by Indigenous filmmakers along with filmmaker discussions and artists workshops. All events will be free and open to the Public.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Improvements will be made to the Licorice Fern Natural Area, including the installation of  a 4-foot kiosk,  enhancements to the main park entrance on NE 130th Street, and the construction of two ADA-accessible crushed rock trails. The project also includes permitting  for  native habitat restoration and trail building within the undeveloped right of way of of NE 130th St.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Friends of the West Seattle Bee Garden and partners will improve the quality and quantity of observation opportunities at the site by enhancing features at the bee hive enclosure. These improvements will be highlighted during the second annual West Seattle Bee Festival scheduled for May of 2014.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Making the 12th Ave Corridor More People-Friendly
Project Description: The 12th Avenue Stewards will celebrate the grand opening of the 12th Avenue Square Park and adjacent James Court woonerf. Inspired by this woonerf, we will begin the conceptual planning to propose a woonerf on nearby Remington Court. Additionally, to fill a gap that was left in recent improvements on 12th Ave., we'll plant two street trees in front of Von Trapp's at 912 12th Ave.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This youth led project will provide a public forum for expressive voice and will engage the community through video and photography in discussions concerning the complexities of urban redevelopment, social equity and racial justice as they relate to the planned changes at Yesler Terrace. It will result in a series of student produced exhibits that document the project and the community process.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Rehabilitate 10 year old ADA Access Paths
Project Description: Trail improvements are planned that would rehabilitate a 10 year old gravel ADA accessible path that surrounds the Magnuson Community Garden, a 150 plot P-Patch.  These improvements would allow equal access for the gardners who use the raised beds and community members who visit the site.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Seattle People of Color Salon (SPoCS) will plan and hold three events in 2014 to highlight the importance of creating people of color arts space in Seattle. The events will consist of a variety of visual and performance art.  The first event will be held in August, the second will be held September, and the third will be held in December. NMF funded events are free and open to the public.  They are funded on a one-time only basis.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Residents of High Point community in West Seattle will adopt 30 designated garden beds and borders in parks, roundabouts and other open spaces within the development. With training from Seattle Tilth they will weed, plant, design and maintaining these plots in teams throughout the year.  A Garden Walk event with prizes is planned to celebrate team accomplishments.  Local youth will create a fence mural, mosaic signs and assist with weeding and outreach.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Through the 2014 Ballard Open Space Inventory, Groundswell NW seeks to gain a better understanding of our community’s current and future open space needs and to identify opportunities to create and enhance open spaces in the Ballard District.  Building on the 1996 Ballard Open Space Inventory, this inventory will assess progress to date, review previously identified opportunities, identify new opportunities, and recommend actions for addressing the open space needs of the community.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Indigenous Studio project will support dialogue and cultural teachings and give families a place to pass on their legacy and historical teachings through the arts.  It will provide opportunities for Urban Natives to learn and maintain cultural identity and traditional values, and pass them to the next generation. A series of art workshops will be held to create authentic contemporary and traditional art.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Transgender Youth & Family Film and Speaker Series
Project Description: The Gender Diversity's Transgender Adolescents Support Group will plan, develop, and host a four-part film series, with guest speakers, to educate  the Seattle community on issues affecting transgender youth.  Three of the events will take place at Seattle Children's Hospital, the remaining screening will occur at a national conference for transgender youth and families to be held in downtown Seattle during  August  of 2014.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Seward Park Torii: Design Development/Oral History
Project Description: This project continues our previous Seward Park Torii Planning Project, with the aim of moving from the community-approved conceptual design to construction documents.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Rainier Valley Walking and Biking Map Project
Project Description: Walking and biking maps that cover Rainer Valley, with an emphasis on the Columbia City and Rainier Beach urban villages  will be developed, printed and distributed in Southeast Seattle. These maps will encourage physical activity in these neighborhoods by increasing awareness of community resources and providing travel time information.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Seattle Theatre Group will present FORTUNE'S BONES: THE MANUMISSION REQUIEM. With a chorus of more than 100, orchestra, music written by Dr. Ysaye Barnwell, lyrics by Marilyn Nelson, and conducted by Dr. Stephen Newby.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Festival Sundiata will showcase art, education and entertainment which depicts the colorful perspectives, culture and history of people of African descent. This free event is June 14-15,  at the Seattle Center.  Activities include a quilting demonstration and exhibit, African doll making, art, workshops, diverse food vendors and much more. Neighborhood Matching Fund supported events are free, open to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: It's A Family Affair | #SEA Annual Family Reunion
Project Description: The `It's A Family Affair` #SEA Annual Family Reunion will be held at Genesee Park, 4316 S, Genesee Street on Sunday, August 31, 2014 from 10:00am - 10:00pm.  The goal is to highlight the role and importance of the family in building strong neighborhoods.  There will be great music, food and activities for children of all ages.  Matching Fund supported events are free, open to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Rainier Valley Steering Committee will implement a project that supports literacy and writing enrichment for children and youth in Seattle.  Twenty-five teens will attend workshops and recieve tutoring on a variety of writing styles and techniques.  This will result in a collection of essays and stories that will be shared at a community celebration.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: North Seattle Boys & Girls Club branch of Boys & Girls Clubs of King County
Project Description: The Greenwood Preparedness Action Network – a grassroots coalition of residents, low-income tenants, and constituents of local CBOs (North Seattle Boys & Girls Club, Low Income Housing Institute, Greenwood Senior Center, Green Bean, and Salvation Army) -- will increase emergency preparedness among over 200 individuals in the Greenwood/North Seattle neighborhood through disaster education workshops, emergency kit distribution, neighborhood-level disaster planning, and installation of 2 Emergency Hubs.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This project will develop a community identity for the Hiawatha Urban Business corridor (HUB) though outreach, creation and installation of light pole banners, business district signage, and events.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Improving Elevator Access to Community Space
Project Description: El Centro de la Raza (ECDLR) will upgrade the elevator in its main building on Beacon Hill in order to improve ADA access and safety for participants served by its 44 wraparound programs and annual cultural events. The building is a historic 100-year-old schoolhouse that ECDLR has occupied since 1972, and a fixture in the North Beacon Hill neighborhood. The current elevator has been in use for two decades, and has become unreliable, falling behind in both safety standards and ADA compliance.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Wing Luke Museum of the Asian Pacific American Experience
Project Description: The Wing Luke Museum will host the Civil Disobedience Exhibit to address civil activism within Seattle’s Pan-Asian Pacific American community, spanning from immigrants in the late 1800s to the present-day and beyond while exploring what it means to be civically active on the issues of today.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description:
Friends of Cayton Corner Park will work with the Parks Department to transform a vacant property at 1831 E Madison St into a small neighborhood pocket park. Cayton Corner Park will provide a  green urban spot and neighborhood gathering space. This project will continue design development from Phase 1 with continued public involvement and will allow partial completion of construction documents. 

Event details will be posted on the DON Neighborhood Events calendar.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Spirit of West Africa (SOWA) is a lively and colorful art, education, and cultural showcase of West Africa and the African Diaspora. SOWA 2014 will be held Saturday, May 10, 2014 from 11 am - 6 pm in the Seattle Center Armory.  Neighborhood Matching Fund events must be free and open to the public.  Support is provided on a one time only basis.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Crown Hill Community Gardens and Celebration
Project Description: The Just Garden Project (JGP) will work with the Labateyah United Indians Youth Home and the Crown Hill Neighborhood Association to engage neighbors in sharing community, food and celebration. We will build 6 edible community gardens, install a 100 ft. community edible walkway at Labateyah, host a community celebration, and provide two free workshops for residents about how to grow affordable, healthy food.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Orca K-8 is an alternative public school located in the Hillman City neighborhood – with close ties and associations to the Seward Park, Lakewood, and Columbia City communities—of Seattle’s Rainier Valley. Funds will be used to move forward with Phase II, having the consultants draw up Project Orca Playground's (POP) construction documents and project cost estimates.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Jackson Street Youth Art Project at WMS
Organization Name: Friends of Hit the Streets on Jackson
Project Description: Friends of Hit the Streets on Jackson (FHSJ) and Coyote Central will collaborate with Jackson Street community groups, residents and businesses to mount a youth art project on the Jackson Street frontage of Washington Middle School (2101 S. Jackson St.) in summer of 2014.  The purpose of the project is to strengthen ties between the neighborhood and school while building in neighborhood youth a sense of community awareness and stewardship.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The project is to develop a conceptual plan for improvements to the school grounds at the Broadview Thomson K-8 (BTK8) school at 13052 Greenwood Ave N. The BTK8 Community Playground Improvement committee plans to renovate the play areas to the east and south of the school building into a space designed to enrich the education and development of all of the children in the neighborhood and those who attend BTK8.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Rainier Court Age to Age Art Connection
Organization Name: Rainier Court Age to Age Art Connection Steering Committee
Project Description: In an effort to connect a community that has few gathering spaces, the `Fifth Annual Rainier Court Community Festival` will be held Saturday, August 23, 2014 at Rainier Court, 3621 - 33rd Ave S from noon until 4:00 pm.  There will be local musicians, great food, and entertainment representing a variety of cultures and ethnic backgrounds.  Neighborhood Matching Fund supported events are free, open to the public and supported on a one time only basis.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The West Seattle Cup is a two-day tournament for youth that will be held on Saturday and Sunday, June 14-15, 8am-7pm at the Walt Hundley Playfield, 6920 34th Ave SW.  The event will bring together teams of elementary-age children and their parents representing different countries to participate in a World Cup-style tournament that celebrates soccer, culture, and community. The West Seattle Cup aims to connect across generational and cultural differences.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Low Income Housing Institute will produce a monthly concert series in the community activity space at Ernestine Anderson Place (EAP) located at 2010 South Jackson Street in the Central Area.   The concert series will feature local musical acts including jazz and R&B and be free and open to the public.   This project will bring a wide range of community members together to create fun and entertaining events and pay tribute to the history of the neighborhood.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: The Micro-Parks of Westlake Avenue North
Project Description: The South Lake Union Community Council will create a conceptual design for improving the streetscape on Westlake between Denny Way + Lake Union Park, creating a series of micro-parks with sculptural benches and plantings in the existing large, unattractive tree pits. Each park will potentially refer to one of Seattle’s 21 sister cities, speaking to the international hi-tech, bio-tech and resident culture in SLU.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: 2014 Year of Pride in Rainier Vista
Project Description: We will bring our Rainier Vista community together through celebrations at Rainier Vista Neighborhood House and Central Park. We will: (i) Host three major events and coordinate a “Summer Saturdays” program that develop community pride; (ii) Incorporate community conversations about critical neighborhood issues into these events; and (iii)  Leverage the process to develop the leadership of diverse neighborhood youth and adults.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Community Priorities at the Cap Hill Station TOD
Project Description: Capitol Hill Champion will organize meaningful community engagement with prospective developers regarding community priorities at the Capitol Hill Station TOD & promote inclusion of neighborhood preferences in developers' proposals during the RFP process.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: West Woodland School and Community Gardens
Project Description:
On the grounds of the West Woodland Elementary School at 5601 4th Ave NW:
1. Create edible plant garden to integrate gardening with curricula and model sustainable gardening with neighbors.
2. Design outdoor classroom to provide learning space. 
3. Add plants, signage and trail features to existing rain garden.
4. Add plants, signage and trail features to native plant garden to invite community to learn about habitat and ethnobotanical value.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Women Driving, Women Advancing is a community project involving 15 low-income Latina women who will develop leadership skills while learning safe driving technigues. This training will help them to gain self-esteem and develop strategies as leaders and become responsible citizens.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Eritrean community will make improvements to their community gathering space.  The enhancements include new flooring, tile work in the bathrooms, repairs to the walls, plumbing upgrades, a wall divider and a  fresh coat of paint.  A neighborhood celebration is planned once the project has been completed.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: A Sense of Place: Community Summer Festival
Project Description: Ethiopian businesses, churches, non-profit groups, and residents of the Central District will organize a community summer festival open to all to be held at the Garfield Community Center on Saturday, August 23, from 11am to 6pm. Local youth will help with outreach. The festival will bring together Ethiopian parents, youth, business, and community leaders and Central District residents for a day of celebration of Ethiopian culture and food, as well as speakers about the immigrant experience.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Filipino Community Center is an integral part of the ethnic community for gathering, celebration, integration and community building. The center is used to communicate, refer resources and provide services to a diverse community. To ensure continued effective use of the facility the sound/lighting and stage will be upgraded along with technological updates to the audio/visual system.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: SR 520 Portage Bay Area Public Trail Access
Project Description: Portage Bay /Roanoke Park Community Council will implement a planning and design project with a Crime Prevention Through Environmental Design (CPTED) consultant to address illegal actitivies under the SR520 bridge in the area from Delmar Dr. to under SR520 to the shoreline.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: HVAC for the West Seattle Senior Center
Project Description: The West Seattle Senior Center will install a permanent HVAC system in their building at 4217 SW Oregon to make it more comfortable for building users, including numerous community groups that hold meetings at the center. A celebration event will be held in June 2015. Event details will be provided to the NMF project manager and posted on the DON Neighborhood Events calendar. An outreach plan will be developed to expand use of the center by community groups.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: `The Incredible Intensity of Just Being Human`
Project Description: Allied Arts Foundation will produce `The Incredible Intensity of Just Being Human`, an art exhibit that intends to shed light and de-stigmatize mental illness in our community. The exhibit will take place at the Anne Focke Gallery at Seattle City Hall, 600 Fourth Ave from January to February 2015.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Friends of the University District P-Patch
Project Description: Friends of the University District P-Patch will move and upgrade structures at the University District P-Patch located at 4009 8th Ave NE. The bee apiary, the tool shed, and the greenhouse will be re-located within the garden and structurally improved.  Two new garden plots will also be added, increasing opportunities for community members to garden. The result will be a community garden that is safer, more welcoming to the public, and less prone to flooding.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description:
La Sala will conduct a community art and youth leadership training project in which 140 participants will create visual and audio works about the South Park neighborhood at 3 places: South Park Neighborhood Center, Ch Sealth HS, and Concord ES. Works will be displayed in November 2014 at the SP Neighborhood Center, 8201 10th Ave S, and the Center for Contemporary Art, 5701 6th Ave S. 

Event details will be provided to the NMF project manager and posted on the DON Neighborhood Events calendar.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Group for Promotion of Family Entertainment in Seattle
Project Description: Group for Promotion of Family Entertainment in Seattle will produce a family variety show  designed to introduce families and children to the performing arts. The family variety show starts September 28, 2014 to October 25, 2015, at the Phinny Ridge Community Center, 6532 Phinney Avenue N.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Lawton Elementary School PTA  will facilitate a planning and design project to modernize the Lawton Community playground structures, improve watershed functions, and connectivity to surrounding parklands. The playground is located at 4000 27th Ave West.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Mt. Baker Community Clubhouse Renovation Planning
Project Description: Mount Baker Community Club will implement a community outreach and planning project to renovate a heavily used 100-year-old community-owned building. It is located at 2811 Mt. Rainier Drive S.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This project is to complete a community visioning and design process for the East Howe Street Gateway Plaza. The creation of this `Gateway Plaza` will help identify the west terminus of a 2,000 foot long trail leading from 10th Avenue E to Fairview Ave E.  It will complete the trail connection to the Lake Union Loop Trail and the many street end parks around Lake Union.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description:
The Greenwood Arts Council will create a holiday lighting installation by lighting up a tower at the Phinney Neighborhood Center and hanging 150 LED-lit metal-frame monkeys from trees and business awnings in the Greenwood-Phinney business district. There will be a rolling series of lighting events in the evening on Saturday, November 29. 

Event details will be provided to the NMF project manager and posted on the DON Neighborhood Events calendar.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Northwest Museum of Legends and Lore
Project Description:
The Seattle Faerie Festival is all things faerie, elven and magical offering a realm of live music, arts, food, vendors and theater inspired by fairy history and tradition.
The Seattle Faerie Festival will be held in Volunteer Park - 1247 15th Ave E on Sunday, September 28, 2014 from 12:00pm to 6:00pm.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Art and Activation Plan for Bell Street Park
Organization Name: Friends of Bell Street Park Art Project
Project Description: The Friends of Bell Street Park Art Project will create a neighborhood-based plan for art and activation in Bell Street Park. A landscape architect will facilitate community stakeholders in collaboration with the Departmentof Parks and Recreation and the Department of Transportation to develop the plan.

The event will be the second annual Madison Park Art Walk featuring local artist's work displayed in local businesses. The event will begin with an opening reception on September 9, 2011 6:00-9:00pm. Attendees will meet at  4000 East Madison Street.  They will be given a brochure that outlines the various exhibits.  The artwork will be available for viewing throughout the month of September.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description:
The Carlos Bulosan Centennial Committee (CBCC) will organize a series of 11 free community events about Carlos Bulosan, a noted Filipino-American author, poet, laborer, and organizer, at various Seattle venues in October and November 2014. The purpose of the project is to increase historic documentation and empower storytelling among community members.

Event details will be provided to the NMF project manager and posted on the DON Neighborhood Events calendar.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Cortona Community and the 25th & Union Parklet Team have teamed to construct a small parklet adjacent to Cortona Cafe & Swing Salon. This project is born out of Seattle Department of Transportation (SDOT's) parklet pilot program and represents one of the first parklets to be constructed in the Seattle area. The Cortona Parklet will be a public gathering place for Central Area residents, promoting neighborly activities around our sidewalks.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: International Examiner Book and Photo Exhibit
Project Description: The Friends of the International Examiner will prepare and publish an anthology of the best stories from the International Examiner entitled `Best of the International Examiner`.  An accompanying photo exhibit will be created and displayed at multiple public venues throughout Seattle. The book and photo exhibit will further strengthen the concept of pan-Asian American identity.  They will also demonstrate the use of ethnic media as a way of promoting social justice.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Improving the North Trail Access to Peppi's Woods
Project Description: Friends of Peppi's Woods will facilitate an enviromental project to improve and formalize the unsafe trail on the north side of Peppi's Woods, located at 3233 E. Spruce St.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Filipino Chamber of Commerce of the Pacific Northwest
Project Description: The Filipino Chamber of Commerce of the Pacific Northwest will conduct a pre-feasibility study to examine the possibility of creating a Filipino business plaza.  The business plaza will be a place where community members can purchase goods and services created by or are relevant to the Filipino community.  The pre-feasibility study will consist of interactive meetings, survey, and interviews to assess community interests.  It will also include preliminary real estate and zoning research.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Friends of Chromer Building Parklet (FCBP) have gotten approval from SDOT to host a parklet on 2nd Ave. in front of the Chromer Building.  This NMF grant will pay for parklet building materials.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Develop a street concept plan for Terry Avenue from Madison to Terrace streets.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Meeting of the Minds urban arts community forum
Project Description: 206 Zulu, a Hip Hop community group, will host a two-day Meeting of the Minds urban arts community forum on Saturday, February 7 (11am-11pm) & Sunday, February 8 (4pm-8pm), 2015, at the Langston Hughes Performing Arts Institute (104 17th Ave S). The forum will connect community members (youth and families) to local and national leaders in urban arts, education, and organizing and increase creative collaboration among neighborhood groups and local businesses.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Seattle Busking Celebration! will host a series of free events in the downtown Seattle to celebrate street performing in Seattle. The events will run from September 14, 2014 until March 31, 2015. They will be held at the Pike Place Market at 85 Pike St, the Central Library at 1000 4th Ave, Experience Music Project Museum at 325 5th Ave N, Benaroya Hall at 200 University St, and other venues in downtown Seattle. The events will feature buskers and other forms of artistic entertainment.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Brighton Neighborhood Group will facilitate the installation of neighborhood welcome signs and a community cleanup. The installation of the signs and community gathering will help in creating community pride by establishing the boundries of the Brighton neighborhood in South East Seattle.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Site Plan for Highland Park Elementary School
Project Description: The Friends of Highland Park Elementary will create and facilitate a planning process to rethink and redesign the large asphalt covered school yard at Highland Park Elementary School located at 1012 SW Trenton St.  The goal is twofold; to work with an architect to design a creative and engaging play space at the school and to learn how to work across any potential cultural, ethnic and language barriers in our diverse neighborhood, building on our community strength.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Viewlands Elementary Playground Site Design Plan
Project Description: Viewlands Elementary School PTA will facilitate a planning and design project to revitalize playground areas on Viewlands Elementary school grounds at 10525 3rd Ave NW.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: SouthEast Effective Development will operate a year-long series of trainings for youth at the Rainier Community Center, located at 4600 38th Ave S. This series, called the Creative Arts Digital Media Academy (CADMA), will give youth skills in digital technology, radio journalism, and the visual arts.  The trainings will be free of charge to participants.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Dance & Dive  Block Party Steering Committee
Project Description: Dance & dive, a community fitness block party  will be held on Sunday, September 7, 2014 from 1pm to 4pm at the Rainier Beach Community Center, 8825 Rainier Avenue South. It will include opportunites to swim, participate in zumba classes, and access nutritional and fitness information. Neighbors will be able to connect/meet quarterly to report on fitness goals and challenges.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: U District Advocates will implement a physical improvement project to design and build the U District's first parklet in public open space in a neighborhood challenged by growth. It will be located at NE 43rd St and University Way NE.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Four 3-day basketball camps will be conducted for Central Area youth.   Students will learn Basketball Fundamentals, Sportsmanship, Team Building and enhance their literacy skills using established curriculum. The first camp will be at Garfield High School 400-23rd Avenue, December 29th-31st from 9:00am-1:00pm.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Vision Hillman City will hold a series of professionally-facilitated community conversations (incl. interpreters) among Hillman City neighbors to identify neighborhood priorities and to foster new relationships and diverse community. Conversations will be held at Hillman City venues in December 2014-March 2015, with a culminating community report-back and celebration in April 2015.  Event details will be provided to the NMF project manager and posted on the DON Neighborhood Events calendar.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Conceptual Design for Smith Cove Park
Project Description: The Friends of Smith Cove Park will hire a landscape architect to develop a conceptual park plan.  Public meetings and other methods of outreach will be used gather information to inform planning. The resulting plan will reflect the community’s desire to have an engaging, activated waterfront park that is a resource for the neighborhood.  All project activates will be closely coordinated with the Seattle Department of Parks and Recreation Project Manager for Smith Cove Park.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: The Asian American Struggle for Racial Equality
Project Description: The Chinese American Historical Society will create a thirty minute video that will raise awareness about the history of Asian Americans’ fight for racial equality in Washington state. The documentary will capture and highlight the discrimination that Asian Americans have experienced beginning with their arrival in the 1800s and continuing into the 21st century. A community celebration and public viewing will be held at the completion of the project.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Friends of Good Shepherd P-Patch will organize neighbors and community members to implement physical improvements at the Good Shepherd P-Patch located at 4618 Bagley Avenue North.  Aging infrastructure will be updated, community garden plots will be added, pathways will be leveled, and physical accessibility throughout the site will be enhanced.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Magnolia Chamber of Commerce will engage the neighborhood to define a collective “Vision for Magnolia Village” and a set of actionable steps to help shape future development of the neighborhood commercial district.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: VPT will conduct a feasibility study for redevelopment of the Volunteer Park bandshell. VPT will hire a consultant and host a series of community meetings to gather input from the performing arts community, park users and prospective park users from the neighborhood and the broader region. This input will inform the efforts to create a feasible path forward to redevelop the bandshell.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Parenting Classes: Healthy Parents and Communities
Project Description: The Rainier Valley Steering Committee (RVSC) is proposing to offer six months of free parenting classes and workshops. The classes will help parents focus on their health and well being specifically as it relates to advocating for their child’s education.

The 98118 Coalition will organize a showcase of ethnic cultural performanes to participate in the Rainier Valley Chamber of Commerce Summer Fest scheduled for August 20, 2011.

Patricipation has inclued but is not limited to Philippines, Somali, Mexico, Eritrea, Japan, Jamaica, Vietnam, Kenya, Burundi, Samoa, Ethiopa and will continue to expand.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Friends of Evanston P-Patch will hire a local landscape architect to create a construction-ready design plan to redevelop the Evanston P-Patch (604 N. 101st St).  The goal of the plan will be to enhance the garden’s functionality and accessibility. At least three community meetings will be held to provide input, and outreach will be done to the surrounding neighborhood as well as the garden community, with interpretation and translation in Spanish and Somali.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Connected Public Realm: Belltown & Denny Triangle
Project Description: The Lake2Bay Coalition will hire a consultant to help develop a Public Realm Plan connecting Belltown and Denny Triangle. Three community events and meetings are planned for input, as well as extensive coordination with City departments. The plan will help the City identify priorities for future street concept plans or other street design tools to employ in the Belltown - Denny Triangle area.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Magnolia Trail Community will hire a consultant to perform a feasibility study of a walking/biking trail that would fill a missing link to give Magnolians and other city residents easy access to the Magnolia waterfront, Smith Cove Park, and trails through Interbay (and points north) and Elliott Bay Park (to downtown and points south). Two community meetings and a series of public tours will be held to provide public input into the study.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Livable, Workable Georgetown Committee will gather community input in Georgetown on neighborhood development, gentrification, and land use. The data will be collected and distributed to a range of stakeholders including community participants, local organizations, City departments, and other government agencies for the purpose of planning and policy-making in and around Georgetown. A culminating community event will be held in late summer 2015 at South Seattle College - Georgetown campus.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Friends of Picardo Farms P-Patch will organize neighbors and community members to implement physical site improvements at Picardo P-Patch community garden located at 8040 25th Ave NE.  The food bank harvesting area will gain improved accessibility and functionality.  The communal outdoor seating area will be renovated.  A bee apiary, medicinal herb garden, and updated informational kiosks will also be built.  Physical accessibility will be incorporated into all improvements.
