In keeping with Belltown's diverse population and culture, we will be holding events in the Lava Lounge, Clever Bottle, Upstairs, and Rabbit Hole providing a combination of venues for all ages and personalities.

Project Title: 44th Burke Block Watch Annual Night Out Party
Project Description: The 44th Burke Block Watch Night Out party has been held annually for at least the last 20 years.  It will be on August 6, 2013 from 6:00-9:00pm.  We use it to connect with our new neighbors and to catch up with folks we have known for decades.  We are very interested in conversations about public safety and the quality of life.  In light in all that has happened in Seattle neighborhoods we want to keep the tradition of Night Out aive and well in our neighborhood.

Project Title: Teen Night Out Against Youth Violence
Project Description: The Teen Night Out Against Violence project will be held in coordination with the National Night Out on Tuesday, August 6, 2013 from 5:30 - 9:00 pm at the courtyard of the New Holly Public Library, 7058 - 32nd Avenue S.  Activities include, peer audio interviews, spray-painting t-shirts, button making, a photo booth and an open mic for performances relating to the topic of preventing youth violence. Neighborhood Matching Fund supported events are free, open to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

Project Title: White Center Business District Night Out
Project Description: On August 6, the White Center business district is hosting a `block party` styled event in the downtown area of White Center. Business owners, non-profits, the King County Sheriff's Office, the White Center Community Development Association and residents are participating via a community dinner, hosting live music, and by simply being out in the neighborhood on this night. Funding will be used for outreach and for booths to be located at the White Center Community Development Association, 1615 SW Cambridge Street, from 5 - 9 p.m. including a booth to provide  bicycle safety information and classes as well as a booth to promote awareness of emergency preparedness for the neighborhood.

Project Title: Bridging the Gap: Green Lake Plaza Reaches Out
Project Description: Green Lake Plaza is a Seattle Housing Authority low income high rise with 125 residents who want to feel more connected to their neighborhood.  To further that aim they are planning a Night Out gathering for Tuesday, August 6th from 7:00-9:00 pm at 505 NE 70th street.  The street will be closed so there will be plenty of room to enjoy great food, play games and get to know your neighbors. There will also be a book/dvd exchange as well as information on public safety and security. Matching Fund supported events are free, open to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

Building on the success of past events the Camp Long South Neighborhood is planning a Night Out gathering on Tuesday, August 6th from 6-9:00 pm at the intersection of SW Findlay and 34th Avenue SW.  There will be great food, music, activities for kids, and an information exchange table including resources for emergency preparedness.  Neighborhood Matching Fund supported events are free, open to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

Project Title: Neighborhood Night Out - Community Potluck Dinner
Project Description: First annual neighborhood night out community potluck dinner near the U District Square development area. All area residents are invited to attend the event on the evening of August 6th, 2013 from 6:00-9:00pm, when the 4200 block of NE Brooklyn Avenue will be closed between 42nd and 43rd Streets NE.

Project Title: Seattle Night Out Community BBQ and Drum Circle
Project Description: The University House will host a community BBQ and Concert for Seattle Night Out on August 6, 2013 from 6:00-9:00pm. This event will focus on cultivating relationships not only within University House, but also with the surrounding residents and businesses.  As people enjoy music, food, and  conversation, they will get to know each other better. The result of the event will be a stronger, safer, and more vibrant neighborhood community.

Project Title: Power to the Story: STE+AM Media Camp
Project Description: Digital Media/Storytelling are combined into a unique informal learning experience for 20 youth from Cleveland HS. The 10-day camp will leverage the power of story and youth’s interest in media to increase civic engagement. The focus is on video storytelling, the project will provide hands-on experience producing featured story videos for three community nonprofits. The stories will be screened as part of the Compassion Games: Survival of the Kindest on September 11, 2013.

The residents of Esperanza Apartments (a senior affordable living apartment complex) and Park Place Assisted Living are joining together to host a `Night Out` block party at 6940 - 37th Avenue South from 6:00-9:00 pm on Tuesday, August 6, 2013.  The goal of the event is to give senior citizens the opportunity to enjoy the company of their diverse neighbors in a safe and secure setting. There will be games and activities for all ages, along with great food and good conversation.  Neighborhood Matching Fund supported events are free, open to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

Project Title: Ross Community Club Tree Walk and Community Picnic
Project Description: On September 7, 2013 from 11:00am - 2:00pm, the Ross Community Club is sponsoring a tree walk in conjunction with the Tree Ambassador program starting at Fremont Peak Park, winding down to Ross Park.   Following the walk, we will hold a free neighborhood picnic for the public at Ross Park.  Small Sparks funds will be used for outreach and supplies for the picnic.

Project Title: Langston Hughes PAI - Summer Academy Celebration
Project Description: This summer 76 Seattle youth ages 6-18 have been  learning the fundamentals of voice, acting, movement and dance, and costuming and set design while focusing on the history of great African American and African artists. The highlight of the summer will be their culminating performance on stage. In celebration of the hard-work and dedication of the youth, the Parent Ambassadors will be hosting a Showcase/Reception for the community on Sunday, August 18th, at approximately 8:30, immediately following the summer musical performance at Langston Hughes Performing Arts Institute, 104 - 17th Avenue South. Neighborhood Matching Fund supported events are free, open to the public and funded on a one time only basis. The goal of this project is to connect the surrounding neighborhood more closely to the Institute and to highlight what an important resource it is for the community.

Alleycat Acres will build a greenhouse for the urban farm at 720 MLK Jr. Way South. The greenhouse will extend the growing season and increase the amount of food grown and distributed to volunteers and the neighborhood food bank.

Project Title: A Neighborhood - Wide Open House and Celebration
Organization Name: Rainier Beach Community Center Advisory Council
Project Description: On September 22, 2013 from 2pm to 5pm there will be a neighborhood celebration for the `grand reopening` of our community center.  We will invite everyone to help us open the newly constructed Rainier Beach Community Center and Pool building.  There will be tours available, translated into every language requested.  There will be free swim sessions in the lap pool and water slide areas and class demonstrations throughout the building, including appearances by local sports figures.  Local restaurants will be highlighted as they will provide multi-ethnic refreshments for the event and local youth will provide music and dance entertainment.  Staff and Advisory Council members will be available to sign people up for classes and fill out scholarship information.

Project Title: Olympic Hills Pocket Park Work Party
Project Description: Lake City Greenways is working with SDOT to create a pocket park in a street end in the Olympic Hills neighborhood (NE 133rd between 27th Ave NE and 28th Ave NE). A work party is being held on Saturday, September 21, 2013 and funds will be used for goats to help clear the site, refreshments for the volunteers, and related expenses for outreach.

Rainier Vista is one of the most culturally diverse neighborhoods in the city with more than 18 different languages spoken within the 700 rental and home ownership units.  In order to strengthen and build that uniquely diverse neighborhood, a Multicultural Summer Celebration is planned for Saturday, August 31st from 2:00 - 5:30 pm at the Central Park, 4410 - 29th Avenue South. This family friendly event will include great food, activities for kids, resource tables from local service providers and multicultural dancers.  This family friendly celebration will be a fun venue for diverse, mixed-income neighbors to build stronger relationships. Neighborhood Matching Fund supported events are free, open to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

Organization Name: Youth Employment Skateboarding (YES) & Skate Like A Girl
Project Description: The YES Program is a leadership training program for skateboarders ages 12 to 23.  Participants organize events, instruct children and youth, and do civic engagement. Requested funding will buy storage boxes at Judkins, Roxhill, Delridge, and Jefferson skate parks to facilitate YES’s free “12 and Under” program. The boxes are needed to store skateboards, pads, helmets and other necessary program equipment and materials. Permission from Seattle Parks to locate the boxes has been secured.

Project Title: Growing Up Brown in Seattle in the '30s-'50s
Organization Name: Seattle Filipino Pioneers Celebration Planning Committee
Project Description: A celebration of Seattle's Filipino Pioneers will be held on Friday, October 4, 2013 from 6:00-9:00 pm at 810 - 18th Avenue. Attendees will hear from 4 Filipino Americans born in the U.S.in the 1930s-40s who will share their experiences growing up in a segregated Seattle. A reception will follow. In 1965 immigration laws changed and the Filipino population increased tremendously.  Most new arrivals are not aware of the old community which laid the foundation for today's Filipino community.  Matching Fund supported events are free, open to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

Organization Name: Northwest Museum of Legends and Lore
Project Description:
The Seattle Faerie Festival will be held in Volunteer Park on Saturday October 5, 2013 from Noon - 6pm.

While being educational and fun, it also encompasses underlying themes of environmental stewardship and preservation, community building, interactive games and artesian craftsmenship.  

The Faerie Festival is an event of all things faerie, elven and magical offering
a realm of live music, arts, food, vendors and theater inspired by fairy history and tradition. All Matching Fund supported events are free, open to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

A permit to use Volunteer Park will be required.  The permit must be provided to DON one week prior to the event.

Funds will be used to fabricate and deploy Base Camp on September 20, 2013 as part of Park(ing) Day 2013 and the Seattle Design Festival.  Base Camp will activate a right-of-way on Occidental, between S King Street and S Jackson Street and will: educate the public about the benefits of Low Impact Design, provide a gathering place for the public for information exchange and interaction, inspire people about the possibilities of parklets, and act as an informal bandstand for music.

Project Title: Nonpartisan Candidates Forum in South Seattle
Organization Name: Coalition of Immigrants, Refugees and Communities of Color (CIRCC)
Project Description: Communities of Color United for Progress is a multi-cultural network based in Seattle. Communities of Color United is made up of individuals involved in community-based civic engagement in the Asian Pacific Islander, Latino and East African communities in South Seattle. The project is to convene a nonpartisan Candidates Forum in South Seattle on Saturday, October 26, 2013 9:00am to 1:30pm at the Eriteran Community Center.

During the first week of November the mentors and students that have signed up for Empower Mentoring Program will all come to the meeting space. At this first meeting the students and mentors will each bring from home a trinket/item that either describes them or shows one of their passions and introduce themselves through their trinket. The whole group will play many ice breakers to get students and mentors to open up and get to know each other on a deeper level. They will learn how to open up and trust each other. 

The students will then pick 2 mentors of the same gender they would like to be matched with for the rest of the year. These forms will be given to the program manager, who will set the matches while the group plays some organized team sport. Once the matches are set, there will be an announcing ceremony. At the end of the launch course the students and their new mentors will set long and short term goals, and make plans for their first one-on-one time.

The North Beacon Hill Council will light three 40ft trees on SDOT property near the intersection of Beacon Ave & 14th Ave S. The tree lighting will be part of a neighborhood celebration, including food, choirs, and sales/special events at businesses around Beacon Hill. Our goal is to bring the community together in an area of the neighborhood many don't find welcoming.

Project Title: The Kenyon St Right of Way Beautification Project
Project Description: This project will add trees, shrubs, and ground-cover to the unimproved Kenyon St right of way between 14th Ave SW and the alley to the west. These plantings will make the space more beautiful, provide wildlife habitat, improve slope stability, and make the experience of walking the site more enjoyable.  The community will be responsible for maintenance and plants will be mulched to decrease the need for irrigation and prevent weeds and erosion.

Project Title: Othello Station Community Advisory Team Outreach
Project Description: The Othello Station Community Advisory Team, (OSCAT,) will rent Lee House in New Holly for regular monthly meetings for 1 year. OSCAT will invite all members, neighbors, and local ethnic leaders to attend these regular meetings. OSCAT will also invite guest participants from Seattle OED, Seattle DPD, Sound Transit, Homesight, nonprofit and for profit developers, property owners, Community Corner Stones Committees, MLK Business Association, Rainier Chamber of Commerce, and interested academics, to share plans and hear community concerns, hopes and wishes thereby coordinating efforts toward successful transit oriented development in Othello.

Organization Name: Central Neighborhood Association, Central District Association
Project Description: Free holiday party that connects Central District residents, enterprises and businesses. Features kid's crafts, local entertainment by Meter Music school students, cartoons, sing-along, pictures with local hair salon owner Earl Lancaster as Santa, and more. We will provide free pizza, popcorn and lemonade to all.

The PACE project team North by Northeast will lead and organize a neighborhood effort to start a SNAP program for disaster preparedness.  The target area is 2 blocks within the Roosevelt Neighbors' Alliance which is in the University District.  The objective is to reach out to residents to build community while giving them the education and resources to be better prepared in the event of an emergency.  Residents will develop a disaster plan, participate in trainings and in disaster drills.

The PACE Cheers to Chambers event will be held on  Wednesday, February 19th from 4:30-7:30 p.m. at Fremont Studios, 155 North 35th street. This free community market will be a perfect venue for residents, businesses and non profit organizations to meet and connect. There will be 200 information tables, food samples from local restaurants, giveaways, and health demonstrations. Matching Fund supported events are funded on a one time only basis.

An adventure game where teams of 2-4 people solve clever clues and face fun challenges while discovering the Georgetown neighborhood will be held on Saturday, March 15, 2014 from 10am-3pm.  This exciting event is free to the public and is a great way to build awareness and appreciation for the history of the Georgetown community.  Neighborhood Matching Fund supported events are funded on a one time only basis.

PACE Jackson Jazz Walk is scheduled for  Saturday, April 5th from 4-10pm  in several locations along Jackson Street between 23rd Ave S and 16th Ave S.  It is free to the public and will feature combos from the award winning Garfield High School and Washington Middle School Jazz Bands as well as other outstanding performers.  Neighborhood Matching Fund supported events are funded on a one time only basis.

The West African Community  will develop a website as a means of connecting with and reaching out to it's members. A professional web designer will be hired to work the community to develop the most effective tool. Matching Fund supported websites cannot be used for or be linked to fundraising, religious or political content.

The West African Community  will develop a website as a means of connecting with and reaching out to it's members. A professional web designer will be hired to work the community to develop the most effective tool. Matching Fund supported websites cannot be used for or be linked to fundraising, religious or political content.

The Spruce Park Community Commons will host a potluck and gathering for neighbors of the Spruce Park community at the Epstein Building, First Floor Community Room locatered at 905 Spruce St., Seattle, WA  98104 on Saturday March 22, 2014 from 2-4 pm. This gathering will be an opportunity to build neighborhood relationships and create a Community Council.

Hawthorne Hills Community Council will host a special forum in conjunction with its annual meeting to address northeast interest in two timely civic issues:  Funding for Seattle Parks, and the effect of Council District elections on City governance. The forum will be held at the Sand Point Community Church located at 4710 NE 70th Street, Seattle, WA  98115 on March 19, 2014 beginning at 7:30 p.m.

The Connections Conference brings together North Seattle service providers with the goal of promoting collaboration, problem solving, advocacy and resource-sharing. This year's conference will be Wednesday, May 28, 2014, from 8am to noon, at the North Seattle Community College Conference Center. The conference helps service providers feel less isolated in their work and ensures they work less in silos. The goal for this year is 80 service providers in attendance.

The Colman Neighborhood Association will host a facilitated dialogue and community BBQ for residents of the Colman and Jackson Place neighborhoods at the Northwest African American Museum (2300 S Massachusetts St) on Saturday, November 14, from 9:00am to 1:00pm. The goal is to reform the Judkins Park Community Council as a united South Central voice and to increase resident participation in neighborhood activities.

Gardeners from Howell Collective Garden, Hypha (a Seattle plant community project), and youth from Lambert House will grow plant starts at Lambert House, and will host free seedling getaways at Howell Garden in April, June, and fall. Giveaways will also include educational demonstrations, storytelling, ethnobotany, and art. Howell garden members will also build a plant growing shelf at Howell Garden for community use for future getaways.

There will be an Equinox celebration in the newly renovated Rainier Beach Community Clubhouse located at 6038 S. Pilgrim Street on Saturday, March 22, 7:00pm -10:00pm. Snacks and beverages will be provided along with traditional Celtic style family music. Matching Fund supported events are free and open to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

Project Title: Earth Day Storytelling at the Duwamish Longhouse
Project Description: In celebration of Earth Day, the Seattle Storytellers Guild will bring together Native and non-Native storytellers at the Duwamish Tribe's Longhouse in Seattle for a free performance for the general public. Stories and other presentations will relate to our Earth. The event will occur on Sunday, April 13, 2:00-4:00pm, at the Duwamish Longhouse and Cultural Center, 4705 W. Marginal Way SW, Seattle, WA 98106.

Project Title: Lower Kinnear Park Ribbon Cutting Event
Project Description: Celebrate the renovation of Lower Kinnear Park with a variety of entertainment venues to attract members of the community to an official re-opening on April 26, 2014 at 1:00 p.m. in Lower Kinnear Park located at West Roy Street & 6th Avenue West, Seatttle, 98119.

Project Title: Wildwood Bus Shelter Community Clean Up
Project Description: Friends of Wildwood and volunteers will do a neighborhood clean-up and landscaping at the Wildwood bus shelter located at 7700 Rainier Ave. S. (east side). This project is being done as part of Bridge to Beach on Sunday, April 27, between 8:00am and 4:00pm.

A mural will be painted by local neighborhood artists on a 150' by 12' wall owned by Goodwill located at 1324 South Weller Street in the heart of Little Saigon.  The mural will reflect the rich diversity of cultures and talents in the neighborhood. The JPCC will create a MOU with Goodwill that includes a maintenance plan.  The artists are required to sign VARA waivers.

Beacon Hill neighbors will host free monthly screenings and facilitated discussions on documentary films spotlighting social, economic and environmental concerns.  The first screening `More Than Honey` is scheduled for Friday, June 20th at the Seattle Garden House, 2336 - 15th Avenue South at 6:30 pm. Matching Fund supported events are free to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

The Belltown Artwalk will add food and music to the artwalk events May through September. In addition, marketing materials will be developed to advertize these jazzed-up summer artwalk events. The artwalk begins at the Belltown Community Center, 415 Bell St., every second Friday of the month from 6-9 p.m.

Project Title: SACBO 2014, Seattle Art Car Blow Out
Project Description: The Seattle ArtCar Blow Out, a beloved component of the Fremont Fair, will be held June 21& 22 on N. 35th Street in Fremont. It is one of the nation's largest and oldest gatherings of decorated vehicles. Sixty permanently or artistically altered vehicles of all descriptions will be displayed during the Fair. Community members are encouraged to decorate and display their vehicles as well.  Matching Fund supported events are free, open to the public and supported on a one time only basis.

The Rainier Beach Town Hall is a civic engagement opportunity intended to organize the neighborhood and expand membership in Rainier Beach Moving Forward. It will set 2014 priorities for education, economic development, public safety, environment, transportation, and family life. This event gives neighbors a chance to meet and to be a part of making the neighborhood the best it can be. The Town Hall will be held on April 22, 2014 at South Shore K-8, 4800 South Henderson St. from 6-8:30 p.m.

The Leschi Community will gather at Flo Ware Park, 330 - 28th Avenue South, on Saturday, May 10th from 11:00 am-2:00 pm to celebrate the neighborhood's efforts to restore the park to a place where children can safely play. The character of the neighborhood has changed from one where gang activity was the norm to a quiet place where families with young children can feel safe and be celebrated.   Matching Fund supported events are free, open to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

Project Title: Licton Spring P-Patch Small Sparks Grant Request
Project Description: The Friends of Licton Springs P-Patch will make physical improvements to the Licton Springs P-Patch located at College Way N and N 92nd St.  The improvements will consist of repairing the exterior of the toolshed and installing native plants in the communal areas of the garden.  These activities will take place during the fall of 2015.

Project Title: 37th Ave S And S Juneau St Traffic Circle Clean Up
Project Description: The traffic circle at the intersection of 37th Ave S and S Juneau St is in a sad state. It is a mess with nothing but dead plants and garbage. We would like to fix it clean it and plant some flowers to make it look presentable.

Project Title: Spring Clean Seattle Stairways - Rainier Beach
Project Description: As an inhancement to a great walkable neighborhood, community members will remove invasive species, clear side drains, remove moss and trash at five hostoric staircases along Rainier Avenue South.  This project will promote community building in a diverse neighborhood.  The cleaning will begin on Saturday, April 27, 2014 from approximately 10am-3pm.  The staircases are along Rainier Avenue South from Redwing, Pilgrim, Norfolk, Cooper and Thayer streets.

Our neighborhood in partnership with Bridge to Beach clean up will be cleaning up on Sunday, April 27, 2014 from 9am - 4pm. We are requesting funds to have food and drink and music celebration during and after the clean up. The celebration will be held at the clean up site (S. Kenyon & Renton Ave. S., SE corner planting strip) and at 4607 S Chicago Street (nearby residence). Celebration is free and open to the neighborhood.

The Compassion Activation Station will be held on Sunday, April 27, 11:30am-6:30pm, as part of an Earth Day event at Seattle University's Pigott Hall: `Connecting the Dots: Compassinate Communities Fostering Climate, Social, & Economic Justice.` Artists will engage the public in free workshops and art-making activities (fish puppets, batik hearts, butterfly flags, etc.).

Project Title: Hillman City Bridge 2 Beach Earth Day Clean-Up
Project Description: We will clean up the main business corridor on Rainier Ave S from Lucille St/Findlay St to Mead St (near 5600 Rainier Ave. S). We will empty 21 neglected concrete flower planters that line the street curbs, drain them, clean/paint them, and plant new plants in them. We also will weed the areas around the trees that line the corridor and put mulch in. This project will be done as part of the Bridge to Beach Rainier Valley community-wide clean up on Sunday, April 27, 2014 from 8am - 4pm.

Project Title: Corner of Kenyon & Renton Beautification Project
Project Description: Install a planting area, plant 1-2 trees and shrubs, 2 4 x 8 edible planting boxes (plant community raspberry patch), and 40% pavers patio area in current planting strip area between curb and sidewalk at the SE corner of S. Kenyon St and Renton Ave S (7900 Renton Ave S).  Put community bulletin boards on side of Victory Grocery (approved by grocery). Permits from SDOT Urban Forestry (obtained) and Street Use (in process) required. This project will be done on Sunday Ap. 27, 8am - 4pm.

As part of the Bridge to Beach Neighborhood Improvement Program, on April 27, 2014 the LSPCC will install new plantings, new wood chips, and a small fence and a trellis on the LSPCC grounds located at 4919 S Angeline St.

Project Title: Clean up Seattle Housing Authority's Othello Site
Project Description: A group of Othello neighbors will beautify the Seattle Housing Authority-owned site (vacant lot) at the Southwest corner of MLK and Othello and prepare it for art. They will pick up litter and install signs with the new Othello neighborhood logo.  This will be done as part of Bridge to Beach Cleanup on Sunday, April 27, 2014, between 8:00am and 4:00pm.  They have approval from SHA to do this and have Seattle Neighborhood Group as the fiscal sponsor.

Project Title: A Project to beautify a park in Hillman City
Project Description: The Hillman City Park & Garden is a project to beautify a 4,000 square foot park in the heart of the Hillman City Community. Guided by the principles of The Hillman City Collaboratory, this park continues to transform into a location for social growth, community building and a space with the ability to provide for the neighborhood.

The project consists of cleaning and landscaping a planting strip within the right-of-way in front of Neighborcare Health Rainier Beach Medical Clinic (9245 Rainier Ave. S.). Activities include cleaning, sweeping, pulling weeds, removing blackberry bushes, planting flowers, etc. No work will be done on private property. This clean up will be done as part of Bridge to Beach on Sunday, April 27, between 12:00pm and 4:00pm. SDOT has approved.

Project Title: 3 HAM Radios for Emergency Preparedness in Fremont
Project Description: “Resilient Fremont” has been the rep. for Fremont in the HubCaps emergency preparedness group for several years. HubCaps are working with the City of Seattle to develop a communication network within/between neighborhoods, and with the City’s EOC. The initial program was built around GMRS radios. Because of new technology and needs of the group the preferred radio technology is now HAM. Resilient Fremont would like to acquire 3 sets of HAM radios as recommended by the groups’ radio leadership.

Project Title: Storage Box for Morgan Junction Park
Project Description: Friends of Morgan Junction Park will purchase and install one steel storage box for Morgan Junction Park at 6373 California Ave SW. This will house tools, tents for community events, and an emergency hub kit. Funds will also be used to buy a tool tray and folding table to be housed in the box. A celebration event will be held within 1 or 2 months of placement. Event details will be provided to the NMF project manager and posted on the DON Neighborhood Events calendar.

Project Title: New Holly Somali Family Cultural Event
Project Description: The Somali Family Safety Task Force will be hosting a Cultural Arts Exhibit and Demonstration, that involves youth, women and seniors to be held at the New Holly Gathering Hall, 7054 32nd Ave South on Friday June 6, from 4pm till midnight. The event will include traditional Somali storytelling, poetry, crafts, and activities to keep Somali culture alive and vibrant. Neighborhood Matching Fund events are free, open to the public and supported on a one time only basis.

Project Title: Bike Tools for DIY Repair Workshops
Project Description: Tools will be purchased to use for free workshops where community members can learn how to repair and maintain bicycles. The workshops will be held from June - September 2014 at the West Seattle Tool Library at Youngstown, 4408 Delridge Way SW, and led by volunteers with knowledge and experience in bicycle repair. The toolkits will also be available to Tool Library members to use through the tool lending program, and will also be used to offer free bike repair during summer festivals and events.

A town hall style event will be held on May 28 at 7:00 p.m. to announce Lake City Future First (LCFF) - a group of residents, businesses & organizations working to create a sustainable organization,engage businesses, and develop a strategic plan through a common vision. Organizations serving Lake City will display information about projects and programs and ask the community their vision for Lake City. The event wil be at the Elliott Bay Brewery located at 12537 Lake City Way NE.

Project Title: Center of Universe Art & Architect Design Studio
Project Description: Intern architects will provide an art and architecture design studio for 25 middle and high school students. Students will be recruited from nearby public and private schools. The students will tour Fremont architecture and visit local businesses, design an architectural project that incorporates art, and give public presentations to which other architects and business leaders will be invited. The studio will occur on [REVISE] 5 Weds, June 25 - July 23, from 1 to 3:30pm, at the Fremont Library.

To build a structure at the Queen Pea P-Patch at 5th Ave N & Howe St in Trolley Hill Park that will meet city codes for honey bee hive placement.  This will allow the community to learn the value of pollinators and the role they play in the food we eat.  It will also provide an opportunity to see safely and up close how fragile these important creatures are and create awareness for how we can take actions to protect them and ourselves from harmful chemicals in the environment.

The New Holly Kids Soccer Project is a community-based soccer program for kids ages 5 to 12. It will take place at Van Asselt Playfield at 7200 Beacon Ave S, starting August 2nd through September 28, 2014. Families at the NewHolly campus are leading this grassroots effort because they want their children to become healthy and productive citizens. The children will participate in physical exercise, community building, multicultural socializing, and learning appropriate competitive skills.

The Summer Smash is a neighborhood party to welcome the new Licton Springs P-Patch, located on the campus of North Seattle Community College, to the neighborhood. The event will be July 12, 2014, from 10:00am to 1:00pm. Food, music, and children's activities will be included.  NMF funded events are free and open to the public.  They are funded on a one time only basis.
We will celebrate Neighborhood Night Out from 6-9pm at 345 N 102nd between Dayton and Greenwood on 102nd. This community gathering will include food, music and a kids bike parade to Evanston P-Patch.

On July 12th from 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm the neighbors of NW 65th Street will gather to host a block party that showcases and celebrates the talents of the neighborhood at large.   There will be cream pie jousting, a Spam carving contest, five local bands, face painting, games, an outdoor movie, a barbeque, locally made art on display, and a potluck. NMF funded are free and open to the public.  They are funded on a one time only basis.

On July 20, 2014 at the 46th St and Bridge Way Murals. We will bring neighbors together for a one-day community clean up and hold a celebration to meet our new residents of Patrick Place Apartments of Catholic Community Service. The clean-up will happen at 46th Street and Bridge Way Murals and the community celebration will take place at the Patrick Place Apartments located at 4251 Aurora Avenue N from 5pm-7pm.

The 5900 44th Ave SW Block Watch group will host a Night Out block party on August 5, 2014 from 5pm to 8pm between SW Juneau St and SW Raymond St on 44th Ave SW.  This festive event will feature food, music, and children's activities.  Neighbors will enjoy getting to know each other better and enhancing community safety. NMF funded events are free and open to the public.  They are funded on a one time only basis.

Dreams Unlimited will host an interactive multimedia performance at the Langston Hughes Performing Arts Institute on July 12, 2014 from 7:00pm - 9:00pm.  The purpose is to spread awareness among and between immigrant communities in Seattle.  Local artists will share inspiration, hopes, and dreams through films, photos, music, spoken word performances, and traditional oral storytelling.  NMF funded events are free and open to the public.  They are funded on a one time only basis.

We will be hosting a Night Out event between NE 125th and NE 130th St on 33rd Avenue NE on August 5, 2014 from 6:30pm to 8pm to bring neighbors in the area together to get to know each other, and in doing so promote crime prevention, safety, a sense of community, keeping the neighborhood clean, and emergency preparedness.

Project Title: Seattle Night Out - Neighborhood BBQ and Clean Up
Project Description: On August 5, 2014 we will celebrate Night Out with a neighborhood clean-up and barbecue. The clean-up will start at 6pm, at 3613 S Juneau St and then proceed to 42 Ave S. The clean-up will conclude with a neighborhood barbecue that will start 7-9pm at the Brighton Playfield 6000 39th Ave S that will include games and prizes.

We will celebrate Night Out on August 5, 2014 from 6pm to 10pm at 6700 block on Murray Ave SW between SW Holly St and Lincoln Park Way SW for a community gathering and clean-up. We will come together for a clean-up, afterwards we will gather for food and drinks, and blockwatch discussions about how to be involved in the neighborhood and crime prevention.

We will celebrate Night Out on August 5 from 6pm to 10pm on the 3600 block on 32nd Ave W by closing the street between W Ruffner St and W Emerson St. We will bring the community together with a gathering that includes music, food and  discussions about crime prevention and neighborhood participation. We will be reaching out to our neighbors with informational fliers and posters.

Project Title: Night Out Block Party and Cleanup 2014
Project Description: The 27th and Spring Block Watch will host a Night Out block party on August 5, 2014 from 6pm to 9pm on 27th Ave between E Spring St and E Marion St. Neighbors will share food, socialize, clean up the neighborhood, and share information about safe communities, block watch activities, and emergency preparedness issues.  NMF funded events are free and open to the public.  They are funded on a one time only basis.

We are having our Annual Lockmore Night Out Event August 5, 2014 at 27th Ave S & Dawson St from 6-9pm to encourage community involvement in crime prevention in our neighborhood. There will be a gathering of information about emergency preparedness, celebrating with live music, a visit from the Captain of South Precinct, Hoola-hoop making, a bike parade for kids, and a cake from local bakery for a sweet ending!

The Rainier Community Advisory Council will host a Neighborhood Night Out event on August 5, 2014 from 5pm to 9pm at the Rainier Community Center located at 4600 38th Ave S.  A community barbeque, games, children's activities, and informational booths will bring people from the neighborhood together in a festive picnic atmosphere. NMF funded events are free and open to the public. They are funded on a one time only basis.

Project Title: 90th Anniversary First Flight Around the World 2014
Organization Name: Friends of NAS Seattle Historic District
Project Description: A free celebration of the 90th anniversary of the landing of the First Flight Around the World, which took place on September 28, 1924. Our celebration will take place on September 28, 2014, at the Northshore Recreation Area at Magnuson Park, located at 7400 Sandpoint Way NE. The celebration will be from Noon to 2:00pm and will include speeches, a memorial tribute, music, and a historic district tour. The highlight  being the arrival of a Douglas World Cruiser reproduction airplane at 1:30pm.

The 49th Ave SW Neighborhood Group will host a National Night Out block party on August 5, 2014 from 6pm to 9pm between SW Andover St and SW Dakota St on 49th Ave SW.  There will be a barbeque, a raffle with small prizes, education materials about emergency preparedness, and conversations about crime prevention.  The neighbors will also update the block watch list.  NMF funded events are free and open to the public.  They are funded on a one time only basis.

Project Title: Night Out Block Party and Neighborhood Outreach
Project Description: We will celebrate Night Out on August 5, 2014 from 6pm to 10pm by closing the street between S Lucile and S Bennett on the 5300 block on 16th Ave S. To build a sense of community we will have music, barbecue, and blockwatch discussions. To encourage community participation we will deliver invitations and  flyers to each household.

We are organizing an event for the community to gather and dance to Michael Jackson's Thriller in Ballard Commons Park on October 24, 2015 at 1:00 p.m. This is a world wide event to celebrate dance and health!

Project Title: Night Out Community Gathering and Safety Fair
Project Description: The Friends of 23rd Avenue NW will hold a Night Out block party event on August 5, 2014 from 6pm to 10pm on 23rd Ave NW between NW 75th St and NW 77th St. This event will build a stronger community and connect neighbors to safety resources. This family-friendly event will include a potluck, children's activities, and entertainment. A neighborhood contact list will be generated.  NMF funded events are free and open to the public.  They are funded on a one time only basis.

We are hosting our first National Night Out block party on August 5, 2014 from 6pm to 10pm in Junction Plaza Park, located at 42nd Ave SW and SW Alaska St.  We will engage and build relationships between the community and city services such as, Fire, Police, and Emergency Management.  Our purpose is to reduce crime, improve public safety and do outreach during the block party.  We will have food, informational handouts, trinkets, games and prizes for kids.

The neighborhood group 28/70 NW will host a Night Out block party on August 5, 2014 from 6pm to 10pm on 70th Ave NW between 28th Ave NW and 30th Ave NW. This event will include sharing information and materials about disaster preparedness and neighborhood crime prevention.  There will also be food and music so neighbors can have fun while strengthening community connections. NMF funded events are free and open to the public. They are funded on a one time only basis.

We will celebrate Night Out on August 5, 2014, from 6pm to 10pm on 23rd Ave SW between SW Roxbury and SW Barton. There will be a potluck to bring neighbors together to talk about disaster emergency prep and our neighborhood plan. Emergency starter kits that include printed copies of neighbors' phone lists will be distributed.

The Friends of Brighton will host a Night Out block party on August 5, 2014 from 6pm to 9pm on S Holly St between Rainier Ave S and 51st Ave S.  Neighbors will enjoy socializing and participating in craft projects.  There will be a barbeque and an ice cream social.  NMF funded events are free and open to the public.  They are funded on a one time only basis.

We the 22nd Ave Block Watch will celebrate Night Out on August 5 from 6-10pm by closing the street between Fir and Spruce on 22nd Ave. There will be performances by neighborhood musicians, distributing block watch information and crime watch discussions. To encourage community participation we will hand deliver invitations and informational fliers to each household one month prior to Night Out.

The Delridge Youth Coalition will host a teen dance competition on September 6, 2014 from 5pm to 9pm at 4401 42nd Ave SW.  This event will encourage youth aged 13 to 18 to build community, cultivate friendships, and embrace diversity. The competition will feature various performances and prizes will be offered.  NMF funded events are free and open to the public.  They are funded on a one time only basis.

The new North Rainier Vista blockwatch group is hosting a Night Out community block event on Tuesday, August 5, 6pm to 9pm, at Rainier Vista's Central Park.  This is an event for neighbors to learn about community safety and to get to know one another.  They hope to have SPD and other city departments at the event. There will be outreach and interpreters at the event in various languages.

First-ever Night Out event on Tuesday, August 5, 2014 6pm-10pm, for the South Fletcher Neighborhood in Rainier Beach, which includes approximately 60 single-family residences. Neighbors will gather in the street (5900 block of S. Fletcher St.) to promote goodwill and solidarity in preventing crime and learn about emergency preparedness.

The community group Nibs Fest will host NibsFest 500 on August 5, 2014 from 7pm to 9pm at the Fremont Abbey Arts Center located at 4272 Fremont Ave N. This unique Night Out event will feature visual art, music, storytelling, food, and poetry in celebration of the surrounding community.  NMF funded events are free and open to the public.  They are funded on a one time only basis.

Project Title: CEASEFIRE Seattle | Crusade Against Gun Violence
Project Description: CEASEFIRE Seattle: A Crusade Against Gun Violence, is a community oriented event, geared towards underserved youth and adults coming together to raise their voice in unity in the fight against gun violence, through a picnic style event. Community Leaders, Members and Youth who have been affected by gun violence directly, will speak on their experiences, share their stories, and community resources available for those in need.

Project Title: The World on 44th Pl S. Block Party
Project Description: The 44th Pl S Block Watch Group will hold a block party on August 10, 2014 from 2pm to 7pm on 44th Pl S between S Kenyon St and S Rose St. The community members will celebrate diversity by sharing food, music, dance, and games representing their various cultures. There will be an `Around the World` themed potluck, live entertainment, art activities, and children's games.  NMF funded events are free and open to the public.  They are funded on a one time only basis.

Organization Name: The Greater Queen Anne Chamber of Commerce
Project Description: The Greater Queen Anne Chamber of Commerce will host an end of summer Queen Anne Art Walk event on September 17, 2014 from 3pm to 9pm at Counterbalance Park located at 2 Roy St.  Community members will enjoy refreshments while getting better acquainted with their neighbors and the local business community.

The Friends of ROOTS Voices will conduct and record community interviews on August 31, 2014 from 10am to 5pm at 2400 S Massachusetts St. This intergenerational cultural heritage project will connect people who are gathered together at the Relatives of Old Timers (ROOTS) picnic to collect the stories of African American community members.  The stories will be permanently archived at the Black Heritage Society archives at the Museum of History and Industry in Seattle.

Project Title: Banners for Madison Park Art Walk
Project Description: The Madison Park Art Walk Association will design and purchase two banners to promote the Madison Park Art Walk, which will be held from September 12 through September 24, 2014 in the Madison Park business district located between the streets of 43rd Ave E, E Newton St, McGilvra Blvd E, and E Garfield St.  This community event will bring together the local community of artists, neighbors, and businesses.  The Madison Park Art Walk is free and open to the public.

The Making Connections Committee will host a community back to school event on August 30, 2014 from 12pm to 3pm at Seward Park located at 5895 Lake Washington Blvd S.  There will be food, live music, and games.  School supplies will be distributed.  NMF funded events are free and open to the public.  They are funded on a one time only basis.

Rainier Vista East New Development will have a  community celebration/potluck on September 6, 2014 from 4pm to 7pm. Rainier Vista East is part of the greater Rainier Vista planned community development.  It is a diverse community with a mix of renters and owners from all over the world. This celebration is a great opportunity to engage our neighbors and get to know one another and address issues that affect our community. There will be food and music and discussions on community involvement.

Project Title: Rainier Valley Cooperative Preschool Fall Community Festival
Organization Name: Friends of Rainier Valley Cooperative Preschool
Project Description: Friends of Rainier Valley Cooperative Preschool will host a community fall festival that is free and open to the public on Saturday, October 4, 2014, from 10am to 2pm, on Roberto Maestas Festival St in Beacon Hill (S. Lander St. between 16th & 17th Aves. S.). This event will feature face painting, a bike rodeo, and music and dance performances. Families from Beacon Hill and surrounding neighborhoods will have the chance to build community and learn about the preschool's programs.

Project Title: Beautification of the Welcome to Magnolia areas
Project Description: The Magnolia Chamber of Commerce will clean up and remove weeds and diseased & dead nursery stock and replace with new nursery stock in the areas around two Welome to Magnolia signs.

The South Seattle Community Media Coalition will host a free community gathering on Saturday, October 18, 6:00pm-9:00pm at the Hillman City Collaboratory (5623 Rainier Ave S).  The purpose of the gathering is to allow residents to engage in constructive dialogues about media perceptions of the South Seattle area and how these perceptions can be improved by citizen journalism and active civic engagement.

Project Title: Community Pride - A New Sign and Repairs
Organization Name: Friends of the Jackson Park P-Patch
Project Description: Friends of the Jackson Park P-Patch will repair five raised beds and build and install a new P-Patch sign.  We will also have a volunteer event and sign dedication on October 26, 2014 from 12:00pm to 3:00pm at the Jackson Park P-Patch located at 13049 10th Ave NE.

Project Title: Fall Pumpkin Carving and Community Fitness Outreach
Project Description: Au Lac Vovinam will host a pumpkin carving and youth fitness outreach event on October 25, 2014 from 5pm to 8pm at the High Point Neighborhood House located at 6400 Sylvan Way SW. Participants will enjoy food, carving a pumpkin to take home, and seeing a Vietnamese martial arts demonstration led by Au Lac Vovinam.  They will also be invited to participate in the free youth martial arts lessons that Au Lac Vovinam offers every weekend at the High Point Neighborhood House.

On Friday, October 24, 2014 at 1012 SW Trenton St. from 5pm to 8pm the Highland Park Elementary PTA will be having a Fall Festival. It is a community gathering event that invites both the school and the surrounding community. The event is free and open to everyone. There will be food and drinks and live entertainment. We believe this gathering will be a great way to bring the community together to improve morale and getting more people involved to talk about issues.

Project Title: Sharing the City's Art Collection w/ New Audiences
Organization Name: Sand Point Arts and Cultural Exchange
Project Description: Invite the community to a grand opening reception of the new public gallery in Building 30 of Magnuson Park on October 26, 2014 from 4:00pm to 6:00pm. Show will feature works of art on loan from the City's 1% for art collection which will be seen in a park environment for the first time. The project includes outreach to nearby public schools.

The free performance is a dance piece influenced by the book “Le Petite Prince`. The project is an afternoon matinee at the Fremont Abbey Arts Center on November 7, 2014 at 2:00 p.m. The matinee is a FREE performance open to the public.

Project Title: Arbor Heights/Boren Fall Harvest Clean Up Party
Organization Name: Arbor Heights Family Engagement Action Team
Project Description: The Arbor Heights Science and Environmental Educattion Team will host a community-building event at the Boren School (5950 Delridge Way SW) on Saturday, November 8, 2014, 10:00am-1:00pm. This work party will improve the planting and hands-on learning areas around the school building. A seed-saving library will also be started with small enrichment activities. A goal is to bring together both the K-5 STEM and Arbor Heights school communities and the larger Delridge Way/Longfellow Creek community.

The ad hoc group Trees for 29th will remove twenty eight existing diseased trees from the planting strip on 29th Avenue between Marion St and Spring St on the estimated date of November 14, 2014. The stumps will be ground in preparation for replacing the removed trees with healthy crab apple trees. The healthy trees will increase the tree canopy, provide habitat for birds, and will beautify the street.  This neighborhood transformation will be of benefit to all neighbors for generations.

This community project involves litter clean-up, weeding and mulching of a parcel of SDOT right-of-way, followed by planting on the parcel. The goal is to provide a pocket park as part of a busy neighborhood business district.   SDOT has approved the project and will be working with the group.

Outcomes:
1) 20 Volunteers will participate in community beautification activities.
2)  Business leaders and residents will take ownership in maintaining the newly established pocket park.

Project Title: New Holly Somali Women's Sewing Group
Project Description: The New Holly Seattle Woman’s Sewing Project will organize a group of 10 low-income refugee women at the New Holly Community Center, 7054 32nd Ave S starting November 8, 2014. They will attend a 2 hour class once a week for 8 weeks. The sewing project will allow isolated refugee women to connect to each other. Through their shared interest of sewing, social ties are strengthen and community is built.

Project Title: Growing Up Brown: Remembering Washington Hall
Organization Name: Seattle Filipino Pioneers Celebration Planning Committee
Project Description: The ad hoc community group Seattle Filipino Pioneers Celebration Planning Committee will host a cultural history event on December 5, 2014 from 6pm to 9pm at the Immaculate Conception Church located at 820 18th Ave.  Food, community panelists, and a video screening of the documentary `Remembering Washington Hall` will be featured.  The purpose of the event is to increase awareness about the history of the Filipino-American community in the Central District.

Project Title: Conversational Arabic Language at New Holly
Project Description: The Conversational Arabic Language Group will hold a pilot 12-week Arabic class for 25 people at the New Holly Gathering Hall (7054 32nd Ave S) between December 28, 2014, and March 15, 2015. Weekly 3-hour Sunday sessions will teach New Holly residents and others to read, write, and speak in the Arabic language. The class will be an opportunity to develop appreciation for Arabic language learning and build community across cultures. Class materials will be retained for community use at the Hall.
The Belltown Bulbers will plant 2000 bulbs (500 per block) in Bell Street Park on Saturday November 15, 2014.

Project Title: Rainier Beach Holiday Store Front Challenge
Project Description: The Holiday Storefront Challenge is an event sponsored by the Rainier Beach Merchants Association. As a community and safe-streets building effort, stores along Rainier Ave S. from S. Henderson to “Old Town” Rainier Beach at 57th Ave S. are challenged to decorate their storefronts with community groups, local artists, or with their own creative energy. Awards for best displays will be voted on by the community at a celebratory event on December 5, 2014 at 3:00 p.m. at South Shore High School.

The Capitol Hill Community Council will host a winter open house on Thursday, December 18, 6:30pm - 9:00pm, at the Cal Anderson Park Shelter House as a community-building, meet-your-neighbors, and information-gathering event on community needs and desires. The identified priorities will help the Capitol Hill Community Council apply for a Small & Simple grant or other funding opportunity.

Project Title: Playspace and Workshop Site Preparation & Design
Project Description: Seattle ReCreative will make site improvements to their facility located at 8408 Greenwood Avenue N on December 20, 2014 from 10am to 4pm.  The areas to be improved are the indoor children's play space and the community workshop area.  Both of these areas will be free and open the public as part of Seattle ReCreative programming, which focuses on promoting art, creativity, environmental sustainability, and community building.

TEXTure is a collaboration between diverse visual artists and poets culminating in an exhibition of new work at METHOD Gallery and an Artist Panel public event at the Central Seattle Public Library on January 29th, 6:00-9:00 pm. A catalogue documenting the process with art, writing, and profiles will be available free to the public and accessible in the permanent library collection. Exhibit dates: Jan 8-Feb 21, 2015.  All NMF supported events are free and funded on a one time only basis.

Upper Rainier Beach Gardeners will plant a garden and containers and add irrigation at the Rainer Beach Community Club building (6038 S Pilgrim St). Work parties will be held in February and March, with a culminating community garden tour during the last weekend in June. Event details will be provided to the NMF project manager and posted on the DON Neighborhood Event Calendar online.

Organization Name: Arbor Heights Family Engagement Action Team
Project Description: The Family Engagement and Action Team (FEAT) of Arbor Heights Elementary will host a community wide Multicultural Night on February 6, 2015 from 6PM to 9PM at 5950 Delridge Way SW.  The goal is to produce a joyful family friendly event that celebrates  the diversity within the Arbor Heights neighborhood.   Matching Fund supported events are free, open to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

Au Lac Vovinam will attend and perform during the annual Tet in Seattle event (free and open to the public) on February 21st and 22nd, 2015 at the Seattle Center in order to share an important aspect of Vietnamese culture to the public through Vovinam’s teachings.

Lowell Elementary located at 1058 E. Mercer St. will be hosting Heritage Day that is tentatively scheduled for February 26, 2015, 6:00 to 8:00pm. 
The diverse student population representing multiple cultures will share their stories with family, friends and community through the creative display of their personal heritage project. The community will share a potluck dinner representing the different cultures and background.

Hearts for Humanity is a self-esteem building program through salon and spa treatments for the  homeless, the disabled, victims of domestic violence, and cancer patients. We will have a planning retreat on May 2nd at the Douglas Truth Library 2300 E. Yesler Way and a volunteer beautician recruitment event on May 3rd at the Central Area Senior Center 500 30th Ave. S. Events both days begin at 1:00 p.m.

Project Title: `Rainier Beach: A Beautiful Safe Place for Youth`
Organization Name: Rainier Beach: A Beautiful Safe Place for Youth Branding Committee
Project Description: Rainier Beach: A Beautiful Safe Place for Youth (ABSPY) Branding Committee will hire a graphic designer to make a logo for youth violence prevention activities. The ABSPY initiative focuses on five Rainier Beach hot spots, and its goal is to improve the quality of life and economic prospects for Rainier Beach youth. A `corner greeters` community event will be held at the Rainier & Henderson Plaza on March 30 from 4:30 to 6:00pm. Details of other events will be provided to NMF project manager.

Project Title: `FIRST LOOK FORUM`:  Who's Running in District 4?
Project Description: Hawthorne Hills and View Ridge Community Councils will jointly sponsor a District 4 candidates forum to introduce declared candidates to the voters and residents of our two neighborhoods. The forum will be held on March 18, 2015 at 7:30 p.m. at the Sand Point Community Church's Perry Hall - 4710 NE 70th Street.

Project Title: Rejuvenate the Greenwood Community Council Website
Project Description: The Greenwood Community Council will engage a web consultant to make our website more useful and interactive to support connections and dialogue within the community of active Greenwood citizens.

Organization Name: Committee to Celebrate 1965 U.S. Immigration Law
Project Description: The ad hoc group Committee to Celebrate 1965 U.S. Immigration Law will create and display a historical photo exhibit to educate the public about how the 1965 U.S. Immigration Law has impacted the Filipino American community in Seattle.  The exhibit will be displayed at the Pagdiriwang Festal Celebration to be held June 6 and 7, 2015 from 10am - 5pm at the Seattle Center Armory Building located at 305 Harrison St.

Project Title: Earth Day Storytelling:  New Seeds, New Growth
Project Description: In celebration of Earth Day, the Seattle Storytellers Guild will bring together Native and non-Native storytellers at the West Duwamish Longhouse (4705 W Marginal Way SW) on Sunday, April 19, 2:00-4:00pm, for a free performance for the general public. This new project has a youth focus: youth will participate in storytelling and also tell the story and show a video of a mural they created at the Youngstown Cultural Arts Center that was inspired by a Native story about the Duwamish River.

Othello Park Alliance will remove weeds and garbage from tree wells in front of businesses between S. Othello and S. Myrtle Streets on the west side of Martin Luther King Way S. Gravel will be put on top. This clean-up, approved by SDOT, will be done on Saturday, April 25, 2015 9am - noon, as part of Bridge to Beach. This will help enhance the Othello business district where facades have recently been improved.

This project will provide the Rainier Beach community with valuable training, information, and emergency equipment such as first aid kits, water filtration system, to be utilized in case of a disaster.

The Share and Play Steering Committee will create and maintain a public sharing bin at the Ballard Community Center located at 6020 28th Ave NW from June to August 2015.  The bin will promote sharing and conservation by providing a place for neighbors to share toys and clothes with other families for free.  Up to three other bins may be added in other public locations in Ballard. Brochures will be created to encourage use of the bins.  Access to the bins will be free and open to the public.

Skate Like a Girl will organize `The Wheels of Fortune Welcome Party,` an all ages meet-and-skate-with-girls-from-all-over-the-world event on Friday, May 1, 2015 from 7pm to 10pm, at Hilliard's Brewery, 1550 NW 49th St.  The event is free and open to the public. The goal is to allow skateboarders and non-skateboarders to mix and mingle. There will be music bands and skateboarding demonstrations. No part of the award will be used for beer, and no people who have had beer will be allowed to skate.

On April 25, 2015 between Noon and 4pm at Brighton Park located at 6000 39th Ave S, the Sisters of South Seattle will have a Spring Fair to raise health awareness in their community. The aim of this event is to bring together the many diverse groups that make up the Brighton  community. There will be various workshops on healthcare and many games and activities for children.

The African American Community Alliance, Black female SPD officers and Parks and Recreation have partnered to provide educational and social activities to marginalized youths. 
On May 9, 2015 at 3pm a workshop will be held at the Garfield Teen Life Center. On May 16, 2015 the participants will be able to attend the Pompeii exhibit. The community report back will happen on May 20, 2015 at 5pm participants will give presentations and share what they learned from the workshop and exhibit.

Make Music Seattle is part of a free world-wide music celebration held on Summer Solstice, June 21st. Launched in 1982 in France, it is now held in more than 700 cities. Completely different from typical music festivals, Make Music Seattle is open to anyone who wants to take part. Music makers young and old, amateur, professional, and all genres.  The Make Music Seattle event will be held at the Seattle Center from 9am-11pm and at additional venues as can be added with on-going fundraising.

To help reduce isolation and loneliness for senior citizens in the New Holly community. The New Holly Senior Social will hold twice a month social activities at the Lee house located at 7315 39th Ave South at New Holly Neighborhood Campus. The purpose of the socials is to create opportunities for seniors in the New Holly community for friendship, support and to enhance fitness by engaging in age and fitness-level appropriate physical activity.

The Share and Play Steering Committee will create and maintain a public sharing bin at the Ballard Community Center located at 6020 28th Ave NW from June to August 2015.  The bin will promote sharing and conservation by providing a place for neighbors to share toys and clothes with other families for free.  Up to three other bins may be added in other public locations in Ballard. Brochures will be created to encourage use of the bins.  Access to the bins will be free and open to the public.

Project Title: Sirens of Serpentine - West Seattle Mermaid Parade
Project Description: The mermaid parade is a free open participation community art event. Parade participants will meet in costume at the Alki Boat house at 11 am on Saturday, May 30, 2015 for a water themed dance installation by Sirens of Serpentine performed to live harp music. The entire group will then parade the Alki Beach Trail to the site of the old Luna Park. Everyone is welcome.  Matching Fund supported events are funded on a one time only basis.

Project Title: District 4 Candidates Forum - NE Seattle, June 17
Project Description: This is a Candidates Forum for Seattle City Council candidates from District 4, and is open to the public.  The forum will take place on Wednesday, June 17, 2015 at the University Heights Center at 6pm.  The forum will be 1.5 hours long and community members will be given the opportunity to meet and to hear the candidates positions and ask questions.

The South Park Candidate Forum Committee will organize a community forum for Seattle City Council District 1 candidates on Wednesday, May 27, 7:00 - 9:00pm, at the South Park Neighborhood Center, 8201 10th Ave. S. The forum will provide an opportunity for South Park residents and other stakeholders to engage with candidates running for Seattle City Council District 1. Spanish interpretation and printed materials will be provided.

The 2015 Walk for Change will encourage, provoke and inspire fathers to view fatherhood as a powerful entity that is strong enough to invoke change. Families will walk the HOT SPOTS of Rainier Beach together as a symbol of unity on Saturday, June 27th, registration begins at 9 am, the walk starts at 11:00, followed by food and other activities. All activities begin at the Rainier Beach Community Center, 8825 Rainier Avenue South.

Hearts for Humanity is a self-esteem building program through salon and spa treatments for the  homeless, the disabled, victims of domestic violence, and cancer patients. We will have a planning retreat on May 2nd at the Douglas Truth Library 2300 E. Yesler Way and a volunteer beautician recruitment event on May 3rd at the Central Area Senior Center 500 30th Ave. S. Events both days begin at 1:00 p.m.

Organization Name: Rainier Beach: A Beautiful Safe Place for Youth Branding Committee
Project Description: Rainier Beach: A Beautiful Safe Place for Youth (ABSPY) Branding Committee will hire a graphic designer to make a logo for youth violence prevention activities. Spanish interpretation and printed materials will be provided.
