Families will walk the HOT SPOTS of Rainier Beach together as a symbol of unity on Saturday, June 27th, registration begins at 9 am, the walk starts at 11:00, followed by food and other activities. All activities begin at the Rainier Beach Community Center, 8825 Rainier Avenue South.
A community clean-up and spruce-up of Morningside Park on June 27, 2015. This is one of only two open spaces near our core neighborhood of Wedgwood.

Friends of SLU Youth will organize the SLU-Cascade Youth Tech Project to bring South Lake Union’s strong tech talent and resources to youth who may not have access to tech-based learning opportunities. Up to 18 school-aged youth will participate in robotics education sessions from 5:30 to 7:30pm every Wednesday in July 2015 at 415 Westlake, culminating in a community celebration on Wednesday, July 29, also at 415 Westlake. Stipends will be given to the youth who complete the project.

Project Title: Georgetown Historic Sites Plaque Map & Open House
Project Description: The Friends of Georgetown History would like to showcase Georgetown Historic Sites at the upcoming Georgetown Garden Walk on July 12, 2015.  We would like to create a map with the location of all the plaques we installed at various historic sites and the open house at our new History Museum at 6206 Carleton Ave S. The maps will serve a dual purpose of the map as well as a hand fan to beat the heat of a hot July day.

Coinciding with the Ballard Seafood Fest on July 11, 2015, Fest-Bowl is a youth sport event that takes place at the skateboard facility in Ballard Commons Park.  It will attract youth ages 5 and up for a variety of skateboarding activities including:

1. clinics and instruction
2. skills showcase
3. timed slalom race
4. bowl competitions

This event promotes self-expression, creativity and individuality while building skateboard skills and camaraderie between participants.

Whittier Heights Involved Neighbors (WHIN) will organize a family festival at Kirke Park - 7028 9th Ave NW on Saturday, August 8, 2015, from 11:00am to 3:00pm.  The festival will feature arts, crafts, food and drinks, free guitar lessons and possibly yoga and gardening tutorials, a kids' bike parade, and live musical performances from a local kids' band.  The hope is that this becomes an annual event for our neighborhood in which the community can get together.

A neighborhood block party will raise awareness about environmental concerns will be held on Tuesday evening, August 4, 2015 from 6:00 to 10:00pm at 13055 First Avenue NE as part of National Night Out.  There will be a barbecue and potluck dinner, a parade with the `Haller Lake Monster,` games, music, community singing and an open mic for those who wish to talk or perform. Matching Fund supported events are free to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

The Night Out event planned by the 22nd Avenue Neighbors will use Emergency Preparedness as the theme.  It will be held on Tuesday, August 4, 2015 from 6-10:00pm on 22nd Avenue between Union and Marion.  Neighbors will collaborate to bring supplies and Matching Fund resources will be used to purchase duffel bags and first aid kits.   Matching Fund supported events are free to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

Project Title: Night Out Against Crime for West Queen Anne
Project Description: On August 4, 2015 from 6pm to 10pm on the 1600 block of 11th Avenue W between W Garfield St and W Blaine St. There will be a Neighborhood Night Out to expand outreach and to deepen the connections within the neighborhood. This family friendly event will bring together various members of the neighborhood to discuss crime prevention activities and build community esprit de corps.

Project Title:
Night Out 2015 - 
8th Ave. Green St. Neighbors
Project Description: The 8th Ave Green Street Neighbors will host a National Night Out Against Crime event on August 4, 2015 from 6:30 pm to 8:30 pm.  The event will take place on 8th Ave between James and Columbia Streets.  The event will allow neighbors to get to know each other better and enjoy an evening together. It will include a live band, food, information tables, games, and socializing. There will also be a chance to take a tour of the historic church.  NMF events are funded on a one time only basis.

Project Title: SW Rose Street 2015 Neighborhood Night Out
Project Description: On August 4, 2015 from 6pm to 10pm on SW Rose Street between 41st Ave SW and California Ave SW block there will be a Neighborhood Night Out to support Neighborhood Block Watch. This family friendly event will bring together various members of the neighborhood to discuss crime prevention activities and build community esprit de corps.

Organization Name: Friends of City Arts and Culture
Project Description: Belltown Bash is going to take place on August 4, 2015 from 5pm to 8pm at 2312 3rd Avenue as part of Belltown's National Night Out's celebration.

Project Title: 12th Ave SW Seattle Night Out Against Crime
Project Description: The 12th Avenue SW Block Watch Group will hold a `Meet Your Neighbors` event on Tuesday, August 4, 2015 from 6:00 to 10:00pm in the 7700 block of 12th Avenue SW.  The goal is to strengthen  and celebrate relationships between neighbors, talk about community needs and issues and provide an update on the proposed plans for a painted intersection street mural.  Matching Fund supported events are free to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

Project Title: Seattle Night Out Block Watch on 22nd Ave W
Project Description: Our block is participating in the SEATTLE NIGHT OUT on Aug 4, 2015 from 5:00 to 9:30 pm.  We are closing 22nd Avenue West from Dravus to Bertona Streets.  We will provide food, games, prizes, and a balloon entertainer for the neighborhood kids.

Project Title: A Beautiful Safe Place for Youth Night Out 2015
Organization Name: Rainier Beach: A Beautiful Safe Place for Youth Branding Committee
Project Description: Night Out 2015 events will be held at the following locations Tuesday Evening August 4th from 6-9:00 pm in Rainier Beach:  1) the Plaza at Rainier Ave S & Henderson; 2)  South Rose Street and Rainier Ave S; 3) Safeway Plaza at the 9200 blk of Rainier Ave S and 4) Light Rail Station at ML King Jr Way S. and S Henderson.  There will be food, entertainment and a chance for neighbors to engage and connect.  Matching Fund supported events are free to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

Project Title: 2015 South Roxbury Street Night Out Block Party
Project Description: The Roxbury Street Block Party steering committee will host a block party to celebrate Night Out Against Crime on August 4, 2015.  It will take place on S Roxbury St between S Keppler and S Redwing streets from 6:00 pm to 8:00 pm.  There will be live music, food, and visits by law enforcement.  The goal of the event is to improve safety and build community among neighbors in this diverse neighborhood.

Project Title: Chinatown International District Night Out Event
Organization Name: Seattle Chinatown International District Preservation and Development Authority
Project Description: For National Night Out, Friends of Little Saigon will host an event at King Street under I-5 in the International District. To activate an area that has long been a site of illegal encampments and drug activity. The Night Out Event will draw people with music, dancing, chalk art, food, and information about local businesses and events. This is a first step in long-term efforts to activate the area. All are welcome to participate.

Project Title: Neighborhood Night Out - Block Party & Potluck
Project Description: All area neighborhood residents are invited to attend the Night Out event on the evening of August 4, 2015 from 5:00pm to 10:00pm. The 1300 block of NE 43rd Street will be closed between University Way NE to the east and the mid-block alley to the west.

Project Title: National Night Out event in our neighborhood.
Project Description: The 105th St SW Blockwatch group will plan and host its first-ever Night Out Against Crime event to help get local neighbors talking and engaged in joining a block watch.  An additional goal at the event will be to collect names, addresses, and contact information from all of our neighbors so we can create a contact sheet and map.  Food and entertainment will be provided.  The event will be held on August 4, 2015 from 6 pm to 9 pm on 105th St SW between 35th Ave SW and 39th Ave SW.

On August 4, 2015 from 4:00pm to 9:00pm, the Deuce 98 Community Block Watch Neighbors will hold a block party to celebrate Safety/Awareness and Cultural Diversity by sharing food, music, voices and games representing the neighborhood. There will be a `Safety and Awareness` potluck, live entertainment, art activities, and children's games. It will be free & open to the public.

Project Title: Dearborn Park Night Out Block Party
Project Description: The 32nd Ave S Block Watch will hosts a Night Out Against Crime event on August 4, 2015.  The event will be held on 32nd Ave S between S Orcas and S Lucille streets from 5:30 pm to 8:30 pm.  Food and activities will be on hand to help neighbors enjoy spending time together and getting to know one another.

Project Title: Zumba Gold in Ballard Commons Park
Project Description: A Zumba Gold instructor will give dance classes in Ballard Commons Park 5701 22nd Ave NW on Tuesdays & Thursdays at 10:00 - 11:00 am, August 4 - October 1, 2015. Zumba Gold is a slower paced Brazilian dance geared towards senior citizens and fun for all ages. These classes will be open to the public, free, and will provide a healthy, fun activity for much of the summer season.
Fitness for All will offer a free, public, one hour yoga class in Ballard Commons Park, 5701 22nd Ave NW, on Saturdays July 25th through September 27th, 10:30am to 11:30am.

Project Title: 46th Ave SW E Prep Training/Traffic calming
Organization Name: 46th Ave SW Emergency Prep and Block Watchers
Project Description: Our neighborhood will host a Night Out event on August 4, 2015 from 5:00 to 8:00 pm on the 9300 block of 46th Ave SW.  We will focus on emergency preparedness by training neighbors and providing them with emergency supplies.

The Summit Block Party Volunteer Crew will organize the 2015 Summit Block Party on Saturday, August 22, 2015, from 12pm to 10pm on Belmont Ave between E Olive St & E Howell St. This block party will showcase local artists, musicians, and craft-makers. It promotes the acceptance of all races, sexual orientations, and socioeconomic classes. Summit Block Party is a free, non-for-profit, volunteer-run event, and is fueled by community support.

The Seattle Neighborhood Night Out Gathering planned for Tuesday, August 4, 2015 from 6:00pm to 10:00pm in the 3600 block of 32nd Avenue West.  This will enhance the neighborhood cohesiveness by providing a family friendly opportunity for neighbors to meet new friends and reconnect with old ones.  There will be food, entertainment and great conversation.  Matching Fund supported events are free to the public and funded on a one time only basis.
The Queen Anne P-Patch located at 217 Lynn St. will add a berry patch, herb garden, and pollinator habitat to the existing west orchard.  We will also repair our picnic table.

Project Title: Block Party and Neighborhood Outreach August 30
Project Description: The 5300 Block 16th Block watch will host a neighborhood block party on Sunday, August 30, 2015 from 2pm to 5pm between S Lucile and S Bennett on the 5300 block on 16th Ave S. The purpose of the block party is to build a sense of community, outreach to the neighborhood to encourage community participation. All are welcome to participate. NMF events are funded on a one-time only basis.

On September 12, 2015 between 11am and 4pm Leschi Business association and community council are collaborating to host a community gathering and festival along the east side of the sidewalks on 100 Lakeside Ave. S. to Lake Washington Blvd.  This family friendly festival will highlight local businesses, feature local artists, an art walk, and many children's activities.

Project Title: Bartlett Ave NE Outdoor Movie Night
Project Description: On August 29, 2015 at 11315 Bartlett Ave NE between NE 113th St. and NE 115th St. The Bartlett Ave Play St neighborhood group and Meadowbrook Community Council are partnering for a neighborhood potluck and outdoor movie night. The potluck starts at 6:30pm and the movie showing at 8:30pm. This family-friendly event  will bring the neighborhoods together for a night of fun and community building where food will be collected and donated to the North Helpline emergency food bank.

Project Title:
Art Walk Rainier Beach 2015
Duwamish Totem Pole
Project Description: On September 5, 2015 from 10:00am to 4:30pm at the Rainier Beach Community Center -  8825 Rainier Ave S.  Art Walk Rainier Beach will celebrate “A Cultural Homecoming”, for those who have lived, worked and shared in our community since its founding by the Duwamish People. This year, Art Walk Rainier Beach will honor the Duwamish Tribe with their participation in music, dance, and storytelling. There will be a art work creation of a cedar-frame canoe that will go to a community installation.

Summer Parkways at the Garfield Community Center coincides with the grand opening of Phase 1 of the first Central District Greenway on Sept 12 at 11:00 a.m. We will provide bike decorations to the public to decorate their bicycles for the `parade` following the ribbon-cutting. We'll provide bike decoration materials throughout the day for all Summer Parkways participants.

Project Title: Pedestrian Streets Pilot - Data Analysis & Debrief
Project Description: The Pike Pine Pedestrian Street Pilot will close 3 blocks of Pike Street, from Broadway to 12th Avenue, to vehicular traffic and implement community activities and performances on 4 Saturday nights in August as an experiment aimed at improving the nightlife experience in Pike/Pine.  This grant will fund analysis in September of data collected about how the street is used at these times as compared to normal weekend nights. This analysis will be presented at debrief meetings in September-October.

The ROOTS Celebration Committee will host the annual ROOTS Family Picnic on September 6, 2015 from 10 am to 6 pm at Gas Works Park located at 2101 N Northlake Way.  This iconic event brings people from across Seattle together to celebrate the music, art and tradition of the African diaspora.  It will support intergenerational exchange with emphasis upon Northwest African American heritage.  NMF funds events on a one-time-only basis.

Family Bike Seattle will help organize the Disaster Relief Trials on September 12, 2015 from 11 am to 3 pm.  The will event consist of a bicycle riding course that will begin and end at the Garfield Playfield located at 537 25th Ave.  Participants will ride to various locations around the Central District to simulate and raise awareness of the vital role community bicyclists and cargo bikes can potentially play in the event of a disaster.

A free showing of The Lego Movie in Ballard Commons Park, located at 2230 NW 57th Street, will bring people together in the neighborhood for a night of fun.  The movie will be shown on Friday, August 28, 2015 at 8:00 pm.

SPNA and businesses are partnering with the police to organize two community safety workshops – 911 training and Crime Prevention through Environmental Design. The 911 Best Practices workshop will be held at the South Park Community Center at 8319 8th Avenue South on August 25, 2015 at 6:00p.m. and the CPTED workshop will be held on September 21, 2015 at 6:00p.m. at the same location.

`Youth Beautify the Block` coordinated by the “GOOD Girls & BAD Boyz” of Rainier Vista, is a youth led neighborhood engagement project with a focus on creative expression, civic service, and social entrepreneurialism. The purpose of the event is to engage, entertain and inform the local community via game tournaments, youth led performances, tabling, and food services. The event will be held at the Rainier Vista Park on Thursday, October 1, 2015 from 4pm to 7pm.

Project Title: Mt Baker Town Center Street Festival
Organization Name: Friends of Mount Baker Town Center
Project Description: On September 20, 2015 from 11:30am to 6pm a Street Festival will be held at the Mt. Baker Light Rail Link. The event will include live music, art, food trucks and a design installation created by community members. Through these efforts the event will help foster a better sense of community and pride for the neighborhood.

Amigos de Seattle is organizing a multi-cultural boat representing Latin-American countries for the Fiestas Patrias parade along 14th Ave. S. in South Park on Saturday, September 19, 2015, from 10am to 1:30pm. The project will engage around 20 people as volunteers and attract the attention of hundreds of parade-goers from different countries who are residents of South Park and other neighborhoods.

Organization Name: Citizens for a Safer First Hill
Project Description: Citizens for a Safer First Hill will install crosswalk flags at 9th Ave. & Columbia St. This intersection is accessed by various community groups, including seniors, business associates, children, and dog walkers. Despite clearly painted marks on the road and bright safety signs, visibility is difficult due mainly to the parked cars.  A community event to celebrate installation of the flags will be held at the intersection on Tuesday, December 8, 12noon to 1:00pm.

The Aurora Licton Urban Village Alliance will create a website to inform and engage neighbors in planning efforts in the Aurora Licton Neighborhood Plan Boundary area.  The website will focus on the Aurora corridor between N 85th and N 105th Streets. Website content will be developed in coordination with the Seattle Department of Planning and Development to accurately reflect planning and any related updates for the Aurora Licton Neighborhood Plan Boundary area.

Project Title: Illuminate the 900 block of 20th Avenue East
Project Description: The 20 Alohas neighborhood group will install lights in street trees by the end of November along one side of the 900 block of 20th Avenue East. This lighting will illuminate block gatherings and potlucks on Friday evenings in November through January. The lighting will be done in accordance with SDOT guidelines.

The Somali Health Fair Planning Team will host a community health fair on Saturday, November 14, 10:00am to 4:00pm, at the New Holly Gathering Hall (7050 32nd Ave S). Free and open to the public, the fair will offer a wide range of screenings and services, including blood pressure checks, a dental bus, hookah/shiisa education, and health insurance enrollment.

Shop Small West Seattle! will create winter welcome cards for new Junction residents. The cards will highlight three events in the West Seattle neighborhood business district: Small Business Saturday (Nov 28), Junction Tree Lighting Event and Winter Holiday Party (Dec 5), and Special Art Walk (Dec 10). The cards will be mailed to 500-750 households in new apartment complexes in The Junction.

Organization Name: Friends of Small Business Saturday in Magnolia
Project Description: The Magnolia Chamber will create and distribute posters and flyers to educate and encourage the residents of Magnolia to shop at the small locally owned businesses during the winter holiday season.

On December 19, 2015, from 5pm to 9pm we will have a fall bazaar at the Mercy Association Center located at 3613 S Juneau St. The bazaar will have neighborhood organizations providing information about their services. The bazaar will also include food, games, and activities, all with the purpose of bringing the community together.

Project Title: Rainier Beach Arts and Crafts Market
Project Description: The Rainier Beach Community Club will organize an arts and crafts fair to showcase local artisans. It will be held December 5, 2015 from 10am to 2 pm at 6038 S Pilgrim St. The event will bring community members together in a festive atmosphere where they can get to know their neighbors and support small business owners and artisans.   Outreach signage will be placed according to Seattle Department of Transportation (SDOT) standards.  The event will be free and open to the public.

Set up an emergency communications hub in the parking lot of Hope Lutheran Church and School at 4456 42nd Ave SW.  The hub will be used during  disaster situations for the West Seattle Alaska Junction neighborhood.

Project Title: Homeless Winter Survival Kits - Southwest Seattle
Project Description: The All the Sky Foundation will partner with businesses, families, and youth in the community to create winter survival kits for the unsheltered homeless in West Seattle. The kits will contain hats and gloves, toiletries, socks, hand warmers, rain ponchos, flashlights, and snacks. The kits will be distributed from the neighborhood food bank and other non-profits who serve the homeless.

Friends of Hawthorne will have a series of monthly evening coffee chats at Hawthorne Elementary School located at 4100 39th Ave S from 5pm to 6pm starting in January. The purpose of these chats is to engage and empower the parents of students, to gain an understanding of the specific needs of the diverse study body and to build positive relationships in the community.

Project Title: `Rainier Beach: A Beautiful Safe Place for Youth`
Organization Name: Rainier Beach: A Beautiful Safe Place for Youth Branding Committee
Project Description: Rainier Beach: A Beautiful Safe Place for Youth (ABSPY) Branding Committee will hire a graphic designer to make a logo for youth violence prevention activities. The ABSPY initiative focuses on five Rainier Beach hot spots, and its goal is to improve the quality of life and economic prospects for Rainier Beach youth. A `corner greeters` community event will be held at the Rainier & Henderson Plaza on March 30 from 4:30 to 6:00pm. Details of other events will be provided to NMF project manager.

Project Title: `FIRST LOOK FORUM`:  Who's Running in District 4?
Project Description: Hawthorne Hills and View Ridge Community Councils will jointly sponsor a District 4 candidates forum to introduce declared candidates to the voters and residents of our two neighborhoods. The forum will be held on March 18, 2015 at 7:30 p.m. at the Sand Point Community Church's Perry Hall - 4710 NE 70th Street.

Project Title: Rejuvenate the Greenwood Community Council Website
Project Description: The Greenwood Community Council will engage a web consultant to make our website more useful and interactive to support connections and dialogue within the community of active Greenwood citizens.

Organization Name: Committee to Celebrate 1965 U.S. Immigration Law
Project Description: The ad hoc group Committee to Celebrate 1965 U.S. Immigration Law will create and display a historical photo exhibit to educate the public about how the 1965 U.S. Immigration Law has impacted the Filipino American community in Seattle.  The exhibit will be displayed at the Pagdiriwang Festal Celebration to be held June 6 and 7, 2015 from 10am - 5pm at the Seattle Center Armory Building located at 305 Harrison St.

Project Title: Earth Day Storytelling at the Duwamish Longhouse
Project Description: In celebration of Earth Day, the Seattle Storytellers Guild will bring together Native and non-Native storytellers at the West Duwamish Longhouse (4705 W Marginal Way SW) on Sunday, April 19, 2:00-4:00pm, for a free performance for the general public. This new project has a youth focus: youth will participate in storytelling and also tell the story and show a video of a mural they created at the Youngstown Cultural Arts Center that was inspired by a Native story about the Duwamish River.

Othello Park Alliance will remove weeds and garbage from tree wells in front of businesses between S. Othello and S. Myrtle Streets on the west side of Martin Luther King Way S. Gravel will be put on top. This clean-up, approved by SDOT, will be done on Saturday, April 25, 2015 9am - noon, as part of Bridge to Beach. This will help enhance the Othello business district where facades have recently been improved.

This project will provide the Rainier Beach community with valuable training, information, and emergency equipment such as first aid kits, water filtration system, to be utilized in case of a disaster.

The Share and Play Steering Committee will create and maintain a public sharing bin at the Ballard Community Center located at 6020 28th Ave NW from June to August 2015.  The bin will promote sharing and conservation by providing a place for neighbors to share toys and clothes with other families for free.  Up to three other bins may be added in other public locations in Ballard. Brochures will be created to encourage use of the bins.  Access to the bins will be free and open to the public.

Skate Like a Girl will organize `The Wheels of Fortune Welcome Party,` an all ages meet-and-skate-with-girls-from-all-over-the-world event on Friday, May 1, 2015 from 7pm to 10pm, at Hilliard's Brewery, 1550 NW 49th St.  The event is free and open to the public. The goal is to allow skateboarders and non-skateboarders to mix and mingle. There will be music bands and skateboarding demonstrations. No part of the award will be used for beer, and no people who have had beer will be allowed to skate.

On April 25, 2015 between Noon and 4pm at Brighton Park located at 6000 39th Ave S, the Sisters of South Seattle will have a Spring Fair to raise health awareness in their community. The aim of this event is to bring together the many diverse groups that make up the Brighton  community. There will be various workshops on healthcare and many games and activities for children.

The African American Community Alliance, Black female SPD officers and Parks and Recreation have partnered to provide educational and social activities to marginalized youths. 
On May 9, 2015 at 3pm a workshop will be held at the Garfield Teen Life Center. On May 16, 2015 the participants will be able to attend the Pompeii exhibit. The community report back will happen on May 20, 2015 at 5pm participants will give presentations and share what they learned from the workshop and exhibit.

Make Music Seattle is part of a free world-wide music celebration held on Summer Solstice, June 21st. Launched in 1982 in France, it is now held in more than 700 cities. Completely different from typical music festivals, Make Music Seattle is open to anyone who wants to take part. Music makers young and old, amateur, professional, and all genres.  The Make Music Seattle event will be held at the Seattle Center from 9am-11pm and at additional venues as can be added with on-going fundraising.

To help reduce isolation and loneliness for senior citizens in the New Holly community. The New Holly Senior Social will hold twice a month social activities at the Lee house located at 7315 39th Ave South at New Holly Neighborhood Campus. The purpose of the socials is to create opportunities for seniors in the New Holly community for friendship, support and to enhance fitness by engaging in age and fitness-level appropriate physical activity.

Project Title: Cascade Block Party National Night Out Aug 4, 2015
Project Description: The Cascade Recycled Arts Project will host a Night Out Against Crime block party Aug 4, 2015. It will take place on Thomas Street between Minor Ave N and Pontius Ave N from 4 pm to 8 pm.  The event will help the Cascade neighborhood celebrate community.  There will be food, music, and games to bring youth, seniors and families together.

Project Title: Sirens of Serpentine - West Seattle Mermaid Parade
Project Description: The mermaid parade is a free open participation community art event. Parade participants will meet in costume at the Alki Boat house at 11 am on Saturday, May 30, 2015 for a water themed dance installation by Sirens of Serpentine performed to live harp music. The entire group will then parade the Alki Beach Trail to the site of the old Luna Park. Everyone is welcome.  Matching Fund supported events are funded on a one time only basis.

Project Title: District 4 Candidates Forum - NE Seattle, June 17.
Project Description: This is a Candidates Forum for Seattle City Council candidates from District 4, and is open to the public.  The forum will take place on Wednesday, June 17, 2015 at the University Heights Center at 6pm.  The forum will be 1.5 hours long and community members will be given the opportunity to meet and to hear the candidates positions and ask questions.

The South Park Candidate Forum Committee will organize a community forum for Seattle City Council District 1 candidates on Wednesday, May 27, 7:00 - 9:00pm, at the South Park Neighborhood Center, 8201 10th Ave. S. The forum will provide an opportunity for South Park residents and other stakeholders to engage with candidates running for Seattle City Council District 1. Spanish interpretation and printed materials will be provided.

The 2015 Walk for Change will encourage, provoke and inspire fathers to view fatherhood as a powerful entity that is strong enough to invoke change. Families will walk the HOT SPOTS of Rainier Beach together as a symbol of unity on Saturday, June 27th, registration begins at 9 am, the walk starts at 11:00, followed by food and other activities. All activities begin at the Rainier Beach Community Center, 8825 Rainier Avenue South.
A community clean-up and spruce-up of Morningside Park on June 27, 2015. This is one of only two open spaces near our core neighborhood of Wedgwood.

Friends of SLU Youth will organize the SLU-Cascade Youth Tech Project to bring South Lake Union’s strong tech talent and resources to youth who may not have access to tech-based learning opportunities. Up to 18 school-aged youth will participate in robotics education sessions from 5:30 to 7:30pm every Wednesday in July 2015 at 415 Westlake, culminating in a community celebration on Wednesday, July 29, also at 415 Westlake. Stipends will be given to the youth who complete the project.

Project Title: Georgetown Historic Sites Plaque Map & Open House
Project Description: The Friends of Georgetown History would like to showcase Georgetown Historic Sites at the upcoming Georgetown Garden Walk on July 12, 2015.  We would like to create a map with the location of all the plaques we installed at various historic sites and the open house at our new History Museum at 6206 Carleton Ave S. The maps will serve a dual purpose of the map as well as a hand fan to beat the heat of a hot July day.

Project Title: Madison Park Emergency Hub Box and Supplies
Project Description: A Knaack box, designed to store emergency supplies will be purchased and installed on a concrete pad north of the Madison Park tennis courts.  This project supports the ongoing efforts of the Madison Park community to prepare for and respond to emergency situations.

Coinciding with the Ballard Seafood Fest on July 11, 2015, Festi-Bowl is a youth sport event that takes place at the skateboard facility in Ballard Commons Park.  It will attract youth ages 5 and up for a variety of skateboarding activities including:

1. clinics and instruction
2. skills showcase
3. timed slalom race
4. bowl competitions

This event promotes self-expression, creativity and individuality while building skateboard skills and camaraderie between participants.

Whittier Heights Involved Neighbors (WHIN) will organize a family festival at Kirke Park - 7028 9th Ave NW on Saturday, August 8, 2015, from 11:00am to 3:00pm.  The festival will feature arts, crafts, food and drinks, free guitar lessons and possibly yoga and gardening tutorials, a kids' bike parade, and live musical performances from a local kids' band.  The hope is that this becomes an annual event for our neighborhood in which the community can get together.

Neighbors will collaborate to bring supplies and Matching Fund resources will be used to purchase duffel bags and first aid kits.   Matching Fund supported events are free to the public and funded on a one time only basis.

Project Description: Neighborhood wide City Night Out event

Organization Name: Rainier Beach: A Beautiful Safe Place for Youth Branding Committee
Project Description: Night Out 2015 events will be held at the following locations Tuesday Evening August 4th from 6-9:00 pm in Rainier Beach:  1) the Plaza at Rainier Ave S & Henderson; 2)  South Rose Street and Rainier Ave S; 3) Safeway Plaza at the 9200 blk of Rainier Ave S and 4) Light Rail Station at ML King Jr Way S. and S Henderson. The goal of the event is to improve safety and build community among neighbors in this diverse neighborhood.

On August 4, 2015 from 6pm to 10pm the Friends of 16th Ave will have a Night Out Seattle for neighbors to join together for a BBQ and fun on the 300 Block of 16th Avenue between E. Alder St and E Jefferson St.

Project Title: Chinatown International District Night Out Event
Organization Name: Seattle Chinatown International District Preservation and Development Authority
Project Description: For National Night Out, Friends of Little Saigon will host an event at King Street under I-5 in the International District. To activate an area that has long been a site of illegal encampments and drug activity. The Night Out Event will draw people with music, dancing, chalk art, food, and information about local businesses and events. This is a first step in long-term efforts to activate the area. All are welcome to participate.

Project Title: National Night Out event in our neighborhood.
Project Description: The 105th St SW Blockwatch group will plan and host its first-ever Night Out Against Crime event to help get local neighbors talking and engaged in joining a block watch.  An additional goal at the event will be to collect names, addresses, and contact information from all of our neighbors so we can create a contact sheet and map.  Food and entertainment will be provided.  The event will be held on August 4, 2015 from 6 pm to 9 pm on 105th St SW between 35th Ave SW and 39th Ave SW.

On August 4, 2015 from 4:00pm to 9:00pm, the Deuce 98 Community Block Watch Neighbors will hold a block party to celebrate Safety/Awareness and Cultural Diversity by sharing food, music, voices and games representing the neighborhood. There will be a `Safety and Awareness` potluck, live entertainment, art activities, and children's games. It will be free & open to the public.

Gather neighbors to foster community relations, raise awareness of the council working on their behalf, educate about disaster preparedness, and inform about opportunities to connect (blog, NextDoor, e-mail lists, etc.).  We'll also share a meal, meet local officials (police and fire dept.), and provide fun activities for the neighborhood kids.

Central District Youth Night Out 2015 will take a multi-generational approach to engaging youth and elders to work together to design, co-create and implement strategies for improving community health and well being necessary to make Seattle and surrounding neighborhoods safer.

Project Title: Dearborn Park Night Out Block Party
Project Description: The 32nd Ave S Block Watch will hosts a Night Out Against Crime event on August 4, 2015.  The event will be held on 32nd Ave S between S Orcas and S Lucille streets from 5:30 pm to 8:30 pm.  Food and activities will be on hand to help neighbors enjoy spending time together and getting to know one another.

Project Title: Zumba Gold in Ballard Commons Park
Project Description: A Zumba Gold instructor will give dance classes in Ballard Commons Park 5701 22nd Ave NW on Tuesdays & Thursdays at 10:00 - 11:00 am, August 4 - October 1, 2015. Zumba Gold is a slower paced Brazilian dance geared towards senior citizens and fun for all ages. These classes will be open to the public, free, and will provide a healthy, fun activity for much of the summer season.
Fitness for All will offer a free, public, one hour yoga class in Ballard Commons Park, 5701 22nd Ave NW, on Saturdays July 25th through September 27th, 10:30am to 11:30am.

Project Title: 46th Ave SW E Prep Training/Traffic calming
Organization Name: 46th Ave SW Emergency Prep and Block Watchers
Project Description: Our neighborhood will host a Night Out event on August 4, 2015 from 5:00 to 8:00 pm on the 9300 block of 46th Ave SW.  We will focus on emergency preparedness by training neighbors and providing them with emergency supplies.

The Summit Block Party Volunteer Crew will organize the 2015 Summit Block Party on Saturday, August 22, 2015, from 12pm to 10pm on Belmont Ave between E Olive St & E Howell St. This block party will showcase local artists, musicians, and craft-makers. It promotes the acceptance of all races, sexual orientations, and socioeconomic classes. Summit Block Party is a free, non-for-profit, volunteer-run event, and is fueled by community support.

The Seattle Neighborhood Night Out Gathering planned for Tuesday, August 4, 2015 from 6:00pm to 10:00pm in the 3600 block of 32nd Avenue West.  This will enhance the neighborhood cohesiveness by providing a family friendly opportunity for neighbors to meet new friends and reconnect with old ones.  There will be food, entertainment and great conversation.  Matching Fund supported events are free to the public and funded on a one time only basis.
The Queen Anne P-Patch located at 217 Lynn St. will add a berry patch, herb garden, and pollinator habitat to the existing west orchard.  We will also repair our picnic table.

Project Title: Block Party and Neighborhood Outreach August 30
Project Description: The 5300 Block 16th Block watch will host a neighborhood block party on Sunday, August 30, 2015 from 2pm to 5pm between S Lucile and S Bennett on the 5300 block on 16th Ave S. The purpose of the block party is to build a sense of community, outreach to the neighborhood to encourage community participation. All are welcome to participate. NMF events are funded on a one-time only basis.

On September 12, 2015 between 11am and 4pm Leschi Business association and community council are collaborating to host a community gathering and festival along the east side of the sidewalks on 100 Lakeside Ave. S. to Lake Washington Blvd.  This family friendly festival will highlight local businesses, feature local artists, an art walk, and many children's activities.

Project Title: Bartlett Ave NE Outdoor Movie Night
Project Description: On August 29, 2015 at 11315 Bartlett Ave NE between NE 113th St. and NE 115th St. The Bartlett Ave Play St neighborhood group and Meadowbrook Community Council are partnering for a neighborhood potluck and outdoor movie night. The potluck starts at 6:30pm and the movie showing at 8:30pm. This family-friendly event  will bring the neighborhoods together for a night of fun and community building where food will be collected and donated to the North Helpline emergency food bank.

Project Title:
Art Walk Rainier Beach 2015
Duwamish Totem Pole
Project Description: On September 5, 2015 from 10:00am to 4:30pm at the Rainier Beach Community Center -  8825 Rainier Ave S.  Art Walk Rainier Beach will celebrate “A Cultural Homecoming”, for those who have lived, worked and shared in our community since its founding by the Duwamish People. This year, Art Walk Rainier Beach will honor the Duwamish Tribe with their participation in music, dance, and storytelling. There will be a art work creation of a cedar-frame canoe that will go to a community installation.

Summer Parkways at the Garfield Community Center coincides with the grand opening of Phase 1 of the first Central District Greenway on Sept 12 at 11:00 a.m. We will provide bike decorations to the public to decorate their bicycles for the `parade` following the ribbon-cutting. We'll provide bike decoration materials throughout the day for all Summer Parkways participants.

Project Title: Pedestrian Streets Pilot - Data Analysis & Debrief
Project Description: The Pike Pine Pedestrian Street Pilot will close 3 blocks of Pike Street, from Broadway to 12th Avenue, to vehicular traffic and implement community activities and performances on 4 Saturday nights in August as an experiment aimed at improving the nightlife experience in Pike/Pine.  This grant will fund analysis in September of data collected about how the street is used at these times as compared to normal weekend nights. This analysis will be presented at debrief meetings in September-October.

The ROOTS Celebration Committee will host the annual ROOTS Family Picnic on September 6, 2015 from 10 am to 6 pm at Gas Works Park located at 2101 N Northlake Way.  This iconic event brings people from across Seattle together to celebrate the music, art and tradition of the African diaspora.  It will support intergenerational exchange with emphasis upon Northwest African American heritage.  NMF funds events on a one-time-only basis.

Family Bike Seattle will help organize the Disaster Relief Trials on September 12, 2015 from 11 am to 3 pm.  The will event consist of a bicycle riding course that will begin and end at the Garfield Playfield located at 537 25th Ave.  Participants will ride to various locations around the Central District to simulate and raise awareness of the vital role community bicyclists and cargo bikes can potentially play in the event of a disaster.

A free showing of The Lego Movie in Ballard Commons Park, located at 2230 NW 57th Street, will bring people together in the neighborhood for a night of fun.  The movie will be shown on Friday, August 28, 2015 at 8:00 pm.

Walk Away Day is a three part event that begins with a rally, proceeds with a walk and concludes as a festival. At Walk Away Day, youth from all over the city are coming together to make a decision to let go of something negative in their life.

SPNA and businesses are partnering with the police to organize two community safety workshops – 911 training and Crime Prevention through Environmental Design. The 911 Best Practices workshop will be held at the South Park Community Center at 8319 8th Avenue South on August 25, 2015 at 6:00p.m. and the CPTED workshop will be held on September 21, 2015 at 6:00p.m. at the same location.

`Youth Beautify the Block` coordinated by the “GOOD Girls & BAD Boyz” of Rainier Vista, is a youth led neighborhood engagement project with a focus on creative expression, civic service, and social entrepreneurialism. The purpose of the event is to engage, entertain and inform the local community via game tournaments, youth led performances, tabling, and food services. The event will be held at the Rainier Vista Park on Thursday, October 1, 2015 from 4pm to 7pm.

Project Title: Mt Baker Town Center Street Festival
Organization Name: Friends of Mount Baker Town Center
Project Description: On September 20, 2015 from 11:30am to 6pm a Street Festival will be held at the Mt. Baker Light Rail Link. The event will include live music, art, food trucks and a design installation created by community members. Through these efforts the event will help foster a better sense of community and pride for the neighborhood.

Amigos de Seattle is organizing a multi-cultural boat representing Latin-American countries for the Fiestas Patrias parade along 14th Ave. S. in South Park on Saturday, September 19, 2015, from 10am to 1:30pm. The project will engage around 20 people as volunteers and attract the attention of hundreds of parade-goers from different countries who are residents of South Park and other neighborhoods.

Organization Name: Citizens for a Safer First Hill
Project Description: Citizens for a Safer First Hill will install crosswalk flags at 9th Ave. & Columbia St. This intersection is accessed by various community groups, including seniors, business associates, children, and dog walkers. Despite clearly painted marks on the road and bright safety signs, visibility is difficult due mainly to the parked cars.  A community event to celebrate installation of the flags will be held at the intersection on Tuesday, December 8, 12noon to 1:00pm.

The Colman Neighborhood Association will host a facilitated dialogue and community BBQ for residents of the Colman and Jackson Place neighborhoods at the Northwest African American Museum (2300 S Massachusetts St) on Saturday, November 14, from 9:00am to 1:00pm. The goal is to reform the Judkins Park Community Council as a united South Central voice and to increase resident participation in neighborhood activities.

Project Title: Licton Spring P-Patch Small Sparks Grant Request
Project Description: The Friends of Licton Springs P-Patch will make physical improvements to the Licton Springs P-Patch located at College Way N and N 92nd St.  The improvements will consist of repairing the exterior of the toolshed and installing native plants in the communal areas of the garden.  These activities will take place during the fall of 2015.

We are organizing an event for the community to gather and dance to Michael Jackson's Thriller in Ballard Commons Park on October 24, 2015 at 1:00 p.m. This is a world wide event to celebrate dance and health!

The Aurora Licton Urban Village Alliance will create a website to inform and engage neighbors in planning efforts in the Aurora Licton Neighborhood Plan Boundary area.  The website will focus on the Aurora corridor between N 85th and N 105th Streets. Website content will be developed in coordination with the Seattle Department of Planning and Development to accurately reflect planning and any related updates for the Aurora Licton Neighborhood Plan Boundary area.

Project Title: Illuminate the 900 block of 20th Avenue East
Project Description: The 20 Alohas neighborhood group will install lights in street trees by the end of November along one side of the 900 block of 20th Avenue East. This lighting will illuminate block gatherings and potlucks on Friday evenings in November through January. The lighting will be done in accordance with SDOT guidelines.

The Somali Health Fair Planning Team will host a community health fair on Saturday, November 14, 10:00am to 4:00pm, at the New Holly Gathering Hall (7050 32nd Ave S). Free and open to the public, the fair will offer a wide range of screenings and services, including blood pressure checks, a dental bus, hookah/shiisa education, and health insurance enrollment.

Shop Small West Seattle! will create winter welcome cards for new Junction residents. The cards will highlight three events in the West Seattle neighborhood business district: Small Business Saturday (Nov 28), Junction Tree Lighting Event and Winter Holiday Party (Dec 5), and Special Art Walk (Dec 10). The cards will be mailed to 500-750 households in new apartment complexes in The Junction.

Organization Name: Friends of Small Business Saturday in Magnolia
Project Description: The Magnolia Chamber will create and distribute posters and flyers to educate and encourage the residents of Magnolia to shop at the small locally owned businesses during the winter holiday season.

On December 19, 2015, from 5pm to 9pm we will have a fall bazaar at the Mercy Association Center located at 3613 S Juneau St. The bazaar will have neighborhood organizations providing information about their services. The bazaar will also include food, games, and activities, all with the purpose of bringing the community together.

Project Title: Rainier Beach Arts and Crafts Market
Project Description: The Rainier Beach Community Club will organize an arts and crafts fair to showcase local artisans. It will be held December 5, 2015 from 10am to 2 pm at 6038 S Pilgrim St. The event will bring community members together in a festive atmosphere where they can get to know their neighbors and support small business owners and artisans.   Outreach signage will be placed according to Seattle Department of Transportation (SDOT) standards.  The event will be free and open to the public.

Set up an emergency communications hub in the parking lot of Hope Lutheran Church and School at 4456 42nd Ave SW.  The hub will be used during  disaster situations for the West Seattle Alaska Junction neighborhood.

Project Title: Homeless Winter Survival Kits - Southwest Seattle
Project Description: The All the Sky Foundation will partner with businesses, families, and youth in the community to create winter survival kits for the unsheltered homeless in West Seattle. The kits will contain hats and gloves, toiletries, socks, hand warmers, rain ponchos, flashlights, and snacks. The kits will be distributed from the neighborhood food bank and other non-profits who serve the homeless.

Friends of Hawthorne will have a series of monthly evening coffee chats at Hawthorne Elementary School located at 4100 39th Ave S from 5pm to 6pm starting in January. The purpose of these chats is to engage and empower the parents of students, to gain an understanding of the specific needs of the diverse study body and to build positive relationships in the community.

Construction of a rain garden on the Cherry St. hill climb of the 710 Cherry Street property to include benches and spaces for pedestrians, as well as education panels regarding storm water run-off, native plants, and green infrastructure.
Improve the building’s energy efficiency and safety by replacing the roof, removing or repairing the damaged brick chimneys, and installing energy-efficient gas-fired boiler.
Renovate existing school playground and play areas which will benefit both the school and the surrounding neighborhoods, including the Bitter Lake Community Center.
Complete the restoration of Yesler Swamp and construct 300 additional feet of the remaining section of an environmentally-designed, ADA-accessible boardwalk.

As a collaboration between the Roosevelt neighborhood and the City, convert a cut-through street into a safe public space to serve as a pedestrian- and bike-friendly zone that bridges the gap between the I-5 Park and Ride and the Sound Transit Light Rail station.

Project Title: John Stanford School Playground Renovation Project
Project Description: Improve the school grounds into a more accessible, safe, and welcoming public space for the entire neighborhood. Project will implement select components including replacing concrete fixtures and the outdated play equipment.

Project Title: Construction Planning East Howe Steps Plaza
Project Description: Proceed from 30% design completion to final construction documents for the East Howe Steps Plaza.

Renovate the performance hall to include improvements to the facility's egress, ADA accessibility, creation of a foyer, installation of stage lighting and audio visual equipment, and addition of other aesthetic improvements.

Project Title: Activating Rainier Beach Urban Farm and Wetlands
Project Description: Add a children’s learning garden, rain gardens, and educational signage; equip the community farm stand, kitchen, and greenhouses;  and host a community-led celebration. The Farm serves as a community space for organic farming, food distribution, education, and community building.

Project Title: Pike Place Market Neighborhood Center Project
Project Description: Support the planning, design, and construction of the new Pike Place Market Neighborhood Center, a 1,950 square foot welcoming, accessible venue. It will serve as a gathering place and will support and strengthen connections in the downtown community through activities.

Project Title: Jimi Hendrix Park: Are You Experienced? Phase 2
Organization Name: Friends of Jimi Hendrix Park Committee
Project Description: Construct Phase 2 of Jimi Hendrix Park designated `Are You Experienced?` to include additional pathways, lawn mow curbs, and vine plantings. It will entail mobilization, temporary erosion and sedimentation control, demolition, earthwork, hardscape, and planting and irrigation.
Build a new torii in Seward Park to replace the one that stood for 50 years and served as a community icon and gathering place.

Implement series of community-supported road safety and placemaking measures (e.g. pedestrian lighting, distinctive paving, crosswalks, signage, and art) recommended in an NMF Small & Simple-funded conceptual plan.

Implement a leadership and capacity-building program where emerging leaders of color will be recruited, trained and supported, and placed in full-time work at communities-of-color-led nonprofits in Rainier Valley. Funds will provide stipends to fellows, training support, and evaluation of the program.

Construct a new play structure, track, and site and renovate the field and painted sport courts to help revitalize this gathering place with purposeful and accessible areas for play, exercise, and recreation for all in the neighborhood.
Produce 12 events in 2016 that will connect diverse community partners and build stronger relationships between organizations, groups, and individuals in the greater Delridge neighborhood.

Project Title: CASC Planning Options for Facility Redevelopment
Project Description: Conduct a feasibility study to identify and prioritize options for the future redevelopment of the senior center. Professional consultant will do surveying, architecture, parking and traffic analysis, engineering, and comprehensive community engagement.

Project Title: Legacy of Justice at Hirabayashi Place
Organization Name: Hirabayashi Place Legacy of Justice Committee
Project Description: Complete and install community-led project located on and around Hirabayashi Place to provide historical and cultural identity of Nihonmachi, Seattle’s historic Japantown, by honoring civil rights leader Gordon Hirabayashi. Project will create a place for education, inspiration, remembrance, and hope.

Organization Name: Friends of Jackson Street Mural Project
Project Description: Commission painting and installation of a mural depicting significant historical labor events in the rich, multicultural context of the International and Central Districts. The community-designed art will be installed on the Washington State Labor Council, AFL-CIO office building.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Fitness Zone equipment will be installed in Powell Barnett Park in the Central District, and will increase neighborhood residents’ access to opportunities to improve their health and wellness.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: The Art of Alzheimer’s  - A Community Conversation
Project Description: The Art of Alzheimer’s will organize a free art exhibition featuring paintings by people living with dementia.  It will take place at Seattle City Hall during January and February of 2016.  Art classes will be offered at senior centers throughout Seattle in conjunction with the exhibit.  The project will prompt community conversation about Alzheimer's, deepen community understanding of dementia, and raise awareness about the organizations that enrich the lives of people living with dementia.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Center for Linguistic and Cultural Democracy
Project Description: This project will unite members of the diverse Caribbean Community in the Seattle Area along with those interested in experiencing Caribbean cultural expression. This family-oriented event will be a day of cultural performances, cultural expression, and cultural exchange. The festival theme is “Solar Energy Powers our Culture and our Future” which will be held August 23, 2015 at Seward Park.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Circulo de Mamas will convene a group of 20 Latina mothers and community members to further develop their community leadership through culturally relevant training.  The `Madres Aprendiendo` program will consist of intensive English classes, connecting community members to relevant resources, and a resource fair for the general public.  The participants’ progress will be documented through a video.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Remembering the Past and Welcoming the Future
Project Description: Through a day long event, this project will provide education and share the stories of Cambodian refugees `fleeing for life” during the 1975-1979 Khmer Rouge Genocide and the resettlement process of refugees in communities of their adopted country–the U.S.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The West Seattle Timebank will host a series of approximately 20 interactive community events and workshops to promote timebanking  and increase participation in timebanking.  The events will run from approximately December 2015 through August 2016.  The project is particularly focused upon ensuring that timebank users in West Seattle reflect the general population of West Seattle, which is diverse.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Chief Sealth Indoor Tennis Center Planning Grant
Project Description: Community members in West Seattle will solicit proposals and select a design consultant to conduct a feasibility study and develop a conceptual plan for an indoor tennis center at the former Denny Middle School site, adjacent to the Southwest Community Center.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This proposal funds finishing elements to the Valley View Trail's trailhead connection at 28th Avenue S., two additional way-finding posts within the park, and a celebration! The community preferred plan calls for a set of boulders to be placed across the end of 28th Avenue S. to prevent trucks from being able to back up to the steep slope and dump their loads. Entry, wayfinding and rules signage are desirable at this location as well to signify a welcoming access point into this woodland park.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Troll's Knoll P-Patch Community Garden Tool Shed
Project Description: We are requesting an NMF grant to provide the funds needed to complete the final aspects of the Troll’s Knoll P-Patch. The majority of initial construction for the P-Patch has been funded and is underway.  The remaining elements proposed for NMF funding are: building and outfitting the tool shed, creating the pathways between the garden plots, purchasing the compost bins and rain barrels, and accessible raised beds for those for whom gardening on their knees is not an option.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Friends of Cayton Corner Park will work with a consultant to prepare construction documents for a neighborhood pocket park on the site of a small vacant lot on Capitol Hill.  The park will be a beautiful urban garden in a densely populated neighborhood that provides a safe place for people to gather, play, and relax.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This project is a phase  of the Bell Street Park Art + Activation 5 Year Plan for Alley Gallery. This Placemaking process will identify key stakeholders and develop specific recommendations to transform the Bell Street Park alleys into unrivaled assets for ongoing creativity.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Growing Vine Street 2020 brings new life to the award-winning 1990’s green-street project of the same name. This project will increase organizational capacity and engage the community in a dialogue about green space needs, neighborhood history and sustainable utilization of storm water through two community events.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Lake City Fred Meyer Garden Project
Organization Name: Friends of the Lake City Fred Meyer Garden Project
Project Description: The Lake City Fred Meyer Community Garden will create a design for a common space through a shared vision. The steering committee will lead a community input process with the help of a consultant. The goal is to beautify and activate a parcel of land owned by Fred Meyer for community benefit. The project will also help to bring business and community together in a meaningful way.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Restore Colman Park's West Slope to Olmsted Design
Project Description: This project will continue ongoing efforts to engage the community in the development of a vegetation plan for the west slope of Colman Park.  Consultants will be hired  to work with the community and Parks to develop a specific actionable plan to restore historic vegetation in this heritage Park.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Creation of a community tool library and fixer’s collective to provide items that people will be able to check out to take home or use in the workshop. There will be all sorts of items, e.g. ladders, drills, food dehydrators, ice chests, table settings, strollers, etc. The library will also host meetings and classes to help neighborhood residents to fix belongings, start DIY projects, and build community.

Organization Name: Belltown Community Council Parks and Arts
Project Description: This is a continuation of the Regrade Dog Park beautification.  In Phase 1, a mural was painted on a standing wall.  Phase 2 continues the Park's visual improvements by adding art to the vertical walls along the walking paths throughout the Park.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Lake City Future First Community Connect Website
Project Description: Lake City Future First will work with a website developer/graphic designer to improve its website and to train community volunteers in the use of the website. The purpose is to brand the website as a recognizable place to post volunteer opportunities and projects needing support; connect Lake City to resources and each other; and encourage posts by Public Engagement Outreach Liaisons and other community members for broad community engagement.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Ballard Historic Resources Survey and GIS Mapping
Project Description: Conduct a volunteer driven Historic Inventory that updates previous documents from 1937 and 1997 into a digital format for use as a cultural resource of the Ballard community and City of Seattle.  The updates will utilize a visual and interactive GIS mapping component to engage volunteers and the public.  It will be accessible to the public through the Ballard Historic Society web site.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The proposal is to plant the hillside at Othello Park with 100% low native plants, using an established planting plan. To ensure there is more plant diversity and seasonal interest, the plan will be modified slightly by a landscape architect, after input from the community.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Outreach to Support a Ballard Improvement Area
Project Description: This project will strengthen outreach efforts within Ballard to garner strong support for a proposed Business Improvement Area (BIA). The BIA would provide long-term sustainable funding for the neighborhood leadership organization to directly serve the needs of Ballard businesses, residents, and nonprofits in this rapidly growing neighborhood.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Low Income Housing Institute would like to create an event series to take place every other month in the community activity space at Cheryl Chow Court located at 2014 NW 57th Street in Ballard.   The event series will feature people and topics relating to the Ballard neighborhood, be free and open to the public, bringing a wide range of community members together to create fun and educational events that highlight the people and history of the neighborhood.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The South Park Area Revitalization Committee (SPARC) proposes to hire a landscape architecture and design consultant to facilitate public input and create a schematic design, construction documents, and construction cost estimates to improve Duwamish Waterway Park. SPARC will identify features and programming that meet community members’ needs and interests.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Lawton Community Playground Improvement Project P2
Project Description: We want to modernize the playground structures and redesign the surrounding space to create a physically and intellectually stimulating, inclusive and safe environment for our students and community members, reduce maintenance costs, and improve watershed function and connectivity to surrounding parklands. We recently completed the design phase and this grant would allow us to progress from conceptual design to detailed construction ready documents to begin implementing our vision.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Capitol Hill EcoDistrict Renter Activation Project
Project Description: Nearly 90 percent of the residents living in the Capitol Hill EcoDistrict live in multifamily housing. Capitol Hill Housing, in partnership with the City, Capitol Hill Community Council and other neighborhood leaders, will engage renters living within the Capitol Hill EcoDistrict first in a voter registration and pledge to vote drive, and then as Building Ambassadors brought together at a 2016 Renters Summit to build community and inform the next wave of development coming to the Hill.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Kitchen Renovation: The MLK FAME Community Center
Organization Name: MLK Family Arts Mentoring Enrichment Community Center
Project Description: The MLK Family Arts Mentoring Enrichment Community Center will hire a professional architect team to conduct a planning study and prepare a master plan to renovate the facility’s kitchen—a dilapidated kitchen in need of repair--into a modern commercial kitchen with up-to-date code and permit compliance.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The 23rd Ave Action Core Team will organize and host the Central Area Block Party on Cherry Street between 23rd and 25th Avenues in September 2015.  This free public festival will focus on building and maintaining community in a diverse neighborhood undergoing a high volume of transition. The one-day event will highlight local businesses, preserve historic identity through cultural art displays and performances, and engage the broader community in City development and planning processes.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Friends of Cathay Post Oral History Project
Project Description: The untold stories of Chinese American WWII and Korean War veterans will be documented. The project will videotape full length interviews with forty to fifty elderly veterans, digitize historical photos and documents, produce online digital content, develop a one-hour documentary film, and publish a special oral history publication.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: The Racial Equity & Social Justice Circle
Project Description: The Freedom Project will organize a series of free workshops to address racial inequity on a local level. By engaging in collective learning, dialogue, and action, this project will support efforts of dismantling racism, with special focus on healing institutional racism.  The events will be documented through a graphic recording which will be publically displayed to share the work of and lessons learned from the workshops.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Queer Healthcare Accountability Coalition will solicit public input to create a database of health care providers to ensure that the LGBT community has access to high quality, competent healthcare across Seattle. We believe that by working together across identities and neighborhoods, we can build a centralized resource that will be widely available and will link LGBTQ city residents to the healthcare services they need, from providers they can trust.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The development of Junction Plaza Park in West Seattle was completed in 2010. The second phase is to install a significant piece of public art. The purpose of this grant is to procure a large sculpture and install lighting.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Plan for the Montlake Business District
Project Description: The Montlake Community Club will hire an urban planner to work with community stake-holders to develop a planning document to improve the vitality of the Montlake business district along the 24th Avenue corridor to Highway 520.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Madrona PK-8 PTSA will install a reader board at the school's front entrance at 33rd & Union.  Madrona PK-8 is experiencing enrollment growth and the reader board will engage the Madrona community with school news and neighborhood events.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This project is the second phase of design work for a series of micro-parks along Westlake Avenue N., from Denny Way to Lake Union Park, intended to enhance the vibrancy of the public space along the arterial.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Friends of North Lake Union will carry out the initial assessment and planning requirements for the creation of a small scale environmental restoration project for Waterway 22 located on N Northlake Way at Stone Way N.  This entails a site assessment, acquiring permits, and a community planning process. The outcome will be an initial plan for the future creation of an improved ecological space where the community can enjoy views of Lake Union.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: A feasibility study addressing improvements of water usage in Volunteer Park. The study will include preliminary design and estimate costs for these water related issues.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Magnuson Park Low-Powered FM Radio Station
Organization Name: Sand Point Arts and Cultural Exchange
Project Description: This FCC permitted low-power FM radio station will broadcast in a 3 – 10 mile radius from Magnuson Park. The station KMGP 101.1 will broadcast a diverse mix of arts and culturally relevant news, music and programming. The station will also provide the opportunities for after school youth job training, school programming and community involvement.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Bell Street Park Mobile Reading Room
Organization Name: Friends of Bell Street Park Reading Room
Project Description: The Friends of Belltown Reading Room will put out carts of books, tables, and chairs to create a mobile public reading room at Bell Street Park events and in the Belltown Community Center. This project will foster a love of the printed word in the youngest Belltown residents and encourage older readers to expand their horizons with free books.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Garinagu Houngua will organize a series of workshops where the community can learn about the language, culture and art of the Garifuna people directly from Garifuna natives.  A final cultural event will be held on April 12, a celebratory day for the Garifuna people. This event will have presentations from the workshops, Garifuna dance, art, and food. A well-known historian of Garifuna culture will serve as a guest speaker at the culminating event.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Friends of Mt. Baker Ridge Viewpoint
Project Description: This project will remove black locust saplings and other invasives, restoring the native habitat and preserving the view corridor. Also we will complete a small amount of replacement planting.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Deaf Spotlight will offer a 3-week summer theater camp August 6-27, 2016 for 15- 20 middle and high school youth.  They will learn all aspects of a theatrical production guided by two artists in residence.  The goal is to engage youth who are hard of hearing or are signing hearing children of deaf adults.  The project will culminate in a free performance of a play which the students will write and produce.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The goal is to create a shared vision for business prosperity and growth, and to foster community-oriented economic development and to connect neighborhood businesses and resident stakeholders.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Wing Luke Museum of the Asian Pacific American Experience
Project Description: The Wing Luke Museum of the Asian Pacific American Experience will create an exhibit about the Danny Woo Community Garden.  It will run from March 2016 to January 2017.  It will feature stories of pioneers and elderly immigrant gardeners and will connect the Seattle community with the Danny Woo Community Garden. The exhibit will promote environmental sustainability, cultural preservation and community building through oral histories in the exhibit and hands on learning activities at the garden.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Friends of the Ballard Civic Orchestra
Project Description: The Friend of Ballard Civic Orchestra will create a civic orchestra that will expand music opportunities in Ballard. It will create a multi-generational, multi-ethnic community orchestra open to the public without charge.  This will strengthen the Ballard community by bringing together people of different ages and cultures who share an interest in learning and growing through music. The orchestra will offer rehearsals, instructional workshops and performances without charge.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Festival Centro Americano will organize a one day event to unite the Central American community along with those interested in experiencing various cultures of Central America.  The Festival Centro Americano 2015 will be a day of cultural performances, cultural expression, and cultural exchange.  It will be held on August 28, 2016 at Seward Park located at 5900 Lake Washington Blvd S.  It will be free to the public.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: On the Margins of the Margins
Project Description: Gay City Arts will organize a series events exploring the experiences of 3 marginalized groups within LGBT communities: people of color, trans and genderqueer people, and people over 40. There will be community dialogues, round table discussions, and performances by artists at the events.  The connections generated during these events will continue via free public classes in visual, literary and performing arts. All events will be free and open to the public.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Chilberg Addition's Link to Emma Schmitz Park
Project Description: Chilberg Avenue SW has a sloped median between (2) one-way streets leading to Emma Schmitz Park. The neighborhood's goal is to use the median for meeting neighbors, food production, and an attractive display of landscape. This project will remove invasives, prune vegetation, improve soil, plant edible plants, and create an area for rainwater holding a secured art piece.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Sand Point Elementary reopened five years ago with limited play/sport options. In an attempt to improve this, the PTSA will create a more usable court in our covered indoor/outdoor play area by installing flooring. The new textured surface marked for various sports will be safer than the existing concrete.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The improvements to the playground will reduce maintenance costs,  improve watershed function and increase connectivity to surrounding parklands. At this time the design to construction ready documents are being created and this grant would allow the implementation of Phase 1 of improvements in the summer of 2016.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Magnolia Trail - Feasibility Study - Phase II
Project Description: The Magnolia Trail Community will continue work with a consultant to carry out Phase II of a community-informed study to develop a walk/bike trail through roughly 300 yards of SDOT and DPR land that is currently a gap in the network of citywide trails.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Making Space Thrive: A Vision for First Hill
Project Description: First Hill Improvement Association seeks funding to provide safe, active open space for First Hill. We will build off the momentum from our summer activation events and outreach to engage the community in a visioning and concept design for First Hill Park.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: 11th Annual Aaina: South Asian Women's Festival
Project Description: Tasveer will organize the 11th annual Aaina: South Asian Women's Focus festival which will be held at the Seattle Asian Art Museum located at 1400 E Prospect St on April 22-24, 2016.  Aaina, which in Urdu/Hindi means mirror, celebrates the artistic and activist work of and about South Asian women and its community.  This will be done through films, visual art, performance art, conversations and much more, all aimed at highlighting the issues relevant to South Asians.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This project will create a plan for permanent overhead street lighting for historic Ballard Ave NW. It will foster an improved sense of security and enhance this historic, iconic, neighborhood.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Neighborhood Advocacy at Capitol Hill Transit
Project Description: Organize community engagement regarding neighborhood priorities at the Capitol Hill Station Transit Oriented Development by hosting focused conversations and design charrettes with specific, underrepresented populations in our community to promote the  inclusion of neighborhood preferences during the Design Review Process.

Project Title: Brighton Park Hillman City Field Day
Project Description: The Hillman City Planning Committee will host a neighborhood field day event at Brighton Park on Saturday, June 25, 2016 from 3:00pm to 8:00pm. The first ever Hillman City Field Day will feature a picnic and pi�ata, soccer and track & field relay races, music, and arts and craft activities. It will provide families, teens, and youth in Hillman City with a positive community activity. Expected attendance is at least 70.

Project Title: Art in the Park for Kids!
Project Description: The 2016 `Art in the Park for Kids` celebration scheduled for Saturday, September 10th at Leschi Park, 201 Lakeside Ave S. from 11:00 am - 4:00 pm will include bead making taught by a resident jewelry maker, booths for crafts, a nature walk led by a local photographer, and dance lessons from a local choreographer. This event is free and open to the public.

Project Title: Community Volunteer Fair in Lake City
Project Description: The Outreach Committee for Lake City will host a community resource fair on Wednesday, January 27, 2016, 6:00-8:00pm, at the Lake City Community Center (12531 28th Ave. NE).
