The grant will pay for entertainment, youth stipends for outreach and help, and stipends for local ethnic restaurants to provide food and describe their goals, hopes and dreams for their business and for the Lake City community. This project will also connect people with over 15 groups looking for volunteers.

Sand Point Elementary PTA will host a community Earth Day Celebration on Saturday, April 23, from 10:00am to 2:00pm, at the Sand Point Elementary School (6208 60th Ave. NE). Community members will participate in a bicycle rodeo, planting of container trees on the playground, and painting of garden benches for use as reading circles and gathering places. All activities have been approved by Seattle Public Schools.

Organization Name: Neighborhood Watch Night Out - Arbor Heights
Project Description: The Night Out celebration for the Arbor Heights community will take place on Tuesday, August 2 from 5-9pm in the area of 10200 California Avenue SW.  It will include pony rides children ages 2-7, a face painting artist, a musician and a food truck.

The Greenwood Community Council will design and produce outreach materials for free distribution at public summer events including the Greenwood Car Show which will be held on June 25, 2016 from 8 am to 4 pm on Greenwood Ave N between N 68th St and N 90th St.  The outreach materials will raise awareness about and increase participation in the Greenwood Community Council.  This outreach will also enhance the sense of neighborhood identity and unity in the Greenwood area.

Project Title: Queen Anne Greenways Play Street Event
Project Description: On July 28, 2016 from 2pm to 7pm at the Queen Anne Farmers Market located on 1st Ave N between W Crockett and W Howe. A community event in coordination with the QA Farmers Market will be held to support the Queen Anne Greenway. The event will provide a fun space for children to ride bikes, trikes and scooters, there will be games and educational outreach materials, along with interactive maps related to the Greenway.

Project Title: Night Out - N 87th Street Block Party
Project Description: On August 2, 2016 from 6pm to 10pm on N. 87th Street between Meridian Ave N. and Corliss Ave N. there will be a Seattle Night Out block party. This project will bring neighbors together to encourage community engagement and security. The hope is to build better relationships with neighbors, discuss emergency preparedness, and organize an easy way to contact each other. There will be food, activities, and maybe music.

National Night Out in the Dexter Corridor will be held on Tuesday, August 2 from 5-9pm in the 1100 block of Dexter Avenue North. This is the inaugural event for the Dexter Corridor Community promoting the awareness of community block watch, police emergency services and getting to know your neighbors.

Night Out, on Tuesday, August 2nd from 5-9pm will be an opportunity for neighbors who live on the 40th block of Whitman Ave N. to engage and build stronger relationships with. This will enable neighbors to communicate more effectively when an issue or concern arises. The event will include food, entertainment and great conversation.

Project Title: PACE Outreach to Renters in Little Brook
Project Description: The Lake City Way PACE Group will host a booth to provide information about Seattle's Rental Registration and Inspection Ordinance (RRIO) at the Outdoor Movie Night at Little Brook Park (14043 32nd Ave. NE) on Saturday, August 6, 2016, 7:30pm-10:30pm. The goal is to engage renters who have historically been hard to reach. Art activities will be used to attract people, especially families. RRIO outreach will also be done at several Lake City Farmer's Market Thursdays (3pm-7pm) this summer.

The CID National Night Out Committee will host a free Night Out event on S King Street between 10th Ave S and 8th Ave S on August 2, 2016 from 6 pm to 9 pm. The event will activate an area that has long been a site of illegal encampments and drug activity. It will draw people with music, dancing, chalk art, food, and information about local businesses and events. This is the continuation of long-term efforts to activate the area. All are welcome to participate.

Project Title: Parking Day - `A Day in the Parklet` U-District
Project Description: On September 16th and 17th from 10am to 7pm the U-District Advocates will be hosting a Parking Day themed `A Day in the Parklet`.  It will be located at 4208 University Way NE. The event will create a temporary space where the community can come together and socialize. This event will demonstrate the need for public open space for a livable community and a strong democracy.

Project Title: Night Out - Puget Park Night Out 2016
Project Description: The Puget Park Neighbors will host a free National Night Out Against Crime event on August 2, 2016 from 6 pm - 8 pm.  It will be held on Puget Blvd SW between SW Hudson St and 23rd Ave SW.  The event will bring together long time neighbors, welcome new neighbors, provide a place to talk about crime prevention and Block Watch efforts, and mainly just have a great time with food, live music, and games.

The community group The 51% will organize and host a free public art exhibit.  The exhibit will be on display at 220 S Jackson St from August 4 - 7.  The exhibit will be open 10 am to 9 pm each day. It will feature the works of 14 artists.  All of the artists will be women and a significant portion will be women of color.  The exhibit will highlight the importance as well as the under-representation of women of all races in the arts.

Project Title: Parking Day - Little Saigon Activation Project
Project Description: On September 16thand 17th from 10am to 7pm, Little Saigon Placemaking will be hosting a Parking Day Event. It will be located at 1065-1157 S. Jackson St on the SW corner of 12th Ave S & S. Jackson St.  Parking day allows adding temporary greenery, seating, and activities to an area that is currently under utilized. Activities will focus on gathering community input for the future parklet that will be installed at the activated site.

The Greater Seattle Chapter of Filipino American National Historical Society will host a free public symposium on the Filipino American struggle for civil rights entitled �Learning from our Man@ngs: The Filipino American Struggle for Civil Rights Yesterday and Today�.  It will address and inspire intergenerational community leadership and activism. It will be held on February 27, 2016 from 10:30 am to 4:30 pm at the University of Washington Ethnic Cultural Center located at 3931 Brooklyn Ave NE.

Downtown Seattle Families will participate in the City of Seattle's Park(ing) Day by setting up a temporary children's play-themed activity in downtown Seattle.  It will be located on 1st Ave between University St. and Seneca St.  It will be free and open to the public on September 16 and 17, from 10 am - 7pm each day.

Project Title: PACE Water Conservation Outreach in International District
Organization Name: Rebate Awareness for Increased Savings & Efficiency (RAISE) Community Project
Project Description: A PACE group, Rebate Awareness for Increased Savings & Efficiency (RAISE), will conduct culturally and linguistically appropriate outreach about Seattle Public Utilities' water-saving toilet rebate program by going door-to-door to small business owners in the International District (ID) during two five-hour sessions in late September. The project will also collect data about toilet efficiency and barriers to program participation. A report will be provide to SPU/DON and the ID community.

Project Title: Parking Day - Under I-5 King St Activation
Project Description: On September 16th and 17th, from 10am to 7pm, Friends of the I-5 CID underpass intend to activate the area under I-5 on 919 S. King St. by hosting a Parking Day. This event will bring together community groups to engage around re-visioning what the area could look like, with a specific emphasis on safety, environmental improvements and traffic calming.

National Night Out is an annual community-building campaign that promotes police-community partnerships and neighborhood camaraderie to make our neighborhoods safer, better places to live. Neighbors in the 5000 block of Ivanhoe Place NE will celebrate on Tuesday, August 2nd from 5-9pm with food, a petting zoo and great conversation.

Organization Name: Rainier Beach High School, IB Art Program
Project Description: The Rainier Beach IB Art exhibit will be held on March 22, 2016 from 5pm to 8pm at the South Shore Rotunda located at 4800 S Henderson St.  This grant will allow the purchase of materials for the creation of portable wood panels so that students at Rainer High School IB Art program can display their artwork.

Project Title: ECS and the Rainier Valley Heritage Festival
Project Description: The Ethiopian Community in Seattle (ECS) will participate in the 2016 Rainier Valley Heritage Parade on Saturday, August 13, 11:00am to 4:30pm, in Columbia City. ECS will share its rich culture at parade booths through traditional activities that include spinning cotton, teaching and sharing coffee ceremonies and Ethiopian cuisine, and dance. Small stipends will be paid to teens for performing traditional Ethiopian dances.

To celebrate the 60th anniversary of Filipino Youth Activities, an organization that dates back to 1957, a photo exhibit will be created that highlights the diversity of programs and events through which thousands of Filipino youth have been served. The exhibit will be showcased during the Filipino Festival, a free public event planned for June 4-5 at the Seattle Center before being established at it's permanent location at 810 18th Avenue in Seattle, Washington.

On Monday October 31, 2016 from 4pm to 7pm the Boo Bash at the Beach Celebration will happen at 9262 Rainier Ave S on the east side of the Safeway  parking lot. Many community partners have come together to host trick or treat booths, games and entertainment. Boo Bash at the Beach wants to create a safe and fun Halloween experience, that encourages neighbors to take back their neighborhood and keep kids in their own community on what is generally a highly anticipated rite of childhood.

Project Title: Build a High Volume Community Cider Press
Project Description: The Brandon Triangle Community Garden will build a high volume cider press for use by the Brandon Orchard P-patch, the neighborhood community, and partner organizations. The Orchard will also use the press for a public event during the fall harvest.

Project Title: Block Watch and Community Building Event
Project Description: On September 27, 2016, from 6:30pm to 9:30pm located on the 5300 Block of 16th Ave S. between S Bennett and S Lucile. The local block watch will have a community event. The purpose of the event is to energize the block watch and help build a sense community. Food and activities will be on hand to help neighbors enjoy spending time together and getting to know one another. NMF funded events are free and open to the public. They are funded on a one time only basis.

T.O.K.E.N (Teaching Our Kids to Educate the Next) in partnership with the Seattle Police Department will produce the first ever Peace Festival, Saturday, June 11th from noon to 6:00 p.m. at the Rainier Beach Community Center, 8825 Rainier Avenue South.  This free event will include a resource fair with local businesses/organizations, performers, food, a raffle and a basketball game between the Police and the community. The goal is to help foster a positive perception of police in the community.

Project Title: Au New You - Women's Empowerment Luncheon
Project Description: The Women's Empowerment Luncheon, will be held on June 4, 2016 from 11:00am - 4:00pm at Rainier Beach Community Center, 8825 Rainier Avenue South.  This luncheon will reach women to teach  new avenues to improve mental & physical well being; improve ability to succeed in regards to family, parenting, overcoming challenges & negative affects that have impacted their lives. This seminar will leave participants with renewed confidence information to make positive contributions to the community.

Via Seattle will host a free public event to bring people together and raise awareness about homelessness as the winter season begins.  The event will feature free food, a DJ, and the opportunity for people to offer coats for donation if they wish.  It will take place on December 18, 2016 from 4:30 pm - 8 pm at 1406 E Pike St.

Project Title: Emergency Preparedness - 23rd Ave. NW Block Watch
Project Description: The 23rd Ave. NW Block Watch group will install a storage shed at 7351 23rd Ave. NW and stock it with neighborhood disaster response supplies. This place will be a neighborhood meeting place in the event of a disaster. It will have supplies, first aid, and emergency response items. Monthly meetings will be held to educate and involve neighbors in preparation for disaster response using Seattle's SNAP guidelines.

A grassroots group of Vietnamese-Americans whose mission is to honor and enrich the Vietnamese American experience by preserving their stories, will host a community `World Caf�` discussion on Tuesday, November 29th from 6-8 pm at Southside Commons, 3518 S Edmunds Street in Seattle.  The goal is to provide a space to bridge the generational and cultural gaps of the Vietnamese-American community with an evening of story-telling and discussion.  The event is free and open to the public.

Project Title: Night Out Block Party for NE 88th St Neighbors
Project Description:
This will be the 5th annual Night Out block party for NE 88th St. between Roosevelt Way NE & 15th Ave NE. It's a bratwurst BBQ and potluck on August 2, 2016 at 6:00 - 10:00 p.m. 

We've gotten to know neighbors, made new friends, kept watch on homes, started a block book club, and found babysitters due to acquaintances made at our block parties.

The Hillman City P-Patch community will kick off their 2016 Spring Site Clean-up by hiring a certified arborist to assess and prune the large willow tree which is the main feature of the garden.  Tools will also be purchased to facilitate the clean up and gardening work.  A celebration will be held to showcase their accomplishments once the work has been completed.

Project Title: Parking Day - Event on Summit Ave
Organization Name: Capitol Hill EcoDistrict -- Capitol Hill Housing
Project Description: This is a pop-up park on the 1700 block of Summit Avenue East that will be a part of SDOT's PARK(ing) Day event on September 16 - 17, 2016. This event will bring awareness to the lack of greenery on the 1700 block of Summit Ave. This will be an opportunity to invite the public to participate in the design process for future activation of this particular site.

Project Title: Sound in Stone: Celebrating James Washington
Project Description: The Committee to Celebrate James Washington will host a free performance in honor of Central Area stone sculptor James Washington.   It will feature music and poetry inspired by Washington's art in the month that would have marked his 113th birthday.  The program will explore civil rights struggles in the Central District from Washington's time through the present.  The performance will take place on November 27, 2016 from 2 pm - 3 pm at the Beacon Hill Library located at 2821 Beacon Ave S.

Project Title: Parking  Day - Bee Happy in Lake City
Organization Name: Friends of the Kaffeeklatsch Park(ing) Day
Project Description: In recognition of Parking Day a `pop up park` will be created in front of Lake City's Kaffeeklatsch store located at 12513 Lake City Way NE.  This will be an opportunity to engage and inform the community about bee pollination and the importance of bees in the world.  It will be open from 10:00 am to 7:00 pm September 16th and 17th.

Compassion Activation will host five art-making events and community discussions about housing the homeless this summer.  The first will be at the Sustainable Ballard Festival , August 27th from 11:00 am to 4:00 pm at Ballard Commons Park, 5701 22nd Ave NW. Other venues will be identified throughout the summer. The made art (painted prayer flags) will be used to beautify tent encampments and shelters.

From April through September this project will add a Sea Turtle Garden, Butterfly Garden, and a bigger Snack Walk Garden, (filled with berry bushes), to our existing `friends`: the Grey Whale Garden, Starfish Garden, Salmon Survival Path, and Tidepool Gardens!  The Red Wiggler Worms will get a new home and the Grey Whale Garden and Salmon Survival Path mosaics will be repaired.

A  two and one half hour presentation and facilitated conversation on the subject of White Privilege will be held on Thursday, January 26, 2017 from 6:00-8:30 pm at the Mount Baker Community Club, 2811 Mt. Rainier Drive South. The goal is to help participants become more comfortable with talking about racism while exploring mutual solutions in working for greater social justice and equality.

In celebration of Juneteenth, the African American observance of the end of slavery, there will be a community wide event at the New Holly Community Center, 7054 - 32nd Avenue South, on Saturday, June 11 from noon until 5:00 p.m.  The day's events include an educational component as well as multi cultural activities, dance, spoken word, music, foods, and  performances.  This celebration is free and open to the public.

Project Title: Rainier Beach Community Multimedia Mural Project
Project Description: On July 23, 2016 from 11am to 7pm at the Rainer Beach BAAMfest(Beach Arts and Music Fest), located at 8825 Rainier Ave S. There will be a multi-media live performance that will include beat boxing, videography, poetry, live music mixing. Throughout the performance a graffiti artist will be creating a mural on portable panels. The focus of the project is to break down stereotypes of Muslims and to curb Islamophobia.

With the goal of encouraging youth to focus on continuing their education, the `Take Vista to School` back to school rally will be held on Tuesday, August 30th from 4-6:30pm at the Rainier Vista Central Park, 4410 29th Avenue South. Students of all ages are invited.  There will be info booths, resource tables and guest speakers of all ages.  Find out what college is really like, from someone who knows.  This event is free and open to the public.

Project Title: Training for Community Members to Talk to Youth About Life Skills
Project Description: The Mercer Middle School PTSA will host a free public workshop for community members on the topic of addressing reproduction and sexual health with middle-school aged youth. It will take place at Mercer Middle School located at 1600 Columbian Way S on March 9, 2016 from 6 pm to 8 pm.  A subject matter expert will present information and interpretation will be provided. The project will empower community members and build connections among them.

Organization Name: Rainier Beach: A Beautiful Safe Place for Youth Branding Committee
Project Description: Community and business volunteers will assemble and distribute `Graffiti Survival Kits` to small graffiti impacted businesses in Rainier Beach, and work with them to paint out graffiti during the  Bridge-to-Beach event on 4/30/16 from 9:00 am to noon beginning at 8115 Rainier Avenue South.

Organization Name: Denny International Middle School Multicultural Potluck Steering Committee
Project Description: The Denny International Middle School Multicultural Potluck Steering Committee will host a community Multicultural Potluck and Talent Show on May 19, 2016 from 6:30 pm to 8:00 pm at Denny International Middle School, 2601 SW Kenyon Street. It will be a potluck where people from all over West Seattle share food and performances from their cultural backgrounds.

Greenwood-Phinney Greenways will install temporary curb bulbs for ped/bike safety at Greenwood Ave N & N 83rd St, a future greenway per Seattle's Bicycle Master Plan, as part of this SDOT approved Parking Day Plus + event. The curb bulb in front of Coyle's Bakeshop will be extended as a pop-up park featuring seating and plants. The project goal is to demonstrate safer crossings and park/open space, and how they can help make the neighborhood better for all.

The Georgetown Community Council will host its inaugural 2017 meeting at Old Georgetown City Hall located at 6202 13th Ave S on January 23, 2017 from 7 pm - 8:30 pm.  The group will purchase chairs to support this meeting. The chairs will continue to be used only for activities that are free and open to the public.

Project Title: Earth Day Weekend Cal Anderson Park Clean-up
Organization Name: Capitol Hill EcoDistrict -- Capitol Hill Housing
Project Description: On Earth Day April 23, 2016 starting at 9am there will be community building and a clean up at Cal Anderson Park located at 1635 11th Ave. This event is open to all and gives the opportunity for the community to come together, help clean-up the park and identify maintenance issues.

Project Title: South Park Putts Out Night Out
Project Description: South Park Arts will organize eight teams of artists to create artistic mini-golf holes that will be played by the public on national Night Out Against Crime, Tuesday, August 2, 5:30-8:30pm, along the 800 block of S. Thistle Street. The block's parking strips will serve as the greens. The public will vote on their favorite hole and on the best-dressed golfers. The event is free and open to the public.

SCIDpda in partnership with CIDBIA will host their 18th Annual Chinatown-ID Spring Clean on April 30, 2016 from 8am to 1pm.  This event starting at 409 Maynard Ave S. will bring together volunteers from many local organizations and community members from  Chinatown-ID community to work on cleaning up the neighborhood and assist small business owners with improvements to their businesses.

Project Title: BFF Education Night with Pandora Thomas
Organization Name: Education Team of Beacon Food Forest
Project Description: The Beacon Food Forest Education Team will host an interactive workshop on Thursday, October 6th from 6:30 pm - 9:00 pm at El Centro de la Raza (room 307), 2524 - 16th Avenue South.  A featured speaker will engage the community on a variety of topics including permaculture, social justice, and food security.  This is an opportunity for cross cultural interaction and community building.  The event is free to the public.

Project Title: Development of a Hillman City Neighborhood Council
Project Description: Vision Hillman City will publicize a proposal for creating a neighborhood council and hold a neighborhood-wide meeting to discuss the content of the proposal and seek the community's input and approval. The meeting will be on September 15, 2016 from 6:30 - 8:30 p.m. at the Rainier Avenue Church located at 5900 Rainier Avenue South.

The Cham Refugee Community organization will lead a public spring clean-up event at the Brighton Playfield located at 6000 39th Ave S.  It will take place on April 23, 2016 from 8 am - 2 pm.  Refreshments and cleaning supplies will be provided. Outreach efforts will focus upon attracting youth participants.  Only herbicide and pesticide-free cleaning supplies will be used.

On August 2, 2016 the Evanston P-Patch Neighborhood Watch will have a Night Out from 6pm to 10pm on 101st St. between Evanston and Fremont Ave.  There will be outreach activities to promote community efforts to improve safety and discussion on how that can be achieved.  There will be entertainment, food and beverages along with fun games for the children in the neighborhood.

On September 10th from Noon to 7pm, located at 6020 Beacon Ave S and South Spencer St. The Spencer St Steering Committee will host a community event that is free and open to all. The event  will revive the local Block watch, and raise awareness of the future Beacon Hill Hub. There will be food that reflects the diversity of the community along with dance and live music.

Eastlake P-Patch will host a summer solstice community celebration on Saturday, June 25, 4:00pm to 8:00 pm, at Eastlake P-Patch/Fairview Park. There will be music, food, garden tours, and activities for kids (including face-painting and slug races!).

The Circulo de Mamas Seattle will organize Latinos con Voz y Voto, in which candidates forums and voter registration events will be held in public locations to be determined in South Park.  All activities and materials will be non-partisan. The events will be held during the fall of 2016.

Project Title: Voices and Photos That Define Our Community
Project Description: The Voices of the Community will host an interactive display of historical photos from the Al Smith Sr. collection that document the lives of African Americans in Seattle throughout the 20th century.  The display will be presented at the ROOTS celebration on September 4, 2016 from 12pm- 5pm at Sam Smith Park located at 1400 MLK Jr. Way S.  Community members will explore the photos and their historical context. These activities will be documented by video that will be publicly archived.

Project Title: Night Out: 1st Ave W and McGraw Block Party
Project Description: The Neighborhood Night Out Planning Committee will host a Night Out Against Crime block party on 1st Ave W between W Smith St and W McGraw St on August 2, 2016 from 6 pm to 9 pm.  The event will unite neighbors to enjoy food, games, and live music together.  The event will be free and open to the public.

Project Title: Reviving Greater Madison Valley Community Council
Project Description: To support the recently elected slate of officers of the Greater Madison Valley Community Council (GMVCC), a consultant will be hired to amend the By-Laws, bringing them into compliance with IRS regulations for non-profits.  The project also includes the development of a new website and the initiation of a  `Get to Know Your Neighbors` campaign, through social media, mailings, and celebratory events.  The inaugural event is planned for the spring, once outreach efforts have garnered new members.

The Rainier Vista Year of Pride Organizing Committee and the Rainer Vista Vietnamese Seniors Group will host a Vietnamese New Year/Tet celebration on Saturday, February 4, 2017, from noon to 4:00pm. There will be food, music, and traditional decor. The event will be held in the Rainier Vista Snoqualmie Community Room (2917 South Snoqualmie Street), and will be free and open to the public.

Project Title: Parking Day: Bees to Salmon: Exploring Urban Rainwater
Organization Name: Friends of Capital Hill EcoDistrict Park(ing) Day
Project Description: The Bees to Salmon: Exploring Urban Rainwater Parking Day project will be on display at 1640 12th Avenue, September 16th and 17th from 10:00 am until 7:00 pm demonstrating how our cities manage urban rainwater. The parklet prototypes modular raingardens which are strategic water quality management tools for streetscapes, and will include interactive bicycle installations that clean stormwater.

Beginning on April 14, 2016 at Hillman City Collaboratory located at 5623 Rainier Ave S.  Food for Thought Meals will create a space for Rainier Valley Food Bank guests to share ideas about food bank services, learn about social supports, and discuss root causes of hunger in Seattle. Each meal will have a different cultural focus and a designated translator. The hope is that this can develop into a forum where community members can feel empowered to transform their ideas into action plans.

In order to facilitate a stronger, more connected Othello Neighborhood, the Chicago Street neighbors will celebrate the National Night Out on Tuesday, August 2nd, from 5-9pm with a family biking adventure through the neighborhood, followed by food and games for all ages.

The Lake City Clean & Safe Committee will organize a Spring Clean event on Saturday, April 30, 10:00a.m. to noon. Volunteer teams will fan out from three places in the Lake City core: the library, mini-park, and God's Lil Acre (homeless resource center). Clean-up supplies and refreshments will be provided. T-shirts will be given to those who express interest in a volunteer commitment to regular clean-ups in Lake City, and a schedule of future clean-ups will be provided.

Project Title: Parking Day - Capitol Hill Tea Party
Organization Name: Parking Day Capitol Hill Planning Committee
Project Description: The Parking Day Capitol Hill Planning Committee will participate in the City of Seattle's Parking Day by hosting a tea party-themed event with free food, beverages, costumes, and activities. The event will be held on E Pike St between Summit Ave and Belmont Ave.  It will held on September 16, 2016 from 10 am - 7 pm.

Project Title: Night Out - NW 56th St Block Party
Project Description: The Night Out Planning Committee will host a free Night Out event on NW 56th St between 24th Ave NW and 26th Ave NW on August 2, 2016 from 6 pm to 8 pm.  The event will bring neighbors together to enjoy food and live music together.

The Georgetown Events Club will organize and host the Georgetown Egg Hunt on March 27, 2016 from 12 pm to 2 pm at Oxbow Park located at 6430 Corson Ave S.  The event will be free and open to the public.  Entertainment, refreshments, and an egg hunt will be provided for free for community members to enjoy.

Family Bike Seattle will organize the West Seattle Disaster Relief Trials on September 25, 2016 from 11 am - 4 pm.  The event will consist of a bicycle riding course that will begin and end at Alki Beach Park located at 2732 Alki Ave SW.  Participants will ride to various locations around West Seattle to simulate and raise awareness of the vital role community bicyclists and cargo bikes can potentially play in the event of a disaster.

Organization Name: Friends of Maple Leaf P-Patch Community Garden
Project Description: The Friends of Maple Leaf P-Patch Community Garden will host a free Halloween event on October 28, 2016 from 6 pm -7:30 pm at the Northgate Community Center located at 10510 5th Ave NE.  Free pumpkin carving activities, treats, and small prizes will be offered.  The carved pumpkins will be transported to the nearby Maple Leaf P-Patch Community Garden located at 529 NE 103rd St where they will be on public display for several days.

COLA will plan and host a public event to celebrate dogs and their friendship to our families. We will have a doggy costume contest, a special performance by Caspar Babypants, Halloween activities for dogs and kids, and several vendor booths to highlight nonprofits and other canine friendly companies and resources. The event will take place on October 22, 2016 from 11 am to 4 pm at the Bell Street Park and Regrade Off Leash Area, 206 Bell Street.

Project Title: Seattle Neighborhood Night Out Lake City
Project Description: On August 2, 2016 the Friends of Lake City will have a Night Out from 6pm to 10 pm on 33rd St between 125th and 130th streets in the Lake City Neighborhood. There will be outreach activities to promote community efforts to improve safety and discussion on how that can be achieved. There will be entertainment, food and beverages along with fun games for the children in the neighborhood.

Project Title: Phinney Palatine Neighbors Night Out Block Party
Project Description: On August 2, 2016 from 6pm to 10pm on Palatine 3rd Ave N located between 72nd Ave and 73rd Ave there will be a Seattle Night Out Event. This project will bring neighbors together to encourage community engagement and security. The hope is to build better relationships with neighbors. There will be food, activities for children.

This fall Rainier Beach Community Club will hire a contractor to repair the back steps to the VFW building the club uses for community meetings and events (6038 S. Pilgrim St.). These are the steps people use to bring food and supplies into the building. Volunteers will do the tear out and additional cleanup around the building. The VFW makes the building available for free use by community groups such as RBCC and the Rainier Beach Emergency Communications Hub.

Project Title: Night Out: Jackson Place Hiawatha Arts Night Out
Project Description: The Hiawatha Dearborn Block Group will organize a Night Out Against Crime event featuring art, live music, food, and games on August 2, 2016 from 5 pm to 8 pm on Hiawatha Pl S between S Charles St and S Dearborn St.  The event will bring together neighbors and local businesses to celebrate the community, raise awareness about community safety, and enjoy art created by or performed by local community members.  The event will be free and open to the public.

Project Title: Night Out - Troll's Knoll Block Party
Project Description: On Seattle Night Out on August 2, 2016, the Friends of the Troll's Knoll group will host a neighborhood block party on the 3600 block of Winslow Pl N to build community and to generate interest and ideas from the community on how to maintain and enhance the one-acre overgrown right-of-way on the east side of the Fremont Troll.

Organization Name: Friends of Maple Leaf P-Patch Community Garden
Project Description: The Friends of Maple Leaf P-Patch will improve the communal composting area at the Maple Leaf P-Patch located at 529 NE 103rd Seattle.  The improvements will take place in late June 2016.  The public composting area will become more inviting and accessible.  The existing compost bins will be replaced with new functional bins.  A composting demonstration will be provided that will be free and open to the public.

Project Title: Night Out  - 68th Ave South Block Party
Project Description: On August 2, 2016 from 6pm to 10pm at 10740 68th Ave S there will a Neighborhood Night Out celebration. There has been a increase in crime in the community and families are uniting to discuss crime prevention activities. It is also a opportunity to meet with each other and celebrate our rich diversity. There will be games for the children, along with food and drinks.

Project Title: World Day of Remembrance Community Engagement
Project Description: The World Day of Remembrance Committee will organize a project to raise awareness about traffic fatalities and traffic violence.  The group will engage those impacted by the loss of family and friends as well as the general public.  A public event will be held at Seattle City Hall located at 600 4th Ave on November 17, 2016 from 12 pm - 1pm to recognize victims, share information and materials, and hand out silhouettes representing traffic fatalities in 2015 and 2016.

Organization Name: Parents for a Better Downtown Seattle
Project Description: Parents for a Better Downtown Seattle (PBDS) will recruit new members by hosting a table at the Downtown Residents Council's `Downtown 101` event on Wednesday, September 21, 2016, 5:00pm to 8:00pm, at the Palace Ballroom (2100 5th Ave). PBDS is a new community group that advocates for family-oriented infrastructure, policies, and initiatives in downtown Seattle, including schools, parks, playspaces, and affordable family-sized housing. The event is free and open to the public.

Project Title: Rainier Vista Night Out at Central Park
Project Description: On August 2, 2016 from 6pm to 10pm at 4410 29th Ave S. The Rainier Vista Neighborhood will host a Night Out Event that will bring over 300 neighbors together. There will be discussions about safety and crime prevention, the opportunity to socialize, enjoy food, music, entertainment and unite as a community.

Organization Name: World Kulturz dba Native Kulturz Group
Project Description: World Kulturz will organize a six-event series of dance workshops and performances featuring the Contra, Metis jig, Native Powwow and Coastal dance communities. Two workshops will offer interactive dance style teachings at XX Festival at Victor Steinbrueck ParkWHEN. Additional performances will be in the Indigenouz PlaceMakerz Powwow, Coastal Day, and Seafair Torchlight Parade unit during Seafair in August 2017. A public mini-dance-showcase will be held at Seattle Center in fall 2017.

In Phase III, the South Lake Union Community Council will complete final design of microparks along Westlake Avenue between Denny Way and Lake Union Park, finalize cost estimates, and apply for construction permits. The cost estimates will also explore the feasibility of expanding the project further south on Westlake Avenue from Denny Way to downtown.

Project Title: A Vision for First Hill Park - Phase 2
Project Description: In Phase 2, the First Hill Improvement Association will continue working with Site Workshop (consultant), Parks, and DoN to lead the community through final design and construction documentation for improvements to First Hill Park. This phase of work will build off of the approved Phase 1 concept plan.

La Sala will organize a community engagement and social change art project about the issue of women as a commodity in our culture. It will consist of free community art-making events held during the winter of 2016 at various locations throughout Seattle.  There will be a free art exhibition at Oxbow located at 6118 12th Ave S featuring the community-generated art.  The project will build community, engage creativity, create partnerships, and illuminate a diversity cultural perspectives.

Organization Name: Beacon Hill International School Playground Steering Committee
Project Description: The Beacon Hill International School Playground Steering Committee will oversee a community-led project to replace the outdated playground structure that was recently removed from the school play area due to safety concerns.

Project Title: Orca Playground Additions and Rain Garden Art and Signs
Project Description: Project Orca Playground will install additional play equipment and plants, art, and signs in the playground and rain garden at Orca K-8 School, 5215 46th Ave S. The new play equipment will benefit neighborhood children and families. Rain garden plantings and interpretive signs will provide environmental education for the community. Community input will be gathered at meetings and via flyers, posters, and social media.

Organization Name: Friends of Market to MOHAI Corridor
Project Description: Friends of Market to MOHAI Corridor will lead a community input process to develop design standards for a pedestrian corridor from the waterfront to Lake Union along Bell Street and Terry Avenue - the 'Market to MOHAI' corridor. Landscape architectural services will be used. Promenade elements for design will include a logo, sidewalk markers, pedestrian lighting, way-finding signs, and street furniture. This corridor will connect several neighborhoods and parks.

Project Title: Meadowbrook 45th Ave NE Traffic Calming Project
Project Description: The 45th Ave NE Neighborhood Safety Taskforce will hire a traffic engineering consultant to assist in leading a visioning process with the community. They will solicit input from neighborhood stakeholders about how best to address traffic and pedestrian safety concerns on 45th Ave NE. This roadway is a major pedestrian and bike route serving three public schools.

The Friends of Little Saigon will lead a community process to design and install decorative crosswalks at a key Little Saigon intersection:  S. Jackson Street and 12th Avenue S.  Friends of Little Saigon will work closely with SDOT on design, and most of the NMF funds will be used for SDOT installation of the decorative crosswalks, with some funds being used for outreach. Other funding will be used for design and artwork commission.

The Bego organization will organize the Little Ethiopia Festival on August 14, 2016 from 11 am to 6 pm.  It will take place on E Cherry St between 25th Ave and MLK Jr Way. This free event will celebrate Seattle's Ethiopian community through cultural music, song and dance. It will also celebrate the accomplishments of the Ethiopian business community in the Central District.

Project Title: Upgrading the Tigrean Community Center Kitchen
Project Description: This grant funding will be used to fix and upgrade an existing kitchen at the Tigrean Community Center. The project will bring the kitchen up to City's and County's health and safety codes.

Project Title: Concord Elementary Rain Gardens and Crosswalk
Project Description: Concord International Elementary PTA with the help of a landscape architect, will lead a community engagement process to update the conceptual design plan and prepare construction documents. Proposed improvements include the building of  rain and butterfly gardens and planting trees to create a safer entryway and improve community access to the playground.

Madrona PK-8, a Title I school in central Seattle, will replace its aging playground with an engaging play structure that will allow the grounds to be open to the public outside of school hours. The redesign will improve transitions, redo the landscaping, and accommodate the growing school. This grant will pay for design and construction documents.

This celebration on Saturday, March 11, 2017 from 9 am to 4 pm at The Brockey Center at South Seattle Community College, 6000 - 16th Avenue SW, will be held in recognition of International Women's Day. Through story-telling, facilitated conversations, collaborative art and  dance,  participants will realize they are part of a caring and vibrant community of women.  This celebration is free and open to the public.

Project Title: Volunteer Park Amphitheater Phase 2 Concept Design
Project Description: Phase II of the Volunteer Park Amphitheater Project will create the Concept Design for a new performance stage based on our Phase I feasibility study findings.

This project will fund the Youth Initiative portion of the Columbia City BeatWalk. The Youth Initiative recruits approximately 60 youth performers, provides them professional mentoring, and offers them venues at Columbia City businesses for live performance at five BeatWalks June through October.
This project will improve the crosswalks at the intersection of 7th Avenue and Westlake Avenue with a community driven, SDOT approved colorful design through the SDOT Community Crosswalks program.

Project Title: Lake City Fred Meyer Garden Design, Phase II
Organization Name: Friends of the Lake City Fred Meyer Garden Project
Project Description: In Phase II, Friends of the Lake City Fred Meyer Garden Project will develop schematic design and construction drawings based on the conceptual design derived from the community outreach in Phase I. A lease agreement with Fred Meyer will be developed. Friends of the Lake City Fred Meyer Garden Project will also continue work on fundraising, business outreach, artist engagement, materials donation, and a robust public engagement process during Phase II.

Project Title: JCC Mock Trial Team-`Liberty & Justice for All`
Project Description: The Jefferson Community Center Mock Trial Team will host events that serve as outreach to potential youth participants while providing the community with valuable accessible information about the judicial system, legal rights, and prominent legal issues. Activities will include: producing an educational video; attending competitions; hosting informative community events and a community celebration at the conclusion of the project.

Project Title: North 137th Street between Greenwood and Linden
Project Description: Team of N. 137th Street Residents will hire a traffic consultant to help identify issues and possible solutions to increase pedestrian safety and traffic calming on  N. 137th Street, between Greenwood and Linden Avenues. The project will also build and strengthen community bonds by creating opportunities to meet neighbors and work together for a common goal.  The project will include multiple meetings and events, as well as community outreach to all residents of the target area.

Tasveer will organize the South Asian International Documentary Festival on February 11 & 12, 2017 at the Northwest Film Forum located at 1515 12th Ave. This free festival will bring people together to engage with the artistic and activist work of the South Asian region. There will be documentaries, conversations, and art about issues relevant to the South Asian people.

The Wetmore Community Garden that is located on Wetmore Ave S and South Estelle St will transform a neglected quarter acre lot of a SDOT ROW into a space providing neighbors a safe, clean environment to gather, and grow food. The garden will increase food security in the area through education and volunteerism, encouraging community members to grow their own food. Produce will be donated to the Rainier Valley Food Bank that will serve individuals unable to directly participate in the garden.

The Art of Alzheimer's will organize a series of free arts-focused activities to reduce stigmas about people living with dementia in racially and socioeconomically diverse parts of Seattle. Approximately 36 sessions will be held between January and December 2017 at Southeast Seattle Senior Center located at 4655 S Holly St and various other locations throughout Seattle.  This project serves as a catalyst for more inclusion, increased empathy, and less fear.

Amigos de Seattle will organize a series of free family-oriented workshops about Guatemalan culture, history, and peoples. The eleven three-hour workshops will feature folkloric performances and cultural exchange. They will be held on Sundays from January 15 to March 26, 2017, at Concord International School, 723 S. Concord St. This project will unite members of the diverse Guatemalan community in the Seattle area along with people interested in experiencing Guatemalan cultural expression.
Develop 60% construction drawings for a new pocket park in the Olympic Hills neighborhood of Lake City.

Former and current Yesler Terrace residents will reunite to share their collective stories as Yesler Terrace undergoes a major transformation.  The project includes a reunion celebration on August 20,2016 at the Yesler Community Center, a series of community conversations capturing the history and relevancy of the Yesler Terrace community and creation of a scrapbook of stories and pictures.

Project Title: Safe Access: Street to Mt. Baker Park
Organization Name: Friends of Safe Access:  Street to Park
Project Description: `Friends of Safe Access: Street to Park` will conduct a community-driven design process that will create a conceptual plan for a safe and accessible west entry to Mt. Baker Park for all neighbors, families, and visitors.  We will hire a design firm to work with the community in preparing conceptual drawings for the replacement of the steep, hazardous, and slippery trail that currently exists.

This free film training program will empower filmmakers from underrepresented communities by providing free access to video equipment and training in film production. A series of classes will be offered to participants that will enhance both their personal expression and professional development. A showcase featuring the student films is planned for next spring.

Project Title: Queer Resurgence on Capitol Hill Poetry Festival
Project Description: Seattle Poetry Slam will host an all-ages three-day celebration of LGBTQ arts and community on January 22-24, 2017, at Capitol Hill venues. `The Queer Resurgence on Capitol Hill Poetry Festival` will include panel discussions, workshops, and a poetry slam competition. Seattle Poetry Slam will partner with organizations such as Seattle Spit, Gay City, Entre Hermanos, Peace for the Streets for Kids on the Streets, and the Orion Center. All events will be free and open to the public.

Project Title: Community Conversations for Casa Latina's Future
Project Description: Casa Latina will engage the community in a series of conversations to help determine how Casa Latina can best continue to serve Latino immigrants in the coming years. Working with a consultant, the group will organize a series of community stakeholder conversations during the spring of 2017.  They will be held at Casa Latina at 317 17th Ave S. A report will be developed from the conversations.  It will identify the priorities of the Latino immigrant community and ways to address these needs.

The Bergen Place Activation Committee will produce a free, summer, lunchtime concert series in Bergen Place Park, in the heart of Ballard's business district. By providing a weekly program of music and cultural performances, this event series will bring together the local community.

This project aims to build community through the artistic transformation of the utility boxes in the University District right of way. With the addition of art, the boxes will go from ordinary utility boxes that obstruct the sidewalk, to community assets that contribute to both placemaking and wayfinding value.

Project Title: Walk Away Festival (Safe Seattle Summer Sixteen )
Project Description: Walk Away Day on Saturday July 2nd, begins with a rally at Franklin High School, 3013 South Mt. Baker Boulevard at 11:00 am and concludes with a community festival at Genesee Park, 4316 S. Genesee Street from noon to 6:00 pm. Youth from all over the city will come together and make a public decision to walk away from drugs, violence and other negative behaviors. There will be speakers, food and entertainment. All events are free and open to the public.

Project Title: Jimi Hendrix Park Grand Opening Celebration
Organization Name: Friends of Jimi Hendrix Park Committee
Project Description: A day long community celebration  will be held during the summer of 2017 to showcase the  grand opening of Jimi Hendrix Park, located at 2400 S. Massachusetts Street. This free public event will include speakers, a musical concert, food trucks and activities for all ages.

Project Title: Eastlake P-Patch New Garden Edging and Pathways
Project Description: Eastlake P Patch will widen paths and replace deteriorating wooden garden infrastructure at the P Patch (2900 Fairview Ave E) in the fall of 2016 and spring of 2017. Work will be done by community volunteers under the guidance of volunteers donating their professional expertise in construction management. Improvements will be vetted with the garden community at three community meetings, as well as via email, phone, and posting of information and surveys at the garden.

The Magnolia Chamber of Commerce will lead a community-based commercial revitalization effort that is the first step to implementing the NMF funded vision statement for the Magnolia Village completed in 2015. It will include a retail assessment and complementary community outreach efforts.

The Columbia City Theater Group will organize activities that engage high school aged youth in social justice and the arts.  The group will create and publish a graphic novel to be distributed for free.  They will host a social justice workshop at Langston Hughes Performing Arts Institute located at 104 17th Ave S.  They will also create a play that will be performed at Seattle Repertory Theater located at 155 Mercer St on May 12 &13.  All activities will be free and open to the public.

A three day festival at Langston Hughes  Performing Arts Center, 104 17th Avenue South, will be held February 10-12th of 2017 in celebration of  Black History month. An opening reception from 6-9 on the 10th will be followed by two days of programming from noon until 9:00 pm.  Offerings include art, music, food, photography, quilting, vendors and informative presentations and discussions on the contributions of African Americans in the United States.

The Hillman City Collaboratory Parklet located  at 5623 Rainier Ave S is a community led effort that will design and build a parklet. The parklet will be a community open space that will help tell the ongoing story of the Hillman City community.

Project Title: Camp Long Mountain Fest and 75th Anniversary
Organization Name: Camp Long Mountain Fest Steering Committee
Project Description: The Camp Long Mountain Fest Steering Committee will host Camp Long Mountain Fest and 75th Anniversary on September 10, 2016 from 11 am - 5 pm at Camp Long located at 5200 35th Ave SW.  The free event will feature educational presentations, guided rock climbing activities, music, and food.  The event will promote rock climbing and mountaineering among a broad range of community members.  It will highlight the resources of Camp Long, which celebrates its 75th anniversary this year.

The Sisters of South Seattle will host the Let's Get Back to School event to excite and engage students as the school year begins.  The free event will feature food, games, school supply giveaways, and information about local resources including Seattle Public Library.  The event will be held at Brighton Playfield located at 6000 39th Ave S on September 24, 2016 from 5 pm - 8 pm.

Project Title: Rainier Beach Streatery at Jude's Old Town
Organization Name: Friends of a Rainier Beach Streatery at Jude's
Project Description: Friends of a Rainier Beach Streatery at Jude's will construct Rainier Beach's first streatery this fall in the public right-of-way in front of Jude's Old Town neighborhood bar. With a bicycle and edible garden theme, the streatery will be a point of pride and identification for the neighborhood and engage the bicycling community, especially riders along the Lake Washington loop. It will also serve as a hub for youth-focused community events.

The Friends of Highland Park Elementary will hire a designer to create construction drawings for the public playground area at Highland Park Elementary School located at 1012 SW Trenton St. It will be based on the existing conceptual site plan which was developed with a Small and Simple award.  Leadership development workshops will be organized to ensure that the project is inviting to the many cultures of the community. Project activities will take place between fall 2016 and summer 2017.

This project will have Intergenerational Communications Workshops that will enhance bonding between Somali teens and their mothers with the goal to strengthen relationships and foster community building in a supportive environment. Attendees of the workshops, will participate in a series of 4 workshops designed to explore relationships, promote opportunities to create positive interactions, facilitate communication skill building and peer mentoring.
This project consist of painting a crosswalk and utility box on Boren Ave and Howell St.  The crosswalk artwork will convey a story of learning, healing, and peacekeeping.

Project Title: John Hay Elementary School Design Process
Project Description: The John Hay Foundation will lead a community engagement process to design needed improvements to the public playground and public play field areas of John Hay Elementary School located at 201 Garfield St.  This project will include three public meetings and additional outreach efforts to gather community input.  Meetings and other outreach activities will take place primarily in the spring, fall, and winter of 2016. All project activities will be closely coordinated with Seattle Public Schools.

Project Title: Beacon Hill Survey RSJ Inclusion Project
Project Description: North Beacon Hill Council and partner organizations are developing an online survey to poll residents regarding: a) the proposal to double the Beacon Hill urban village size in the Seattle 2035 Comprehensive Plan Update, and b) the continued commitment to the 2010 Neighborhood Plan goals and c) other local issues.  This award will fund translation, distribution and associated events to reach the 44% foreign born population who are non-English or limited English speaking.

The Brighton Community Design Project at the Brighton Apartments in Southeast Seattle will lead residents, staff, board members, neighbors, and community partners through a dynamic process to imagine, design, and select a long-term capital improvement plan for the exterior, publicly accessible, community spaces on the property.

Project Title: Outreach, Planning and Design of Beacon Hill Hub
Project Description: Phase 1 of the Beacon Hill Hub Project includes outreach, community engagement and planning to solicit input that will guide final programming and  design of the Beacon Hill Hub building. The outreach plan includes four charrettes that will focus on developing a multiservice venue whose design and programming will be unique for people of color on South Beacon Hill.

The Somali Health Board will work with a Community-Based Participatory Research consultant to survey the Somali community in Seattle about health priorities and prepare a report with draft implementation plan. The goal is to produce a culturally appropriate mental health program. An MPH student will be hired to assist with the community research. Focus groups, community roundtables, and health forums will be held at the New Holly campus.

Maple Elementary located at 4925 Corson Avenue S. it is a public school located in the Beacon Hill neighborhood. The goal of this project is to improve and enhance the school playground. These improvements will provide more opportunities for play, physical activities, outdoor learning, and community building for the school and the surrounding neighborhoods.

Project Title: Made in Yesler: Open House and STE(A)M Fair
Project Description: This project is designed to expand and improve the ongoing activities of the BBSC. Big Brains will welcome and host at least 60 Yesler residents in the activity space and introduce at least 30 community members to a series of STE(A)M concepts and activities. In addition 10 Big Brains will facilitate these learning expeditions and/or show off their own projects, documenting through participation data, and  photos and videos.

Project Title: BF Day School Playground Improvements - Phase 2
Project Description: In Phase 2 of playground improvements, BF Day PTSA will replace aging circa-1989 play equipment at BF Day Elementary School (3921 Linden Ave. N.) with a new play area geared towards preschoolers and younger elementary students (K-2 grades) and neighborhood children. A grand opening is planned for September 2017.

This project begins phase III of the Volunteer Park Amphitheater Project. It will create a  preliminary schematic design for a new performance stage based on our phase I feasibility study and phase II concept designs.

Organization Name: Friends of the Ballard Civic Orchestra
Project Description: The Friends of Ballard Civic Orchestra will host a series of orchestral activities to celebrate Latino and Hispanic cultural heritage. It will consist of 32 rehearsals and 3 concerts held from January through December 2017. They will be held at the Sunset Hill Community Center at 3003 NW 66th St, Casa Latina at 317 17th Ave S and other locations in Seattle. There will be free instructional workshops for beginning musicians in neighborhoods with limited access to classical music experiences.

This project located at 2312 Gilman Drive W. will provide running water on site to the Gilman Gardens community garden. This will allow the community participants the opportunity to keep up with the watering necessary to keep plants healthy and to fully realize the potential of their garden plots, and the growing of their own food.

Project Title: Hillman City P-Patch Accessible Paths and Planning
Project Description: The Hillman City P-Patch garden community will  reclaim the accessible gravel paths and develop an accessible gardening area at the site.    The project  also includes an update to their 2010 visioning plan and the initiation of a monthly series of events designed to engage the gardeners, neighbors and partner organizations.

Project Title: Van Lang Vietnamese and English Language Workshops
Project Description: Van Lang will organize a series of free workshops for youth and adults to learn about various aspects of Vietnamese culture.  The workshops will also offer Vietnamese and English language instruction. They will be held at Chief Sealth International High School located at 2600 SW Thistle St during non-school hours.  They will take place during the spring and summer of 2017.

Project Title: Landscape Design for Fauntleroy Substation Park
Project Description: The Fauntleroy Watershed Council will lead a community design effort for the Former Fauntleroy Substation property located at 4520 SW Brace Point Drive. A designer will create a preliminary concept plan for the site based on community input.  Community engagement and design activities will take place in the fall of 2016.  All project activities will be coordinated with property owner Seattle City Light.

Multimedia Resources Training Institute (MMRTI) will organize a series of free youth workshops on photography and photojournalism during the winter of 2016.  They will be held at 2301 S. Jackson St.  Youth participants will explore the identity of the Central District.  They will work with instructors to create a one hour documentary and a collection of portraits.  There will be three public events to showcase the film and portraits to be held in the Central District in the spring of 2017.

Project Title: STEM Technology, Video and Computer Camp
Project Description: A total of 60 youth will attend a Science Technology Engineering and Math summer camp where they will have two opportunities to enhance their video skills. They will learn the technical design process all programmers use to create video games. They will also assist in creating, writing and producing a basic video that will be viewed in a public venue upon completion.  The camp will be offered on July 11-15, July 18-22, July 25-29 and August 1-5 at Garfield High School, 400 23rd Avenue.

The Mount Baker Hub Business Association will produce a business district design festival event, with tactical urbanism installations, that work to promote the Mount Baker Hub business district and develop a sense of community and place around the Mount Baker Light Rail Station.

The Freeway Park Association (FPA) will hire a landscape architect and engage the community in a conversation about how connectivity, visibility and public safety at Freeway Park can be improved. Three community meetings will be held for downtown and First Hill residents and other park stakeholders that will result in conceptual design recommendations for future use by the City and FPA.

Organization Name: Skate Like A Girl and Youth Employment Skateboarding (YES)
Project Description: Skate Like a Girl will do a six-month project to recruit, train, and post ten adult volunteer stewards at skate parks throughout Seattle, including Hubbard Homestead, Ballard, Lower Woodland, Seattle Center, Jefferson, Judkins, Roxhill, and Delridge, during the summer of 2016. An orientation will connect stewards-in-training with Youth Employment Skateboarding (YES) teen volunteer skateboarders. A community celebration recognizing their service will be held in the fall.
Revitalize and beautify Japantown's Nihonmachi Alley with public art, lighting, and programming opportunities.

Project Title: Detective Cookie Chess Park - Planning and Design
Organization Name: Friends of Detective Cookie Chess Park
Project Description: This project located at the SW corner of Rainier Ave S and 51st Ave S is to plan and design an outdoor chess park, as a multi-functional community space. The space would honor the work and influence of Detective Denis `Cookie` Bouldin's decade-old chess club and its positive impact on the youth of South Seattle.

The Fauntleroy Centennial Committee will be hosting a community event, `A Century of Serving the Community`, at the historic Fauntleroy Schoolhouse. The one day event will be free and open to the public it will include various activities for the community to participate. Archives will be displayed, a new flagpole will be erected, and there will be a mini carnival.

Friends of Ballard Parklet will build the first public parklet in the Ballard neighborhood for all to enjoy. Our intent is to design, build & raise funds for the parklet with community and public support, including working with the Seattle Parks Foundation, Sustainable Ballard and other Ballard neighborhood organizations.

Project Title: Duwamish Waterway Park Improvements Phase II
Project Description: In Phase II, the South Park Area Redevelopment Committee (SPARC) will prepare construction documents and permits for Duwamish Waterway Park improvements. SPARC will continue to work with ELM Environments to facilitate a community engagement and design process.

Lake City Future First will organize a series of nine monthly Community Conversations as a pilot through the end of 2016 with the help of a Neighborhood Engagement Consultant. The conversations will be held at various Lake City venues in partnership with other organizations. Dedicated local outreach will be happen frequently by Lake City Future First to reach existing and new partners, especially under-represented voices.

The Delridge Grocery Coop (DGC) is in the planning & feasibility stage of opening a grocery coop in Delridge. This project will complete a market study to ascertain if there is a suitable market to sustain a grocery coop and to study if our business plan is viable for opening of the store.

This free family friendly event will raise awareness of the importance of early detection in the fight against breast cancer, especially among women of color.   The two day event, October 22nd and 23rd at Franklin High School, 3013 South Mount Baker Boulevard, includes a basketball tournament showcasing breast cancer survivors, interactive displays, presentations by health care professionals, food, and music.

The U District Advocates will organize the purchase and installation of bicycle corrals and counters for public use in the alleyway between University Way NE, 15th Ave NE, NE 42nd St, and NE 43rd St.  These improvements will increase the accessibility, safety, and functionality of this alleyway for the public.  Installation will take place in the spring of 2017.  A public celebration will be held in May to mark the project's completion.

Path With Art will bring Pioneer Square community members from across the socioeconomic spectrum, including those experiencing homelessness, together to create poetry and visual art. Public art making activities will begin in the spring of 2016 and proceed through the end of the year. The art will be publicly presented through a temporary summer installation in Occidental Park, a free exhibit at the New Foundation, and a free musical performance at Benaroya Hall.

The Neighborhood Exchange is a series of events that share the impact of community coalitions shaping Seattle through community-based design projects. The series will connect community members throughout Seattle to each other and to community advocates from design professions.

The Hillman City Restorative Justice Committee will organize 12 free monthly workshops about Restorative Justice.  Consultants and a youth steering committee will guide the workshop series.  They will be held at the Hillman City Collaboratory located at 5623 Rainier Ave S.  Neighbors, businesses, and youth will learn Restorative Justice practices that will help them resolve conflict and strengthen community relationships.

Project Title: First Place Scholars Facility Improvement Project
Project Description: The Friends of First Place Scholars will make facility improvements and plan for more complex future repairs at the First Place School located at 172 20th Ave.  Facility improvements include roof repairs, addressing water leaks, replacing a water boiler device, restroom repairs, electrical work, and landscaping. Facility planning includes planning for HVAC airflow repairs and electrical needs.

Project Title: Mini Mart City Park Facility Construction
Project Description: Mini Mart City Park will renovate a former gas station in Georgetown into a pocket park, an arts center, and community gathering space. They will hire a general contractor via competitive bid with construction anticipated Nov. 2016 - Sept. 2017 and grand opening in Oct. 2017. They will host community meetings to provide project updates and develop programming once built. MMCP is committed to providing free public events and programs as part of programming for at least 5 years.

Project Title: Digital Storytelling in the International District
Project Description: This project will engage residents of Seattle's Chinatown International District in digital storytelling through classes that teach English language and digital literacy skills in a community-based setting. Participants will tell their personal immigration stories through digital media. A community celebration is also planned.

Project Title: East Howe Steps Plaza - Phase 1 Construction
Project Description:
This project will create a public open space plaza in existing street ROW, now used for private parking, and complete an important pedestrian corridor. 
The grant will fund completion of  construction documents, permits, and Phase 1 construction of  plaza.

A professional studio will be built and equipped and  serve as a digital communications hub for SE Seattle and beyond. The finished space will include a broadcast studio, community production space, classroom for training, offices for volunteers and staff, engineer room and break-room.

The Ubunya (Unity) Project will enable arts organizations in the Central District  to have free access to historic Washington Hall  to produce up to 8 free public events. An open  selection process will be used to identify  groups who's mission serves primarily people of color  who otherwise would not be able to afford to rent Washington Hall.

Project Title: Phase II Construction of the Beacon Food Forest
Project Description: The Beacon Food Forest produces food for the neighborhood, provides educational programming and hosts gatherings and events.   This  Phase II expansion includes outdoor educational space, additional P Patch beds, compost bins, a tool shed and fruit tree guilds.  When completed it will double the capacity of the site.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Community Conversations for Casa Latina's Future
Project Description: Casa Latina will engage the community in a series of conversations to help determine how Casa Latina can best continue to serve Latino immigrants in the coming years. Working with a consultant, the group will organize a series of community stakeholder conversations during the spring of 2017.  They will be held at Casa Latina at 317 17th Ave S. A report will be developed from the conversations.  It will identify the priorities of the Latino immigrant community and ways to address these needs.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Lake City Future First will organize a series of nine monthly Community Conversations as a pilot through the end of 2016 with the help of a Neighborhood Engagement Consultant. The conversations will be held at various Lake City venues in partnership with other organizations. Dedicated local outreach will be happen frequently by Lake City Future First to reach existing and new partners, especially under-represented voices.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Hillman City Restorative Justice Committee will organize 12 free monthly workshops about Restorative Justice.  Consultants and a youth steering committee will guide the workshop series.  They will be held at the Hillman City Collaboratory located at 5623 Rainier Ave S.  Neighbors, businesses, and youth will learn Restorative Justice practices that will help them resolve conflict and strengthen community relationships.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Concord Elementary Rain Gardens and Crosswalk
Project Description: Concord International Elementary PTA with the help of a landscape architect, will lead a community engagement process to update the conceptual design plan and prepare construction documents. Proposed improvements include the building of  rain and butterfly gardens and planting trees to create a safer entryway and improve community access to the playground.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This celebration on Saturday, March 11, 2017 from 9 am to 4 pm at The Brockey Center at South Seattle Community College, 6000 - 16th Avenue SW, will be held in recognition of International Women's Day. Through story-telling, facilitated conversations, collaborative art and  dance,  participants will realize they are part of a caring and vibrant community of women.  This celebration is free and open to the public.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: A three day festival at Langston Hughes  Performing Arts Center, 104 17th Avenue South, will be held February 10-12th of 2017 in celebration of  Black History month. An opening reception from 6-9 on the 10th will be followed by two days of programming from noon until 9:00 pm.  Offerings include art, music, food, photography, quilting, vendors and informative presentations and discussions on the contributions of African Americans in the United States.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Outreach, Planning and Design of Beacon Hill Hub
Project Description: Phase 1 of the Beacon Hill Hub Project includes outreach, community engagement and planning to solicit input that will guide final programming and  design of the Beacon Hill Hub building. The outreach plan includes four charrettes that will focus on developing a multiservice venue whose design and programming will be unique for people of color on South Beacon Hill.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Columbia City Theater Group will organize activities that engage high school aged youth in social justice and the arts.  The group will create and publish a graphic novel to be distributed for free.  They will host a social justice workshop at Langston Hughes Performing Arts Institute located at 104 17th Ave S.  They will also create a play that will be performed at Seattle Repertory Theater located at 155 Mercer St on May 12 &13.  All activities will be free and open to the public.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Eastlake P-Patch New Garden Edging and Pathways
Project Description: Eastlake P Patch will widen paths and replace deteriorating wooden garden infrastructure at the P Patch (2900 Fairview Ave E) in the fall of 2016 and spring of 2017. Work will be done by community volunteers under the guidance of volunteers donating their professional expertise in construction management. Improvements will be vetted with the garden community at three community meetings, as well as via email, phone, and posting of information and surveys at the garden.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Develop 60% construction drawings for a new pocket park in the Olympic Hills neighborhood of Lake City.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Skate Like A Girl and Youth Employment Skateboarding (YES)
Project Description: Skate Like a Girl will do a six-month project to recruit, train, and post ten adult volunteer stewards at skate parks throughout Seattle, including Hubbard Homestead, Ballard, Lower Woodland, Seattle Center, Jefferson, Judkins, Roxhill, and Delridge, during the summer of 2016. An orientation will connect stewards-in-training with Youth Employment Skateboarding (YES) teen volunteer skateboarders. A community celebration recognizing their service will be held in the fall.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Neighborhood Exchange is a series of events that share the impact of community coalitions shaping Seattle through community-based design projects. The series will connect community members throughout Seattle to each other and to community advocates from design professions.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Brighton Community Design Project at the Brighton Apartments in Southeast Seattle will lead residents, staff, board members, neighbors, and community partners through a dynamic process to imagine, design, and select a long-term capital improvement plan for the exterior, publicly accessible, community spaces on the property.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Bergen Place Activation Committee will produce a free, summer, lunchtime concert series in Bergen Place Park, in the heart of Ballard's business district. By providing a weekly program of music and cultural performances, this event series will bring together the local community.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Mount Baker Hub Business Association will produce a business district design festival event, with tactical urbanism installations, that work to promote the Mount Baker Hub business district and develop a sense of community and place around the Mount Baker Light Rail Station.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Orca Playground Additions and Rain Garden Art and Signs
Project Description: Project Orca Playground will install additional play equipment and plants, art, and signs in the playground and rain garden at Orca K-8 School, 5215 46th Ave S. The new play equipment will benefit neighborhood children and families. Rain garden plantings and interpretive signs will provide environmental education for the community. Community input will be gathered at meetings and via flyers, posters, and social media.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Duwamish Waterway Park Improvements Phase II
Project Description: In Phase II, the South Park Area Redevelopment Committee (SPARC) will prepare construction documents and permits for Duwamish Waterway Park improvements. SPARC will continue to work with ELM Environments to facilitate a community engagement and design process.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This project will fund the Youth Initiative portion of the Columbia City BeatWalk. The Youth Initiative recruits approximately 60 youth performers, provides them professional mentoring, and offers them venues at Columbia City businesses for live performance at five BeatWalks June through October.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This project aims to build community through the artistic transformation of the utility boxes in the University District right of way. With the addition of art, the boxes will go from ordinary utility boxes that obstruct the sidewalk, to community assets that contribute to both placemaking and wayfinding value.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Jimi Hendrix Park Grand Opening Celebration
Organization Name: Friends of Jimi Hendrix Park Committee
Project Description: A day long community celebration  will be held during the summer of 2017 to showcase the  grand opening of Jimi Hendrix Park, located at 2400 S. Massachusetts Street. This free public event will include speakers, a musical concert, food trucks and activities for all ages.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Van Lang Vietnamese and English Language Workshops
Project Description: Van Lang will organize a series of free workshops for youth and adults to learn about various aspects of Vietnamese culture.
