The workshops will also offer Vietnamese and English language instruction. They will be held at Chief Sealth International High School located at 2600 SW Thistle St during non-school hours.  They will take place during the spring and summer of 2017.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Friends of Market to MOHAI Corridor
Project Description: Friends of Market to MOHAI Corridor will lead a community input process to develop design standards for a pedestrian corridor from the waterfront to Lake Union along Bell Street and Terry Avenue - the 'Market to MOHAI' corridor. Landscape architectural services will be used. Promenade elements for design will include a logo, sidewalk markers, pedestrian lighting, way-finding signs, and street furniture. This corridor will connect several neighborhoods and parks.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Wetmore Community Garden that is located on Wetmore Ave S and South Estelle St will transform a neglected quarter acre lot of a SDOT ROW into a space providing neighbors a safe, clean environment to gather, and grow food. The garden will increase food security in the area through education and volunteerism, encouraging community members to grow their own food. Produce will be donated to the Rainier Valley Food Bank that will serve individuals unable to directly participate in the garden.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: World Kulturz dba Native Kulturz Group
Project Description: World Kulturz will organize a six-event series of dance workshops and performances featuring the Contra, Metis jig, Native Powwow and Coastal dance communities. Two workshops will offer interactive dance style teachings at XX Festival at Victor Steinbrueck ParkWHEN. Additional performances will be in the Indigenouz PlaceMakerz Powwow, Coastal Day, and Seafair Torchlight Parade unit during Seafair in August 2017. A public mini-dance-showcase will be held at Seattle Center in fall 2017.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Circulo de Mamas Seattle will organize Latinos con Voz y Voto, in which candidates forums and voter registration events will be held in public locations to be determined in South Park.  All activities and materials will be non-partisan. The events will be held during the fall of 2016.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Former and current Yesler Terrace residents will reunite to share their collective stories as Yesler Terrace undergoes a major transformation.  The project includes a reunion celebration on August 20,2016 at the Yesler Community Center, a series of community conversations capturing the history and relevancy of the Yesler Terrace community and creation of a scrapbook of stories and pictures.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Friends of the Ballard Civic Orchestra
Project Description: The Friends of Ballard Civic Orchestra will host a series of orchestral activities to celebrate Latino and Hispanic cultural heritage. It will consist of 32 rehearsals and 3 concerts held from January through December 2017. They will be held at the Sunset Hill Community Center at 3003 NW 66th St, Casa Latina at 317 17th Ave S and other locations in Seattle. There will be free instructional workshops for beginning musicians in neighborhoods with limited access to classical music experiences.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Queer Resurgence on Capitol Hill Poetry Festival
Project Description: Seattle Poetry Slam will host an all-ages three-day celebration of LGBTQ arts and community on January 22-24, 2017, at Capitol Hill venues. `The Queer Resurgence on Capitol Hill Poetry Festival` will include panel discussions, workshops, and a poetry slam competition. Seattle Poetry Slam will partner with organizations such as Seattle Spit, Gay City, Entre Hermanos, Peace for the Streets for Kids on the Streets, and the Orion Center. All events will be free and open to the public.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Landscape Design for Fauntleroy Substation Park
Project Description: The Fauntleroy Watershed Council will lead a community design effort for the Former Fauntleroy Substation property located at 4520 SW Brace Point Drive. A designer will create a preliminary concept plan for the site based on community input.  Community engagement and design activities will take place in the fall of 2016.  All project activities will be coordinated with property owner Seattle City Light.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: BF Day School Playground Improvements - Phase 2
Project Description: In Phase 2 of playground improvements, BF Day PTSA will replace aging circa-1989 play equipment at BF Day Elementary School (3921 Linden Ave. N.) with a new play area geared towards preschoolers and younger elementary students (K-2 grades) and neighborhood children. A grand opening is planned for September 2017.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Lake City Fred Meyer Garden Design, Phase II
Organization Name: Friends of the Lake City Fred Meyer Garden Project
Project Description: In Phase II, Friends of the Lake City Fred Meyer Garden Project will develop schematic design and construction drawings based on the conceptual design derived from the community outreach in Phase I. A lease agreement with Fred Meyer will be developed. Friends of the Lake City Fred Meyer Garden Project will also continue work on fundraising, business outreach, artist engagement, materials donation, and a robust public engagement process during Phase II.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This project will improve the crosswalks at the intersection of 7th Avenue and Westlake Avenue with a community driven, SDOT approved colorful design through the SDOT Community Crosswalks program.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Rainier Beach Streatery at Jude's Old Town
Organization Name: Friends of a Rainier Beach Streatery at Jude's
Project Description: Friends of a Rainier Beach Streatery at Jude's will construct Rainier Beach's first streatery this fall in the public right-of-way in front of Jude's Old Town neighborhood bar. With a bicycle and edible garden theme, the streatery will be a point of pride and identification for the neighborhood and engage the bicycling community, especially riders along the Lake Washington loop. It will also serve as a hub for youth-focused community events.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This project begins phase III of the Volunteer Park Amphitheater Project. It will create a  preliminary schematic design for a new performance stage based on our phase I feasibility study and phase II concept designs.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: La Sala will organize a community engagement and social change art project about the issue of women as a commodity in our culture. It will consist of free community art-making events held during the winter of 2016 at various locations throughout Seattle.  There will be a free art exhibition at Oxbow located at 6118 12th Ave S featuring the community-generated art.  The project will build community, engage creativity, create partnerships, and illuminate a diversity cultural perspectives.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Magnolia Chamber of Commerce will lead a community-based commercial revitalization effort that is the first step to implementing the NMF funded vision statement for the Magnolia Village completed in 2015. It will include a retail assessment and complementary community outreach efforts.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Hillman City Collaboratory Parklet located  at 5623 Rainier Ave S is a community led effort that will design and build a parklet. The parklet will be a community open space that will help tell the ongoing story of the Hillman City community.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Friends of Ballard Parklet will build the first public parklet in the Ballard neighborhood for all to enjoy. Our intent is to design, build & raise funds for the parklet with community and public support, including working with the Seattle Parks Foundation, Sustainable Ballard and other Ballard neighborhood organizations.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Fauntleroy Centennial Committee will be hosting a community event, `A Century of Serving the Community`, at the historic Fauntleroy Schoolhouse. The one day event will be free and open to the public it will include various activities for the community to participate. Archives will be displayed, a new flagpole will be erected, and there will be a mini carnival.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: North 137th Street between Greenwood and Linden
Project Description: Team of N. 137th Street Residents will hire a traffic consultant to help identify issues and possible solutions to increase pedestrian safety and traffic calming on  N. 137th Street, between Greenwood and Linden Avenues. The project will also build and strengthen community bonds by creating opportunities to meet neighbors and work together for a common goal.  The project will include multiple meetings and events, as well as community outreach to all residents of the target area.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Somali Health Board will work with a Community-Based Participatory Research consultant to survey the Somali community in Seattle about health priorities and prepare a report with draft implementation plan. The goal is to produce a culturally appropriate mental health program. An MPH student will be hired to assist with the community research. Focus groups, community roundtables, and health forums will be held at the New Holly campus.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: JCC Mock Trial Team-`Liberty & Justice for All`
Project Description: The Jefferson Community Center Mock Trial Team will host events that serve as outreach to potential youth participants while providing the community with valuable accessible information about the judicial system, legal rights, and prominent legal issues. Activities will include: producing an educational video; attending competitions; hosting informative community events and a community celebration at the conclusion of the project.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Revitalize and beautify Japantown's Nihonmachi Alley with public art, lighting, and programming opportunities.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The U District Advocates will organize the purchase and installation of bicycle corrals and counters for public use in the alleyway between University Way NE, 15th Ave NE, NE 42nd St, and NE 43rd St.  These improvements will increase the accessibility, safety, and functionality of this alleyway for the public.  Installation will take place in the spring of 2017.  A public celebration will be held in May to mark the project's completion.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Camp Long Mountain Fest and 75th Anniversary
Organization Name: Camp Long Mountain Fest Steering Committee
Project Description: The Camp Long Mountain Fest Steering Committee will host Camp Long Mountain Fest and 75th Anniversary on September 10, 2016 from 11 am - 5 pm at Camp Long located at 5200 35th Ave SW.  The free event will feature educational presentations, guided rock climbing activities, music, and food.  The event will promote rock climbing and mountaineering among a broad range of community members.  It will highlight the resources of Camp Long, which celebrates its 75th anniversary this year.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Roof replacements: Interbay P-Patch storage sheds
Project Description: The Interbay P- Patch community will work with their neighbors to replace the roofing on the tool and food bank structures.  These enhancements will give the garden an aesthetically consistent and secure look from the street.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This project located at 2312 Gilman Drive W. will provide running water on site to the Gilman Gardens community garden. This will allow the community participants the opportunity to keep up with the watering necessary to keep plants healthy and to fully realize the potential of their garden plots, and the growing of their own food.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This project will have Intergenerational Communications Workshops that will enhance bonding between Somali teens and their mothers with the goal to strengthen relationships and foster community building in a supportive environment. Attendees of the workshops, will participate in a series of 4 workshops designed to explore relationships, promote opportunities to create positive interactions, facilitate communication skill building and peer mentoring.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Bego organization will organize the Little Ethiopia Festival on August 14, 2016 from 11 am to 6 pm.  It will take place on E Cherry St between 25th Ave and MLK Jr Way. This free event will celebrate Seattle's Ethiopian community through cultural music, song and dance. It will also celebrate the accomplishments of the Ethiopian business community in the Central District.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Volunteer Park Amphitheater Phase 2 Concept Design
Project Description: Phase II of the Volunteer Park Amphitheater Project will create the Concept Design for a new performance stage based on our Phase I feasibility study findings.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This project consist of painting a crosswalk and utility box on Boren Ave and Howell St.  The crosswalk artwork will convey a story of learning, healing, and peacekeeping.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Meadowbrook 45th Ave NE Traffic Calming Project
Project Description: The 45th Ave NE Neighborhood Safety Taskforce will hire a traffic engineering consultant to assist in leading a visioning process with the community. They will solicit input from neighborhood stakeholders about how best to address traffic and pedestrian safety concerns on 45th Ave NE. This roadway is a major pedestrian and bike route serving three public schools.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This free film training program will empower filmmakers from underrepresented communities by providing free access to video equipment and training in film production. A series of classes will be offered to participants that will enhance both their personal expression and professional development. A showcase featuring the student films is planned for next spring.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Multimedia Resources Training Institute (MMRTI) will organize a series of free youth workshops on photography and photojournalism during the winter of 2016.  They will be held at 2301 S. Jackson St.  Youth participants will explore the identity of the Central District.  They will work with instructors to create a one hour documentary and a collection of portraits.  There will be three public events to showcase the film and portraits to be held in the Central District in the spring of 2017.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: This free family friendly event will raise awareness of the importance of early detection in the fight against breast cancer, especially among women of color.   The two day event, October 22nd and 23rd at Franklin High School, 3013 South Mount Baker Boulevard, includes a basketball tournament showcasing breast cancer survivors, interactive displays, presentations by health care professionals, food, and music.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Organization Name: Beacon Hill International School Playground Steering Committee
Project Description: The Beacon Hill International School Playground Steering Committee will oversee a community-led project to replace the outdated playground structure that was recently removed from the school play area due to safety concerns.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Safe Access: Street to Mt. Baker Park
Organization Name: Friends of Safe Access:  Street to Park
Project Description: `Friends of Safe Access: Street to Park` will conduct a community-driven design process that will create a conceptual plan for a safe and accessible west entry to Mt. Baker Park for all neighbors, families, and visitors.  We will hire a design firm to work with the community in preparing conceptual drawings for the replacement of the steep, hazardous, and slippery trail that currently exists.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Friends of Little Saigon will lead a community process to design and install decorative crosswalks at a key Little Saigon intersection:  S. Jackson Street and 12th Avenue S.  Friends of Little Saigon will work closely with SDOT on design, and most of the NMF funds will be used for SDOT installation of the decorative crosswalks, with some funds being used for outreach. Other funding will be used for design and artwork commission.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Tasveer will organize the South Asian International Documentary Festival on February 11 & 12, 2017 at the Northwest Film Forum located at 1515 12th Ave. This free festival will bring people together to engage with the artistic and activist work of the South Asian region. There will be documentaries, conversations, and art about issues relevant to the South Asian people.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Upgrading the Tigrean Community Center Kitchen
Project Description: This grant funding will be used to fix and upgrade an existing kitchen at the Tigrean Community Center. The project will bring the kitchen up to City's and County's health and safety codes.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Hillman City P-Patch Accessible Paths and Planning
Project Description: The Hillman City P-Patch garden community will  reclaim the accessible gravel paths and develop an accessible gardening area at the site.    The project  also includes an update to their 2010 visioning plan and the initiation of a monthly series of events designed to engage the gardeners, neighbors and partner organizations.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Sisters of South Seattle will host the Let's Get Back to School event to excite and engage students as the school year begins.  The free event will feature food, games, school supply giveaways, and information about local resources including Seattle Public Library.  The event will be held at Brighton Playfield located at 6000 39th Ave S on September 24, 2016 from 5 pm - 8 pm.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Walk Away Festival (Safe Seattle Summer Sixteen )
Project Description: Walk Away Day on Saturday July 2nd, begins with a rally at Franklin High School, 3013 South Mt. Baker Boulevard at 11:00 am and concludes with a community festival at Genesee Park, 4316 S. Genesee Street from noon to 6:00 pm. Youth from all over the city will come together and make a public decision to walk away from drugs, violence and other negative behaviors. There will be speakers, food and entertainment. All events are free and open to the public.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Freeway Park Association (FPA) will hire a landscape architect and engage the community in a conversation about how connectivity, visibility and public safety at Freeway Park can be improved. Three community meetings will be held for downtown and First Hill residents and other park stakeholders that will result in conceptual design recommendations for future use by the City and FPA.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Path With Art will bring Pioneer Square community members from across the socioeconomic spectrum, including those experiencing homelessness, together to create poetry and visual art. Public art making activities will begin in the spring of 2016 and proceed through the end of the year. The art will be publicly presented through a temporary summer installation in Occidental Park, a free exhibit at the New Foundation, and a free musical performance at Benaroya Hall.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: In Phase III, the South Lake Union Community Council will complete final design of microparks along Westlake Avenue between Denny Way and Lake Union Park, finalize cost estimates, and apply for construction permits. The cost estimates will also explore the feasibility of expanding the project further south on Westlake Avenue from Denny Way to downtown.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: John Hay Elementary School Design Process
Project Description: The John Hay Foundation will lead a community engagement process to design needed improvements to the public playground and public play field areas of John Hay Elementary School located at 201 Garfield St.  This project will include three public meetings and additional outreach efforts to gather community input.  Meetings and other outreach activities will take place primarily in the spring, fall, and winter of 2016. All project activities will be closely coordinated with Seattle Public Schools.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: STEM Technology, Video and Computer Camp
Project Description: A total of 60 youth will attend a Science Technology Engineering and Math summer camp where they will have two opportunities to enhance their video skills. They will learn the technical design process all programmers use to create video games. They will also assist in creating, writing and producing a basic video that will be viewed in a public venue upon completion.  The camp will be offered on July 11-15, July 18-22, July 25-29 and August 1-5 at Garfield High School, 400 23rd Avenue.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Art of Alzheimer's will organize a series of free arts-focused activities to reduce stigmas about people living with dementia in racially and socioeconomically diverse parts of Seattle. Approximately 36 sessions will be held between January and December 2017 at Southeast Seattle Senior Center located at 4655 S Holly St and various other locations throughout Seattle.  This project serves as a catalyst for more inclusion, increased empathy, and less fear.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Amigos de Seattle will organize a series of free family-oriented workshops about Guatemalan culture, history, and peoples. The eleven three-hour workshops will feature folkloric performances and cultural exchange. They will be held on Sundays from January 15 to March 26, 2017, at Concord International School, 723 S. Concord St. This project will unite members of the diverse Guatemalan community in the Seattle area along with people interested in experiencing Guatemalan cultural expression.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Detective Cookie Chess Park - Planning and Design
Organization Name: Friends of Detective Cookie Chess Park
Project Description: This project located at the SW corner of Rainier Ave S and 51st Ave S is to plan and design an outdoor chess park, as a multi-functional community space. The space would honor the work and influence of Detective Denis `Cookie` Bouldin's decade-old chess club and its positive impact on the youth of South Seattle.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Friends of Highland Park Elementary will hire a designer to create construction drawings for the public playground area at Highland Park Elementary School located at 1012 SW Trenton St. It will be based on the existing conceptual site plan which was developed with a Small and Simple award.  Leadership development workshops will be organized to ensure that the project is inviting to the many cultures of the community. Project activities will take place between fall 2016 and summer 2017.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Made in Yesler: Open House and STE(A)M Fair
Project Description: This project is designed to expand and improve the ongoing activities of the BBSC. Big Brains will welcome and host at least 60 Yesler residents in the activity space and introduce at least 30 community members to a series of STE(A)M concepts and activities. In addition 10 Big Brains will facilitate these learning expeditions and/or show off their own projects, documenting through participation data, and  photos and videos.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Madrona PK-8, a Title I school in central Seattle, will replace its aging playground with an engaging play structure that will allow the grounds to be open to the public outside of school hours. The redesign will improve transitions, redo the landscaping, and accommodate the growing school. This grant will pay for design and construction documents.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: Beacon Hill Survey RSJ Inclusion Project
Project Description: North Beacon Hill Council and partner organizations are developing an online survey to poll residents regarding: a) the proposal to double the Beacon Hill urban village size in the Seattle 2035 Comprehensive Plan Update, and b) the continued commitment to the 2010 Neighborhood Plan goals and c) other local issues.  This award will fund translation, distribution and associated events to reach the 44% foreign born population who are non-English or limited English speaking.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Title: A Vision for First Hill Park - Phase 2
Project Description: In Phase 2, the First Hill Improvement Association will continue working with Site Workshop (consultant), Parks, and DoN to lead the community through final design and construction documentation for improvements to First Hill Park. This phase of work will build off of the approved Phase 1 concept plan.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: The Delridge Grocery Coop (DGC) is in the planning & feasibility stage of opening a grocery coop in Delridge. This project will complete a market study to ascertain if there is a suitable market to sustain a grocery coop and to study if our business plan is viable for opening of the store.

Program Area: NMF Small and Simple Projects Fund
Project Description: Maple Elementary located at 4925 Corson Avenue S. it is a public school located in the Beacon Hill neighborhood. The goal of this project is to improve and enhance the school playground. These improvements will provide more opportunities for play, physical activities, outdoor learning, and community building for the school and the surrounding neighborhoods.
